Text

[HOWARDS END]1-howards end

By [E. M. Forster]253-e. m. forster

CHAPTER I

One may as well begin with [Helen]254-helen s letters to [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister .

" Howards End , "[546-her aunt]

" Tuesday . "[546-her aunt]

" [Dearest Meg]255-margaret , "[546-her aunt]

" It isn t going to be what [we]3784-we expected . [It]3785-it is old and little , and altogether delightful -- red brick . [We]3784-we can scarcely pack in as it is , and [the dear]3786-the dear knows what will happen when [Paul]256-paul ( [younger son]3787-younger son ) arrives to - morrow . From [hall]3788-hall [you]3789-you go right or left into [dining - room]3790-dining - room or [drawing - room]3791-drawing - room . [Hall]3788-hall [itself]3788-hall is practically [a room]3793-a room . [You]3789-you open another door in [it]3788-hall , and there are the stairs going up in a sort of tunnel to the first - floor . [Three bed - rooms in a row there]3794-three bed - rooms in a row there , and three attics in [a row above]3795-a row above . That isn t all [the house]3796-the house really , but it s all that [one]3797-one notices -- nine windows as [you]3789-you look up from [the front garden]3798-the front garden . "[546-her aunt]

" Then there s a very big wych - elm -- to the left as [you]3789-you look up -- leaning a little over [the house]3796-the house , and standing on the boundary between [the garden]3800-the garden and [meadow]3801-meadow . [I]546-her aunt quite love that tree already . Also ordinary elms , oaks -- no nastier than ordinary oaks -- pear - trees , apple - trees , and a vine . No silver birches , though . However , [I]546-her aunt must get on to [[my]546-her aunt host]3802-my host and [hostess]3803-hostess . [I]546-her aunt only wanted to show that it isn t the least what [we]3804-we expected . Why did [we]3804-we settle that [[their]3804-we house]3805-their house would be all gables and wiggles , and [[their]3804-we garden]3806-their garden all gamboge - coloured paths ? [I]546-her aunt believe simply because [we]3804-we associate [them]3804-we with [expensive hotels]3807-expensive hotels -- [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox trailing in beautiful dresses down [long corridors]3808-long corridors , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles bullying [porters]3809-porters , etc . [We]3804-we females are that unjust . "[546-her aunt]

" [I]546-her aunt shall be back Saturday ; will let [you]3810-you know train later . [They]3804-we are as angry as [I]546-her aunt am that [you]3810-you did not come too ; really [Tibby]259-tibby is too tiresome , [he]259-tibby starts a new mortal disease every month . How could [he]259-tibby have got hay fever in [London]2-london ? and even if [he]259-tibby could , it seems hard that [you]3810-you should give up a visit to hear [a schoolboy]3811-a schoolboy sneeze . Tell [him]259-tibby that [Charles Wilcox]258-charles ( [the son who is here]3812-the son who is here ) has hay fever too , but [he]258-charles s brave , and gets quite cross when [we]3804-we inquire after it . [Men like [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes]3813-men like the wilcoxes would do [Tibby]259-tibby a power of good . But [you]3810-you won t agree , and [I]546-her aunt d better change the subject . "[546-her aunt]

" This long letter is because [I]546-her aunt m writing before breakfast . Oh , the beautiful vine leaves ! [The house]3796-the house is covered with a vine . [I]546-her aunt looked out earlier , and [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox was already in [the garden]3800-the garden . [She]257-mrs. wilcox evidently loves it . No wonder [she]257-mrs. wilcox sometimes looks tired . [She]257-mrs. wilcox was watching the large red poppies come out . Then [she]257-mrs. wilcox walked off [the lawn]3816-the lawn to [the meadow]3817-the meadow , whose corner to the right [I]546-her aunt can just see . [Trail]261-trail , trail , went [her]257-mrs. wilcox long dress over the sopping grass , and [she]257-mrs. wilcox came back with [her]257-mrs. wilcox hands full of the hay that was cut yesterday -- [I]546-her aunt suppose for rabbits or something , as [she]257-mrs. wilcox kept on smelling it . The air here is delicious . Later on [I]546-her aunt heard the noise of croquet balls , and looked out again , and it was [Charles Wilcox]258-charles practising ; [they]3818-they are keen on all games . Presently [he]258-charles started sneezing and had to stop . Then [I]546-her aunt hear more clicketing , and it is [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles practising , and then , a - tissue , a - tissue : [he]258-charles has to stop too . Then [Evie]262-evie comes out , and does some calisthenic exercises on a machine that is tacked on to a green - gage - tree -- [they]3818-they put everything to use -- and then [she]262-evie says a - tissue , and in [she]262-evie goes . And finally [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox reappears , trail , trail , still smelling hay and looking at the flowers . [I]546-her aunt inflict all this on [you]3819-you because once [you]3819-you said that life is sometimes life and sometimes only a drama , and [one]3797-one must learn to distinguish tother from which , and up to now [I]546-her aunt have always put that down as [Meg]255-margaret s clever nonsense . But this morning , it really does seem not life but a play , and it did amuse [me]546-her aunt enormously to watch the W s. Now [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox has come in . "[546-her aunt]

" [I]546-her aunt am going to wear [ omission ] . Last night [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox wore an [ omission ] , and [Evie]262-evie [ omission ] . So it isn t exactly [a go - as - [you]3819-you - please place]3821-a go - as - you - please place , and if [you]3819-you shut [your]3819-you eyes it still seems [the wiggly hotel]3822-the wiggly hotel that [we]3823-we expected . Not if [you]3819-you open them . The dog - roses are too sweet . There is a great hedge of them over [the lawn]3816-the lawn -- magnificently tall , so that they fall down in garlands , and nice and thin at the bottom , so that [you]3819-you can see ducks through it and a cow . These belong to [the farm]3825-the farm , which is [the only house near [us]3823-we]3826-the only house near us . There goes the breakfast gong . Much love . [Modified]3827-modified love to [Tibby]259-tibby . Love to [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley ; how good of [her]263-aunt juley to come and keep [you]3819-you company , but what a bore . Burn this . Will write again Thursday . "[546-her aunt]

" [HELEN]254-helen . "[546-her aunt]

" [Howards End]1-howards end "[546-her aunt]

" Friday "[546-her aunt]

" Dearest [Meg]255-margaret , "[546-her aunt]

" [I]546-her aunt am having a glorious time . [I]546-her aunt like [them]3828-they all . [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox , if quieter than in [Germany]3-germany , is sweeter than ever , and [I]546-her aunt never saw anything like [her]257-mrs. wilcox steady unselfishness , and the best of it is that the others do not take advantage of [her]257-mrs. wilcox . [They]3828-they are [the very happiest , jolliest family that [you]3819-you can imagine]3829-the very happiest , jolliest family that you can imagine . [I]546-her aunt do really feel that [we]3830-we are making [friends]3831-friends . The fun of it is that [they]3828-they think [me]546-her aunt [a noodle]3832-a noodle , and say so -- at least , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles does -- and when that happens , and [one]3797-one doesn t mind , it s a pretty sure test , isn t it ? [He]258-charles says the most horrid things about [woman]3834-woman s suffrage so nicely , and when [I]546-her aunt said [I]546-her aunt believed in equality [he]258-charles just folded [his]258-charles arms and gave [me]546-her aunt such a setting down as [I]546-her aunt ve never had . [Meg]255-margaret , shall [we]3830-we ever learn to talk less ? [I]546-her aunt never felt so ashamed of [myself]546-her aunt in [my]546-her aunt life . [I]546-her aunt couldn t point to a time when [men]3835-men had been equal , nor even to a time when the wish to be equal had made [them]3835-men happier in other ways . [I]546-her aunt couldn t say a word . [I]546-her aunt had just picked up the notion that equality is good from some book -- probably from poetry , or [you]3836-you . Anyhow , it s been knocked into pieces , and , like [all people who are really strong]3837-all people who are really strong , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles did it without hurting [me]546-her aunt . On the other hand , [I]546-her aunt laugh at [them]3835-men for catching hay fever . [We]3830-we live like [fighting - cocks]3838-fighting - cocks , and [Charles]258-charles takes [us]3830-we out every day in [the motor]3839-the motor -- [a tomb with trees in [it]3840-a tomb with trees in it]3840-a tomb with trees in it , [a hermit s house]3841-a hermit s house , [a wonderful road]3842-a wonderful road that was made by [the Kings of [Mercia]4-mercia]3843-the kings of mercia -- tennis -- a cricket match -- bridge and at night [we]3830-we squeeze up in [this lovely house]3844-this lovely house . [The whole clan]3845-the whole clan s [here]3846-here now -- [it]3846-here s like [a rabbit warren]3847-a rabbit warren . [Evie]262-evie is [a dear]3848-a dear . [They]3835-men want [me]546-her aunt to stop over Sunday -- [I]546-her aunt suppose it won t matter if [I]546-her aunt do . Marvellous weather and the views marvellous -- views westward to [the high ground]3849-the high ground . Thank [you]3835-men for [your]3835-men letter . Burn this . "[546-her aunt]

" [Your]3835-men affectionate "[546-her aunt]

" [HELEN]254-helen . "[546-her aunt]

" [Howards End]3850-howards end , "[546-her aunt]

" Sunday . "[546-her aunt]

" Dearest , dearest [Meg,--I]3851-meg,--i do not know what [you]3835-men will say : [Paul]256-paul and [I]546-her aunt are in love -- [the younger son who only came [here Wednesday]3853-here wednesday]3852-the younger son who only came here wednesday . "[546-her aunt]

CHAPTER II

[Margaret]255-margaret glanced at [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister s note and pushed it over the breakfast - table to [[her]255-margaret aunt]546-her aunt . There was a moment s hush , and then the flood - gates opened .

" [I]255-margaret can tell [you]3835-men nothing , [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley . [I]255-margaret know no more than [you]3835-men do . [We]3854-we met -- [we]3854-we only met [the father]3855-the father and [mother abroad]3856-mother abroad last spring . [I]255-margaret know so little that [I]255-margaret didn t even know [[their]3857-their son]3858-their son s name . It s all so-- "[255-margaret] [She]255-margaret waved [her]255-margaret hand and laughed a little .

" In that case it is far too sudden . "[546-her aunt]

" Who knows , [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley , who knows ? "[255-margaret]

" But , [Margaret]255-margaret , [dear]3859-dear , [I]546-her aunt mean , [we]3854-we mustn t be unpractical now that [we]3854-we ve come to facts . It is too sudden , surely . "[546-her aunt]

" Who knows ! "[255-margaret]

" But , [Margaret]255-margaret , dear-- "[546-her aunt]

" [I]255-margaret ll go for [her]263-aunt juley other letters , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret . " No , [I]255-margaret won t , [I]255-margaret ll finish [my]255-margaret breakfast . In fact , [I]255-margaret haven t [them]3857-their . [We]3854-we met [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes on an awful expedition that [we]3854-we made from [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg to [Speyer]6-speyer . [Helen]254-helen and [I]255-margaret had got it into [our]3854-we heads that there was [a grand old cathedral at [Speyer]6-speyer]3860-a grand old cathedral at speyer -- [the Archbishop of [Speyer]6-speyer]3861-the archbishop of speyer was one of the seven electors -- [you]3862-you know-- [Speyer]6-speyer , [Maintz]7-maintz , and [Koln]8-koln . [Those three sees]3863-those three sees once commanded [the Rhine Valley]9-the rhine valley and got it the name of [Priest Street]10-priest street . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret still feel quite uneasy about this business , [Margaret]255-margaret . "[255-margaret]

" [The train]3864-the train crossed by [a bridge of boats]3865-a bridge of boats , and at first sight [it]3864-the train looked quite fine . But oh , in five minutes [we]3854-we had seen the whole thing . [The cathedral]3866-the cathedral had been ruined , absolutely ruined , by restoration ; not an inch left of [the original structure]3867-the original structure . [We]3854-we wasted a whole day , and came across [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes as [we]3854-we were eating [our]3854-we sandwiches in [the public gardens]3868-the public gardens . [They]260-the wilcoxes too , poor things , had been taken in -- [they]260-the wilcoxes were actually stopping at [Speyer]6-speyer -- and [they]260-the wilcoxes rather liked [Helen]254-helen s insisting that [they]260-the wilcoxes must fly with [us]3854-we to [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg . As a matter of fact , [they]260-the wilcoxes did come on next day . [We]3854-we all took some drives together . [They]260-the wilcoxes knew [us]3854-we well enough to ask [Helen]254-helen to come and see [them]260-the wilcoxes -- at least , [I]255-margaret was asked too , but [Tibby]259-tibby s illness prevented [me]255-margaret , so last Monday [she]547-she went alone . That s all . [You]3869-you know as much as [I]255-margaret do now . [It]3870-it s [a young man out of the unknown]3871-a young man out of the unknown . [She]547-she was to have come back Saturday , but put off till Monday , perhaps on account of -- [I]255-margaret don t know . "[255-margaret]

[She]547-she broke off , and listened to the sounds of a [London]2-london morning . [[Their]548-their house]3805-their house was in [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , and fairly quiet , for [a lofty promontory of [buildings]551-buildings]550-a lofty promontory of buildings separated [it]3805-their house from [the main thoroughfare]552-the main thoroughfare . [One]553-one had the sense of [a backwater]554-a backwater , or rather of [an estuary]555-an estuary , whose waters flowed in from [the invisible sea]556-the invisible sea , and ebbed into a profound silence while the waves without were still beating . Though [the promontory]557-the promontory consisted of [flats]558-flats -- expensive , with [cavernous entrance halls]559-cavernous entrance halls , full of [concierges]560-concierges and palms -- [it]557-the promontory fulfilled [its]557-the promontory purpose , and gained for [the older houses]561-the older houses opposite a certain measure of peace .

These , too , would be swept away in time , and [another promontory]562-another promontory would arise upon [[their]548-their site]563-their site , as humanity piled itself higher and higher on [the precious soil of [London]2-london]564-the precious soil of london .

[Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt had [her]264-mrs. munt own method of interpreting [[her]264-mrs. munt nieces]565-her nieces . [He]576-her brother was not so well .

The hay fever had worried [him]576-her brother a good deal all night . [His]576-her brother head ached , [his]576-her brother eyes were wet , [his]576-her brother mucous membrane , [he]576-her brother informed [her]255-margaret , in a most unsatisfactory condition . The only thing that made life worth living was the thought of [Walter Savage Landor]270-walter savage landor , from whose Imaginary Conversations [she]255-margaret had promised to read at frequent intervals during the day .

It was rather difficult . Something must be done about [Helen]254-helen . [She]254-helen must be assured that it is not a criminal offence to love at first sight . A telegram to this effect would be cold and cryptic , a personal visit seemed each moment more impossible . Now [the doctor]577-the doctor arrived , and said that [Tibby]259-tibby was quite bad . Might it really be best to accept [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley s kind offer , and to send [her]263-aunt juley down to [Howards End]1-howards end with a note ?

Certainly [Margaret]255-margaret was impulsive . [She]255-margaret did swing rapidly from one decision to another . "[255-margaret]

" [You]546-her aunt will remember , [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley , not to be drawn into discussing the engagement . " Because-- "[255-margaret] But it was no moment to expound the personal nature of love . Even [Margaret]255-margaret shrank from it , and contented [herself]255-margaret with stroking [[her]255-margaret good aunt]583-her good aunt s hand , and with meditating , half sensibly and half poetically , on the journey that was about to begin from [King s Cross]15-king s cross .

Like [many others who have lived long in [a great capital]585-a great capital]584-many others who have lived long in a great capital , [she]255-margaret had strong feelings about [the various railway termini]586-the various railway termini . [They]586-the various railway termini are [our]587-we gates to the glorious and the unknown . Through them [we]587-we pass out into adventure and sunshine , to [them]586-the various railway termini , alas ! [we]587-we return . In [Paddington]16-paddington all [Cornwall]17-cornwall is latent and [the remoter west]588-the remoter west ; down [the inclines of [Liverpool Street]18-liverpool street]589-the inclines of liverpool street lie fenlands and [the illimitable Broads]19-the illimitable broads ; [Scotland]20-scotland is through [the pylons of [Euston]21-euston]590-the pylons of euston ; [Wessex]22-wessex behind the poised chaos of [Waterloo]23-waterloo . [Italians]591-italians realise this , as is natural ; [those of [them]591-italians who are so unfortunate as to serve as [waiters in [Berlin]24-berlin]593-waiters in berlin]592-those of them who are so unfortunate as to serve as waiters in berlin call [the Anhalt Bahnhof]594-the anhalt bahnhof [the Stazione d Italia]595-the stazione d italia , because by it [they]592-those of them who are so unfortunate as to serve as waiters in berlin must return to [[their]592-those of them who are so unfortunate as to serve as waiters in berlin homes]596-their homes . And [he]597-he is [a chilly Londoner who does not endow [[his]597-he stations]599-his stations with some personality , and extend to [them]599-his stations , however shyly , the emotions of fear and love]598-a chilly londoner who does not endow his stations with some personality , and extend to them , however shyly , the emotions of fear and love .

To [Margaret]255-margaret -- [I]3-germany hope that it will not set [the reader]600-the reader against [her]255-margaret -- [the station of King s Cross]601-the station of king s cross had always suggested Infinity . Its very situation -- withdrawn a little behind the facile splendours of [St. Pancras]25-st. pancras -- implied a comment on the materialism of life . Those two great arches , colourless , indifferent , shouldering between [them]602-them an unlovely clock , were fit portals for some eternal adventure , whose issue might be prosperous , but would certainly not be expressed in the ordinary language of prosperity . If [you]603-you think this ridiculous , remember that it is not [Margaret]604-margaret who is telling [you]603-you about it ; and let [me]3-germany hasten to add that [they]602-them were in plenty of time for [the train]3864-the train ; that [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt , though [she]264-mrs. munt took a second - class ticket , was put by [the guard]606-the guard into a first ( only two " seconds "[608-the other babies] on [the train]3864-the train , one smoking and [the other babies]608-the other babies -- one can not be expected to travel with [babies]609-babies ) ; and that [Margaret]255-margaret , on [her]255-margaret return to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , was confronted with the following telegram :

" All over . Wish [I]255-margaret had never written . Tell [no one--]3899-no one-- , [HELEN]254-helen . "[255-margaret]

But [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley was gone -- gone irrevocably , and no power on [earth]610-earth could stop [her]263-aunt juley .

CHAPTER III

Most complacently did [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt rehearse [her]264-mrs. munt mission . [[Her]264-mrs. munt nieces]565-her nieces were [independent young women]612-independent young women , and it was not often that [she]264-mrs. munt was able to help [them]565-her nieces . [[Emily]613-emily s daughters]614-emily s daughters had never been quite like [other girls]615-other girls . [They]614-emily s daughters had been left motherless when [Tibby]259-tibby was born , when [Helen]254-helen was five and [Margaret]255-margaret [herself]255-margaret but thirteen . It was before the passing of [the Deceased Wife]616-the deceased wife s Sister Bill , so [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt could without impropriety offer to go and keep house at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . But [[her]264-mrs. munt brother - in - law]617-her brother - in - law , who was peculiar and [a German]618-a german , had referred the question to [Margaret]255-margaret , who with the crudity of youth had answered , " No , [they]3900-they could manage much better alone . "[255-margaret] Five years later [Mr. Schlegel]271-mr. schlegel had died too , and [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt had repeated [her]264-mrs. munt offer . [Margaret]255-margaret , crude no longer , had been grateful and extremely nice , but the substance of [her]255-margaret answer had been the same . " [I]264-mrs. munt must not interfere a third time , "[264-mrs. munt] thought [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt . However , of course [she]264-mrs. munt did . [She]264-mrs. munt learnt , to [her]264-mrs. munt horror , that [Margaret]255-margaret , now of age , was taking [her]255-margaret money out of the old safe investments and putting it into Foreign Things , which always smash . [Silence]272-silence would have been criminal . [Her]255-margaret own fortune was invested in [Home Rails]619-home rails , and most ardently did [she]255-margaret beg [[her]255-margaret niece]620-her niece to imitate [her]255-margaret . " Then [we]3901-we should be together , [dear]3859-dear . "[255-margaret] [Margaret]255-margaret , out of politeness , invested a few hundreds in [the Nottingham and Derby Railway]621-the nottingham and derby railway , and though the Foreign Things did admirably and the [Nottingham]27-nottingham and [Derby]28-derby declined with the steady dignity of which only [Home Rails]619-home rails are capable , [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt never ceased to rejoice , and to say , " [I]264-mrs. munt did manage that , at all events . When the smash comes [poor Margaret]255-margaret will have a nest - egg to fall back upon . "[264-mrs. munt] This year [Helen]254-helen came of age , and exactly the same thing happened in [Helen]254-helen s case ; [she]254-helen also would shift [her]254-helen money out of Consols , but [she]254-helen , too , almost without being pressed , consecrated a fraction of it to [the [Nottingham]27-nottingham and [Derby Railway]29-derby railway]621-the nottingham and derby railway . So far so good , but in social matters [[their]624-their aunt]625-their aunt had accomplished nothing . Sooner or later [the girls]626-the girls would enter on the process known as throwing [themselves]626-the girls away , and if [they]626-the girls had delayed hitherto , it was only that [they]626-the girls might throw [themselves]626-the girls more vehemently in the future . [They]626-the girls saw too many people at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place -- [unshaven musicians]627-unshaven musicians , [an actress]628-an actress even , [German cousins]629-german cousins ( one knows what [foreigners]630-foreigners are ) , [acquaintances]631-acquaintances picked up at [Continental hotels]632-continental hotels ( one knows what [they]632-continental hotels are too ) . It was interesting , and down at [Swanage]12-swanage [no one]633-no one appreciated culture more than [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt ; but it was dangerous , and disaster was bound to come . How right [she]264-mrs. munt was , and how lucky to be on the spot when the disaster came !

[The train]3864-the train sped northward , under [innumerable tunnels]635-innumerable tunnels . It was only an hour s journey , but [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt had to raise and lower the window again and again . [She]264-mrs. munt passed through [the South Welwyn Tunnel]636-the south welwyn tunnel , saw light for a moment , and entered [the North Welwyn Tunnel]30-the north welwyn tunnel , of tragic fame . [She]264-mrs. munt traversed [the immense viaduct , whose arches span untroubled meadows]637-the immense viaduct , whose arches span untroubled meadows and the dreamy flow of [Tewin Water]31-tewin water . [She]264-mrs. munt skirted [the parks of [politicians]639-politicians]638-the parks of politicians . At times [the Great North Road]640-the great north road accompanied [her]264-mrs. munt , more suggestive of infinity than [any railway]641-any railway , awakening , after a nap of a hundred years , to such life as is conferred by the stench of [motor - cars]642-motor - cars , and to such culture as is implied by the advertisements of antibilious pills . To history , to tragedy , to the past , to the future , [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt remained equally indifferent ; [hers]264-mrs. munt but to concentrate on the end of [her]264-mrs. munt journey , and to rescue poor [Helen]254-helen from this dreadful mess .

[The station for Howards End]643-the station for howards end was at [Hilton]32-hilton , [one of [the large villages that are strung so frequently along [the North Road]33-the north road]645-the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road , and that owe [their]645-the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road size to the traffic of coaching and pre - coaching days]644-one of the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road , and that owe their size to the traffic of coaching and pre - coaching days . Being near [London]2-london , [it]646-it had not shared in [the rural decay]647-the rural decay , and [[its]646-it long High Street]648-its long high street had budded out right and left into [residential estates]649-residential estates . For about a mile a series of [tiled and slated houses]650-tiled and slated houses passed before [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt s inattentive eyes , a series broken at one point by six Danish tumuli that stood shoulder to shoulder along the highroad , [tombs of [soldiers]652-soldiers]651-tombs of soldiers . Beyond [these tumuli]653-these tumuli , habitations thickened , and [the train]3864-the train came to a standstill in a tangle that was almost [a town]655-a town .

[The station]582-the station , like the scenery , like [Helen]254-helen s letters , struck an indeterminate note . Into which [country]657-country will it lead , [England]34-england or [Suburbia]35-suburbia ? [It]582-the station was new , [it]582-the station had [island platforms]658-island platforms and [a subway]659-a subway , and the superficial comfort exacted by [business men]660-business men . But [it]582-the station held hints of local life , personal intercourse , as even [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt was to discover .

" [I]264-mrs. munt want [a house]3903-a house , "[264-mrs. munt] [she]264-mrs. munt confided to [the ticket boy]661-the ticket boy . " [Its]3903-a house name is [Howards Lodge]36-howards lodge . Do [you]661-the ticket boy know where it is ? "[264-mrs. munt]

" [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles ! "[662-the boy] [the boy]662-the boy called .

[A young man]663-a young man in front of [them]664-them turned around .

" [She]264-mrs. munt s wanting [Howards End]1-howards end . "[264-mrs. munt]

There was nothing for it but to go forward , though [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt was too much agitated even to stare at [the stranger]665-the stranger . But remembering that there were [two brothers]666-two brothers , [she]264-mrs. munt had the sense to say to [him]663-a young man , " Excuse [me]264-mrs. munt asking , but are [you]663-a young man [the younger Mr. Wilcox]258-charles or [the elder]3904-the elder ? "[264-mrs. munt]

" [The younger]3905-the younger . Can [I]665-the stranger do anything for [you]663-a young man ? "[665-the stranger]

" Oh , [well"--she]3906-well"--she[264-mrs. munt] controlled [herself]264-mrs. munt with difficulty . " Really . Are [you]663-a young man ? [I--]264-mrs. munt "[264-mrs. munt] [She]264-mrs. munt moved ; away from [the ticket boy]661-the ticket boy and lowered [her]264-mrs. munt voice . CHAPTER IV

[Helen]254-helen and [[her]254-helen aunt]546-her aunt returned to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place in a state of collapse , and for a little time [Margaret]255-margaret had [three invalids on [her]255-margaret hands]738-three invalids on her hands . [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt soon recovered . [She]264-mrs. munt possessed to a remarkable degree the power of distorting the past , and before many days were over [she]264-mrs. munt had forgotten the part played by [her]264-mrs. munt own imprudence in the catastrophe . Even at the crisis [she]264-mrs. munt had cried , " Thank goodness , poor [Margaret]255-margaret is saved this ! "[264-mrs. munt] which during the journey to [London]2-london evolved into , " It had to be gone through by [some one]3973-some one , "[264-mrs. munt] which in its turn ripened into the permanent form of " The one time [I]264-mrs. munt really did help [[Emily]276-emily s girls]3974-emily s girls was over the Wilcox business . "[264-mrs. munt] But [Helen]254-helen was [a more serious patient]739-a more serious patient . New ideas had burst upon [her]254-helen like a thunderclap , and by them and by [their]740-their reverberations [she]254-helen had been stunned .

The truth was that [she]254-helen had fallen in love , not with [an individual]741-an individual , but with [a family]742-a family .

Before [Paul]256-paul arrived [she]254-helen had , as it were , been tuned up into [his]256-paul key . The energy of [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes had fascinated [her]254-helen , had created new images of beauty in [her]254-helen responsive mind . To be all day with [them]260-the wilcoxes in the open air , to sleep at night under [their]260-the wilcoxes roof , had seemed the supreme joy of life , and had led to that abandonment of personality that is a possible prelude to love . [She]254-helen had liked giving in to [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles , or [Evie]262-evie , or [Charles]258-charles ; [she]254-helen had liked being told that [her]254-helen notions of life were sheltered or academic ; that Equality was nonsense , Votes for [Women]743-women nonsense , Socialism nonsense , Art and Literature , except when conducive to strengthening the character , nonsense . One by one [the Schlegel fetiches]254-helen had been overthrown , and , though professing to defend [them]260-the wilcoxes , [she]254-helen had rejoiced . When [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles said that [one sound man of business]744-one sound man of business did more good to [the world]745-the world than [a dozen of [[your]747-your social reformers]748-your social reformers]746-a dozen of your social reformers , [she]254-helen had swallowed the curious assertion without a gasp , and had leant back luxuriously among the cushions of [[his]258-charles motorcar]749-his motorcar . When [Charles]258-charles said , " Why be so polite to [servants]3975-servants ? [they]3975-servants don t understand it , "[258-charles] [she]254-helen had not given the Schlegel retort of , " If [they]3975-servants don t understand it , [I]254-helen do . "[254-helen] No ; [she]254-helen had vowed to be less polite to [servants]3975-servants in the future . " [I]254-helen am swathed in ca nt , "[254-helen] [she]254-helen thought , " and it is good for [me]254-helen to be stripped of it . "[254-helen] And all that [she]254-helen thought or did or breathed was a quiet preparation for [Paul]256-paul . [Paul]256-paul was inevitable . [Charles]258-charles was taken up with [another girl]751-another girl , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles was so old , [Evie]262-evie so young , [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox so different . Round [the absent brother]752-the absent brother [she]254-helen began to throw the halo of Romance , to irradiate [him]752-the absent brother with all the splendour of those happy days , to feel that in [him]752-the absent brother [she]254-helen should draw nearest to the robust ideal . [He]752-the absent brother and [she]254-helen were about the same age , [Evie]262-evie said . [Most people]753-most people thought [Paul]256-paul handsomer than [[his]256-paul brother]754-his brother . [He]256-paul was certainly a better shot , though not so good at golf . And when [Paul]256-paul appeared , flushed with the triumph of getting through an examination , and ready to flirt with [any pretty girl]755-any pretty girl , [Helen]254-helen met [him]256-paul halfway , or more than halfway , and turned towards [him]256-paul on the Sunday evening .

[He]256-paul had been talking of [his]256-paul approaching exile in [Nigeria]37-nigeria , and [he]256-paul should have continued to talk of it , and allowed [[their]756-their guest]757-their guest to recover . But the heave of [her]757-their guest bosom flattered [him]256-paul . Passion was possible , and [he]256-paul became passionate . Deep down in [him]256-paul something whispered , " [This girl]3976-this girl would let [you]256-paul kiss [her]3976-this girl ; [you]256-paul might not have such a chance again . "[256-paul]

That was " how it happened , "[256-paul] or , rather , how [Helen]254-helen described it to [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister , using words even more unsympathetic than [my]3-germany own . But the poetry of that kiss , the wonder of it , the magic that there was in life for hours after it -- who can describe that ? It is so easy for [an Englishman]759-an englishman to sneer at these chance collisions of [human beings]760-human beings . To [the insular cynic]761-the insular cynic and [the insular moralist]762-the insular moralist [they]763-they offer an equal opportunity . It is so easy to talk of " passing emotion , "[761-the insular cynic] and to forget how vivid the emotion was ere it passed . [Our]764-we impulse to sneer , to forget , is at root a good one . [We]764-we recognise that emotion is not enough , and that [men]3835-men and [women]743-women are [personalities capable of sustained relations]767-personalities capable of sustained relations , not mere opportunities for an electrical discharge . Yet [we]764-we rate the impulse too highly . [We]764-we do not admit that by collisions of this trivial sort the doors of [heaven]768-heaven may be shaken open . To [Helen]254-helen , at all events , [her]254-helen life was to bring nothing more intense than the embrace of [this boy who played no part in it]769-this boy who played no part in it . [He]769-this boy who played no part in it had drawn [her]254-helen out of [the house]3796-the house , where there was danger of surprise and light ; [he]769-this boy who played no part in it had led [her]254-helen by a path [he]769-this boy who played no part in it knew , until [they]771-they stood under the column of [the vast wych - elm]772-the vast wych - elm . [A man in the darkness]773-a man in the darkness , [he]769-this boy who played no part in it had whispered " [I]769-this boy who played no part in it love [you]254-helen "[769-this boy who played no part in it] when [she]254-helen was desiring love . In time [his]769-this boy who played no part in it slender personality faded , the scene that [he]769-this boy who played no part in it had evoked endured . In all the variable years that followed [she]254-helen never saw the like of it again .

" [I]774-margaret-- understand , "[774-margaret--] said [Margaret--]774-margaret-- " at least , [I]774-margaret-- understand as much as ever is understood of these things . Tell [me]774-margaret-- now what happened on the Monday morning . "[774-margaret--]

" Somehow , when [that kind of man]3979-that kind of man looks frightened it is too awful . " No , [I]254-helen don t really think that . But [Paul]256-paul was so broad - shouldered ; all kinds of extraordinary things made it worse , and [I]254-helen knew that it would never do -- never . [I]254-helen said to [him]256-paul after breakfast , when [the others]3989-the others were practising strokes , [We]3990-we rather lost [our]3990-we heads , and [he]256-paul looked better at once , though frightfully ashamed . [He]256-paul began a speech about having no money to marry on , but it hurt [him]256-paul to make it , and [I]254-helen stopped [him]256-paul . Then [he]256-paul said , [I]254-helen must beg [your]254-helen pardon over this , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ; [I]254-helen can t think what came over [me]254-helen last night . And [I]254-helen said , Nor what over [me]254-helen ; never mind . And then [we]3990-we parted -- at least , until [I]254-helen remembered that [I]254-helen had written straight off to tell [you]254-helen the night before , and that frightened [him]256-paul again . [I]254-helen asked [him]256-paul to send a telegram for [me]254-helen , for [he]256-paul knew [you]254-helen would be coming or something ; and [he]256-paul tried to get hold of the motor , but [Charles]258-charles and [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles wanted it to go to [the station]582-the station ; and [Charles]258-charles offered to send the telegram for [me]254-helen , and then [I]254-helen had to say that the telegram was of no consequence , for [Paul]256-paul said [Charles]258-charles might read it , and though [I]254-helen wrote it out several times , [he]256-paul always said [people]3992-people would suspect something . [He]256-paul took it [himself]256-paul at last , pretending that [he]256-paul must walk down to get cartridges , and , what with one thing and the other , it was not handed in at [the post - office]3993-the post - office until too late . It was the most terrible morning . [Paul]256-paul disliked [me]254-helen more and more , and [Evie]262-evie talked cricket averages till [I]254-helen nearly screamed . [I]254-helen can not think how [I]254-helen stood [her]262-evie all the other days . Ugh ! but it has been a disgusting business . To think that-- "[776-i] [She]776-i sighed .

" To think that because [you]254-helen and [a young man]663-a young man meet for a moment , there must be all these telegrams and anger , "[255-margaret] supplied [Margaret]255-margaret .

[Helen]254-helen nodded .

" [I]254-helen ve often thought about it , [Helen]254-helen . It s one of the most interesting things in [the world]745-the world . Personal relations , that [we]4002-we think supreme , are not supreme there . There love means marriage settlements , death , death duties . So far [I]254-helen m clear . But here [my]254-helen difficulty . This outer life , though obviously horrid ; often seems [the real one]4003-the real one -- there s grit in it . It does breed character . Do personal relations lead to sloppiness in the end ? "[254-helen]

" Don t [you]254-helen feel it now ? "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen remember [Paul]256-paul at breakfast , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen quietly . " [I]254-helen shall never forget [him]256-paul . [He]256-paul had nothing to fall back upon . [I]254-helen know that personal relations are the real life , for ever and ever . "[254-helen]

" Amen ! "[254-helen]

So the Wilcox episode fell into the background , leaving behind it memories of sweetness and horror that mingled , and [the sisters]775-the sisters pursued the life that [Helen]254-helen had commended . [They]775-the sisters talked to [each other]3998-each other and to [other people]779-other people , [they]775-the sisters filled [the tall thin house at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]780-the tall thin house at wickham place with [those whom [they]775-the sisters liked or could befriend]781-those whom they liked or could befriend . [They]775-the sisters even attended public meetings . In [their]775-the sisters own fashion [they]775-the sisters cared deeply about politics , though not as [politicians]639-politicians would have [us]783-us care ; [they]775-the sisters desired that public life should mirror whatever is good in the life within . Temperance , tolerance , and sexual equality were intelligible cries to [them]775-the sisters ; whereas [they]775-the sisters did not follow [our]783-us Forward Policy in [Tibet]38-tibet with the keen attention that it merits , and would at times dismiss [the whole British Empire]784-the whole british empire with a puzzled , if reverent , sigh . Not out of [them]775-the sisters are the shows of history erected : [the world]745-the world would be a grey , bloodless place were [it]745-the world composed entirely of [Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels . But [the world]745-the world being what it is , perhaps [they]775-the sisters shine out in it like stars .

A word on [their]775-the sisters origin . [They]775-the sisters were not " English to the back - bone , "[775-the sisters] as [[their]775-the sisters aunt]625-their aunt had piously asserted . But , on the other hand , [they]775-the sisters were not " [Germans of the dreadful sort]4006-germans of the dreadful sort . "[775-the sisters] [[Their]775-the sisters father]788-their father had belonged to a type that was more prominent in [Germany]3-germany fifty years ago than now . [He]788-their father was not [the aggressive German]789-the aggressive german , so dear to [the English journalist]790-the english journalist , nor the domestic German , so dear to [the English wit]791-the english wit . If one classed [him]788-their father at all it would be as [the countryman of [Hegel]793-hegel and [Kant]277-kant]792-the countryman of hegel and kant , as [the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose Imperialism was the Imperialism of the air]794-the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose imperialism was the imperialism of the air . Not that [his]788-their father life had been inactive . [He]788-their father had fought like blazes against [Denmark]39-denmark , [Austria]40-austria , [France]41-france . But [he]788-their father had fought without visualising the results of victory . A hint of the truth broke on [him]788-their father after [Sedan]278-sedan , when [he]788-their father saw the dyed moustaches of [Napoleon]279-napoleon going grey ; another when [he]788-their father entered [Paris]42-paris , and saw the smashed windows of [the Tuileries]43-the tuileries . Peace came -- it was all very immense , [one]3797-one had turned into [an Empire]796-an empire -- but [he]788-their father knew that some quality had vanished for which not all [Alsace - Lorraine]44-alsace - lorraine could compensate [him]788-their father . [Germany]3-germany [a commercial Power]797-a commercial power , [Germany]3-germany [a naval Power]798-a naval power , [[Germany]3-germany with [colonies here]800-colonies here and a Forward Policy there]799-germany with colonies here and a forward policy there , and legitimate aspirations in [the other place]801-the other place , might appeal to [others]802-others , and be fitly served by [them]802-others ; for [his]788-their father own part , [he]788-their father abstained from the fruits of victory , and naturalised [himself]788-their father in [England]34-england . [The more earnest members of [[his]788-their father family]804-his family]803-the more earnest members of his family never forgave [him]788-their father , and knew that [[his]788-their father children]805-his children , though scarcely English of the dreadful sort , would never be German to the back - bone . [He]788-their father had obtained work in [one of [[our]807-our provincial universities]808-our provincial universities]806-one of our provincial universities , and there married [Poor Emily]276-emily ( or Die Englanderin , as the case may be ) , and as [she]276-emily had money , [they]809-they proceeded to [London]2-london , and came to know [a good many people]810-a good many people . But [his]788-their father gaze was always fixed beyond [the sea]811-the sea . It was [his]788-their father hope that the clouds of materialism obscuring [the Fatherland]280-the fatherland would part in time , and the mild intellectual light re - emerge . " Do [you]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew imply that [we]807-our [Germans]266-germans are stupid , [Uncle Ernst]281-uncle ernst ? "[812-a haughty and magnificent nephew] exclaimed [a haughty and magnificent nephew]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew . [Uncle Ernst]281-uncle ernst replied , " To [my]281-uncle ernst mind . [You]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew use the intellect , but [you]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew no longer care about it . That [I]281-uncle ernst call stupidity . "[281-uncle ernst] As [the haughty nephew]813-the haughty nephew did not follow , [he]281-uncle ernst continued , " [You]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew only care about the things that [you]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew can use , and therefore arrange them in the following order : Money , supremely useful ; intellect , rather useful ; imagination , of no use at all . No"--for[281-uncle ernst] [the other]814-the other had protested--"your Pan - Germanism is no more imaginative than is [our]807-our Imperialism over here . It is the vice of a vulgar mind to be thrilled by bigness , to think that a thousand square miles are a thousand times more wonderful than one square mile , and that a million square miles are almost the same as heaven . That is not imagination . No , it kills it . When [[their]266-germans poets]4007-their poets over here try to celebrate bigness [they]266-germans are dead at once , and naturally . [[Your]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew poets]4008-your poets too are dying , [[your]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew philosophers]4009-your philosophers , [[your]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew musicians]4010-your musicians , to whom [Europe]45-europe has listened for two hundred years . Gone . Gone with [the little courts that nurtured [them]266-germans]4011-the little courts that nurtured them -- gone with [Esterhazy]46-esterhazy and [Weimar]282-weimar . What ? What s that ? [[Your]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew universities]4012-your universities ? Oh yes , [you]812-a haughty and magnificent nephew have [learned men]4013-learned men , who collect more facts than do [the learned men of [England]34-england]4014-the learned men of england . [They]4013-learned men collect facts , and facts , and empires of facts . But which of [them]4013-learned men will rekindle the light within ? "[281-uncle ernst]

To all this [Margaret]255-margaret listened , sitting on [the haughty nephew]813-the haughty nephew s knee .

It was a unique education for [the little girls]816-the little girls . [The haughty nephew]813-the haughty nephew would be at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place one day , bringing with [him]813-the haughty nephew [an even haughtier wife]818-an even haughtier wife , both convinced that [Germany]3-germany was appointed by [God]274-god to govern [the world]745-the world . [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley would come the next day , convinced that [Great Britain]47-great britain had been appointed to the same post by [the same authority]820-the same authority . Were [both these loud - voiced parties]821-both these loud - voiced parties right ? On one occasion [they]821-both these loud - voiced parties had met and [Margaret]255-margaret with clasped hands had implored [them]821-both these loud - voiced parties to argue the subject out in [her]255-margaret presence . Whereat [they]821-both these loud - voiced parties blushed , and began to talk about the weather . " [Papa]283-papa , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret cried -- [she]255-margaret was [a most offensive child--"why]4015-a most offensive child--"why will [they]821-both these loud - voiced parties not discuss this most clear question ? "[255-margaret] [[Her]255-margaret father]822-her father , surveying the parties grimly , replied that [he]822-her father did not know . Putting [her]255-margaret head on one side , [Margaret]255-margaret then remarked , " To [me]255-margaret one of two things is very clear ; either [God]274-god does not know [his]274-god own mind about [England]34-england and [Germany]3-germany , or else these do not know the mind of [God]274-god . "[255-margaret] [A hateful little girl]823-a hateful little girl , but at thirteen [she]255-margaret had grasped a dilemma that [most people]753-most people travel through life without perceiving . [Her]255-margaret brain darted up and down ; it grew pliant and strong . [Her]255-margaret conclusion was , that [any human being]825-any human being lies nearer to the unseen than [any organisation]826-any organisation , and from this [she]255-margaret never varied .

[Helen]254-helen advanced along the same lines , though with a more irresponsible tread . In character [she]254-helen resembled [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister , but [she]254-helen was pretty , and so apt to have a more amusing time . [People]3992-people gathered round [her]254-helen more readily , especially when [they]3992-people were [new acquaintances]829-new acquaintances , and [she]254-helen did enjoy a little homage very much . When [[their]830-their father]788-their father died and [they]830-their ruled alone at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , [she]254-helen often absorbed the whole of [the company]832-the company , while [Margaret]255-margaret -- [both]833-both were [tremendous talkers]834-tremendous talkers -- fell flat . [Neither sister]835-neither sister bothered about this . [Helen]254-helen never apologised afterwards , [Margaret]255-margaret did not feel the slightest rancour . But looks have [their]830-their influence upon character . [The sisters]775-the sisters were alike as [little girls]837-little girls , but at the time of the Wilcox episode [their]775-the sisters methods were beginning to diverge ; [the younger]3905-the younger was rather apt to entice [people]3992-people , and , in enticing [them]3992-people , to be [herself]3905-the younger enticed ; [the elder]3904-the elder went straight ahead , and accepted an occasional failure as part of the game .

Little need be premised about [Tibby]259-tibby . [He]259-tibby was now [an intelligent man of sixteen]841-an intelligent man of sixteen , but dyspeptic and difficile .

CHAPTER V

It will be generally admitted that [Beethoven]284-beethoven s Fifth Symphony is the most sublime noise that has ever penetrated into the ear of [man]3959-man . All sorts and conditions are satisfied by it . Whether [you]843-you are like [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt , and tap surreptitiously when the tunes come -- of course , not so as to disturb [the others]3989-the others -- or like [Helen]254-helen , who can see [heroes and shipwrecks in the music s flood]845-heroes and shipwrecks in the music s flood ; or like [Margaret]255-margaret , who can only see the music ; or like [Tibby]259-tibby , who is profoundly versed in counterpoint , and holds the full score open on [his]259-tibby knee ; or like [[their]775-the sisters cousin]846-their cousin , [Fraulein Mosebach]285-fraulein mosebach , who remembers all the time that [Beethoven]284-beethoven is echt Deutsch ; or like [Fraulein Mosebach]285-fraulein mosebach [s young man , who can remember nothing but [Fraulein Mosebach]285-fraulein mosebach]847-s young man , who can remember nothing but fraulein mosebach : in any case , the passion of [your]843-you life becomes more vivid , and [you]843-you are bound to admit that such a noise is cheap at two shillings . It is cheap , even if [you]843-you hear it in [the Queen s Hall]848-the queen s hall , [dreariest music - room in [London]2-london]849-dreariest music - room in london , though not as dreary as [the Free Trade Hall]850-the free trade hall , [Manchester]48-manchester ; and even if [you]843-you sit on the extreme left of [that hall]851-that hall , so that the brass bumps at [you]843-you before the rest of [the orchestra]852-the orchestra arrives , it is still cheap .

" Whom is [Margaret]255-margaret talking to ? "[264-mrs. munt] said [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt , at the conclusion of the first movement . [She]264-mrs. munt was again in [London]2-london on a visit to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place .

[Helen]254-helen looked down the long line of [[their]853-their party]854-their party , and said that [she]254-helen did not know .

" Would it be [some young man]4016-some young man or other whom [she]255-margaret takes an interest in ? "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen expect so , "[254-helen] [Helen]254-helen replied . Music enwrapped [her]254-helen , and [she]254-helen could not enter into the distinction that divides [young men]855-young men whom one takes an interest in from [young men whom one]856-young men whom one knows .

" [[You]254-helen girls]4017-you girls are so wonderful in always having -- Oh dear ! [one]3797-one mustn t talk . "[254-helen]

For [the Andante]286-the andante had begun -- very beautiful , but bearing a family likeness to all the other beautiful Andantes that [Beethoven]284-beethoven had written , and , to [Helen]254-helen s mind , rather disconnecting the heroes and shipwrecks of the first movement from [the heroes and goblins of the third]857-the heroes and goblins of the third . [She]254-helen heard the tune through once , and then [her]254-helen attention wandered , and [she]254-helen gazed at [the audience]858-the audience , or the organ , or the architecture . Much did [she]254-helen censure the attenuated Cupids who encircle the ceiling of [the Queen s Hall]848-the queen s hall , inclining each to each with vapid gesture , and clad in sallow pantaloons , on which the October sunlight struck . " How awful to marry [a man like those Cupids]4019-a man like those cupids ! "[254-helen] thought [Helen]254-helen . Here [Beethoven]284-beethoven started decorating [his]284-beethoven tune , so [she]254-helen heard [him]284-beethoven through once more , and then [she]254-helen smiled at [[her]254-helen Cousin]860-her cousin [Frieda]287-frieda . But [Frieda]287-frieda , listening to Classical Music , could not respond . [Herr Liesecke]288-herr liesecke , too , looked as if wild horses could not make [him]288-herr liesecke inattentive ; there were lines across [his]288-herr liesecke forehead , [his]288-herr liesecke lips were parted , [his]288-herr liesecke pince - nez at right angles to [his]288-herr liesecke nose , and [he]288-herr liesecke had laid a thick , white hand on either knee . And next to [her]254-helen was [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley , so [British]861-british , and wanting to tap . How interesting that row of [people]3992-people was ! What diverse influences had gone to the making ! Here [Beethoven]284-beethoven , after humming and hawing with great sweetness , said " Heigho , "[284-beethoven] and the Andante came to an end . Applause , and a round of " wunderschoning "[863-the german contingent] and pracht volleying from [the German contingent]863-the german contingent . [Margaret]255-margaret started talking to [[her]255-margaret new young man]864-her new young man ; [Helen]254-helen said to [[her]254-helen aunt]546-her aunt : " Now comes the wonderful movement : first of [all the goblins]4020-all the goblins , and then a trio of elephants dancing "[254-helen] ; and [Tibby]259-tibby implored [the company]832-the company generally to look out for the transitional passage on the drum .

" On the what , [dear]3859-dear ? "[832-the company]

" On the drum , [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley . "[832-the company]

" No ; look out for the part where [you]546-her aunt think [you]546-her aunt have done with [the goblins]4022-the goblins and [they]4022-the goblins come back , "[254-helen] breathed [Helen]254-helen , as the music started with [a goblin]867-a goblin walking quietly over [the universe]868-the universe , from end to end . [Others]802-others followed [him]867-a goblin . [They]802-others were [not aggressive creatures]870-not aggressive creatures ; it was that that made [them]802-others so terrible to [Helen]254-helen . [They]802-others merely observed in passing that there was no such thing as splendour or heroism in [the world]745-the world . After the interlude of elephants dancing , [they]802-others returned and made the observation for the second time . [Helen]254-helen could not contradict [them]802-others , for , once at all events , [she]254-helen had felt the same , and had seen the reliable walls of [youth]872-youth collapse . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! [The goblins]4022-the goblins were right . [[Her]254-helen brother]576-her brother raised [his]576-her brother finger ; it was the transitional passage on the drum .

For , as if things were going too far , [Beethoven]284-beethoven took hold of [the goblins]4022-the goblins and made [them]4022-the goblins do what [he]284-beethoven wanted . [He]284-beethoven appeared in person . [He]284-beethoven gave [them]4022-the goblins a little push , and [they]4022-the goblins began to walk in a major key instead of in a minor , and then -- [he]284-beethoven blew with [his]284-beethoven mouth and [they]4022-the goblins were scattered ! Gusts of splendour , [gods]876-gods and demigods contending with vast swords , colour and fragrance broadcast on the field of battle , magnificent victory , magnificent death ! Oh , it all burst before [the girl]877-the girl , and [she]877-the girl even stretched out [her]877-the girl gloved hands as if it was tangible . Any fate was titanic ; any contest desirable ; conqueror and conquered would alike be applauded by the angels of the utmost stars .

And [the goblins]4022-the goblins -- [they]4022-the goblins had not really been there at all ? [They]4022-the goblins were only [the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief]879-the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief ? One healthy human impulse would dispel [them]4022-the goblins ? [Men like [the Wilcoxes]4005-the wilcoxes]3813-men like the wilcoxes , or [ex - President Roosevelt]882-ex - president roosevelt , would say yes . [Beethoven]284-beethoven knew better . [The goblins]4022-the goblins really had been [there]884-there . [They]4022-the goblins might return -- and [they]4022-the goblins did . It was as if the splendour of life might boil over and waste to steam and froth . In its dissolution one heard the terrible , ominous note , and [a goblin]867-a goblin , with increased malignity , walked quietly over [the universe]868-the universe from end to end . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! Even the flaming ramparts of [the world]745-the world might fall . [Beethoven]284-beethoven chose to make all right in the end . [He]284-beethoven built the ramparts up . [He]284-beethoven blew with [his]284-beethoven mouth for the second time , and again [the goblins]4022-the goblins were scattered . [He]284-beethoven brought back the gusts of splendour , the heroism , [the youth]889-the youth , the magnificence of life and of death , and , amid vast roarings of a superhuman joy , [he]284-beethoven led [his]284-beethoven Fifth Symphony to its conclusion . But [the goblins]4022-the goblins were there . [They]4022-the goblins could return . [He]284-beethoven had said so bravely , and that is why [one]3797-one can trust [Beethoven]284-beethoven when [he]284-beethoven says other things .

[Helen]254-helen pushed [her]254-helen way out during the applause . [She]254-helen desired to be alone . The music had summed up to [her]254-helen all that had happened or could happen in [her]254-helen career .

[She]254-helen read it as a tangible statement , which could never be superseded . The notes meant this and that to [her]254-helen , and they could have no other meaning , and life could have no other meaning . [She]254-helen pushed right out of [the building]892-the building and walked slowly down [the outside staircase]893-the outside staircase , breathing the autumnal air , and then [she]254-helen strolled [home]894-home .

" So should [I.]930-you Now , [[my]255-margaret sister]4024-my sister declares [they]4045-they re just the same . [We]4046-we have great arguments over it . "[255-margaret] Getting under way , [she]255-margaret cried : " Now , doesn t it seem absurd to [you]930-you ? What is the good of the Arts if they re interchangeable ? What is the good of the ear if it tells [you]4047-you the same as the eye ? [Helen]254-helen s one aim is to translate tunes into the language of painting , and pictures into the language of music . It s very ingenious , and [she]254-helen says several pretty things in the process , but what s gained , [I]255-margaret d like to know ? Oh , it s all rubbish , radically false . If [Monet]300-monet s really [Debussy]301-debussy , and [Debussy]301-debussy s really [Monet]300-monet , [neither gentleman]4048-neither gentleman is worth [his]4048-neither gentleman salt -- that s [my]255-margaret opinion . "[255-margaret]

Evidently [these sisters]931-these sisters quarrelled .

" Now , this very symphony that [we]4046-we ve just been having -- [she]254-helen won t let it alone . [She]254-helen labels it with meanings from start to finish ; turns it into literature . [I]932-an unhappy family wonder if the day will ever return when music will be treated as music . Yet [I]932-an unhappy family don t know . There s [[my]932-an unhappy family brother]4049-my brother -- behind [us]4046-we . [He]4049-my brother treats music as music , and oh , [my]932-an unhappy family goodness ! [He]4049-my brother makes [me]932-an unhappy family angrier than [any one]4050-any one , simply furious . With [him]4049-my brother [I]932-an unhappy family daren t even argue . "[932-an unhappy family]

[An unhappy family]932-an unhappy family , if talented .

" But , of course , [the real villain]4051-the real villain is [Wagner]302-wagner . [He]302-wagner has done more than [any man]4052-any man in the nineteenth century towards the muddling of the arts . [I]679-the young man do feel that music is in a very serious state just now , though extraordinarily interesting . Every now and then in history there do come [these terrible geniuses]4053-these terrible geniuses , like [Wagner]302-wagner , who stir up all the wells of thought at once . For a moment it s splendid . Such a splash as never was . But afterwards -- such a lot of mud ; and the wells -- as it were , [they]4053-these terrible geniuses communicate with [each other]3998-each other too easily now , and not one of [them]4053-these terrible geniuses will run quite clear . That s what [Wagner]302-wagner s done . "[679-the young man]

[Her]933-her speeches fluttered away from [the young man]679-the young man like birds . If only [he]679-the young man could talk like this , [he]679-the young man would have caught [the world]745-the world . Oh , to acquire culture ! Oh , to pronounce foreign names correctly ! Oh , to be well informed , discoursing at ease on every subject that [a lady]922-a lady started ! But it would take one years . With an hour at lunch and a few shattered hours in the evening , how was it possible to catch up with [leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood]937-leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood ? [His]679-the young man brain might be full of names , [he]679-the young man might have even heard of [Monet]300-monet and [Debussy]301-debussy ; the trouble was that [he]679-the young man could not string them together into a sentence , [he]679-the young man could not make [them]938-them " tell , "[679-the young man] [he]679-the young man could not quite forget about [his]679-the young man stolen umbrella . Yes , the umbrella was the real trouble . Behind [Monet]300-monet and [Debussy]301-debussy the umbrella persisted , with the steady beat of a drum . " [I]679-the young man suppose [my]679-the young man umbrella will be all right , "[679-the young man] [he]679-the young man was thinking . " [I]679-the young man don t really mind about it . [I]679-the young man will think about music instead . [I]679-the young man suppose [my]679-the young man umbrella will be all right . "[679-the young man] Earlier in the afternoon [he]679-the young man had worried about seats . Ought [he]679-the young man to have paid as much as two shillings ? Earlier still [he]679-the young man had wondered , " Shall [I]679-the young man try to do without a programme ? "[679-the young man] There had always been something to worry [him]679-the young man ever since [he]679-the young man could remember , always something that distracted [him]679-the young man in the pursuit of beauty . For [he]679-the young man did pursue beauty , and , therefore , [Margaret]255-margaret s speeches did flutter away from [him]679-the young man like birds .

[Margaret]255-margaret talked ahead , occasionally saying , " Don t [you]679-the young man think so ? don t [you]679-the young man feel the same ? "[255-margaret] And once [she]255-margaret stopped , and said , " Oh , do interrupt [me]255-margaret ! "[255-margaret] which terrified [him]679-the young man . [She]255-margaret did not attract [him]679-the young man , though [she]255-margaret filled [him]679-the young man with awe . [Her]255-margaret figure was meagre , [her]255-margaret face seemed all teeth and eyes , [her]255-margaret references to [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister and [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother were uncharitable . It was surprising ( and alarming ) that [she]255-margaret should suddenly say , " [I]255-margaret do hope that [you]4055-you ll come in and have some tea . [We]943-we should be so glad . [They]943-we had arrived at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . The sun had set , and [the backwater]944-the backwater , in deep shadow , was filling with a gentle haze . To the right the fantastic sky - line of [the flats]945-the flats towered black against the hues of evening ; to the left [the older houses]561-the older houses raised a square - cut , irregular parapet against the grey . [Margaret]255-margaret fumbled for [her]255-margaret latch - key . Of course [she]255-margaret had forgotten it . Suppose [Queen Victoria]304-queen victoria gave a dinner - party , and that [the guests]4092-the guests had been [Leighton]305-leighton , [Millais]306-millais , [Swinburne]307-swinburne , [Rossetti]308-rossetti , [Meredith]309-meredith , [Fitzgerald]310-fitzgerald , etc . "[255-margaret]

" [That house]4097-that house being [the W s house]4098-the w s house , [I]259-tibby presume , "[259-tibby] said [Tibby]259-tibby .

Bursts of disloyal laughter -- [you]960-you must remember that [they]961-they are half German -- greeted these suggestions , and [Margaret]255-margaret said pensively , " How inconceivable it would be if [the Royal Family]4103-the royal family cared about Art .
