Beyond [them]963-them [the thoroughfare]964-the thoroughfare roared gently -- a tide that could never be quiet , while in [the east]965-the east , invisible behind the smokes of Wapping , the moon was rising .

" That reminds [me]963-them , [Margaret]255-margaret . [We]968-we might have taken [that young man]4076-that young man into [the dining - room]3978-the dining - room , at all events . Only the majolica plate -- and that is so firmly set in the wall . [I]963-them am really distressed that [he]4076-that young man had no tea . "[963-them]

For that little incident had impressed [the three women]966-the three women more than might be supposed . It remained as a goblin footfall , as a hint that all is not for the best in the best of all possible worlds , and that beneath these superstructures of wealth and art there wanders [an ill - fed boy]967-an ill - fed boy , who has recovered [his]967-an ill - fed boy umbrella indeed , but who has left no address behind [him]967-an ill - fed boy , and no name .

CHAPTER VI

[WE]968-we are not concerned with [the very poor]969-the very poor . [They]969-the very poor are unthinkable and only to be approached by [the statistician]970-the statistician or [the poet]971-the poet . This story deals with [gentlefolk]972-gentlefolk , or with those who are obliged to pretend that [they]972-gentlefolk are [gentlefolk]972-gentlefolk .

[The boy]662-the boy , [Leonard Bast]311-leonard , stood at the extreme verge of gentility . [He]662-the boy was not in [the abyss]975-the abyss , but [he]662-the boy could see it , and at times [people whom [he]662-the boy knew]976-people whom he knew had dropped in , and counted no more . [He]662-the boy knew that [he]662-the boy was poor , and would admit it ; [he]662-the boy would have died sooner than confess any inferiority to [the rich]977-the rich . This may be splendid of [him]662-the boy . But [he]662-the boy was inferior to [most rich people]978-most rich people , there is not the least doubt of it . [He]662-the boy was not as courteous as [the average rich man]979-the average rich man , nor as intelligent , nor as healthy , nor as lovable . [His]662-the boy mind and [his]662-the boy body had been alike underfed , because [he]662-the boy was poor , and because [he]662-the boy was modern [they]980-they were always craving better food . Had [he]662-the boy lived some centuries ago , in the brightly coloured civilisations of the past , [he]662-the boy would have had a definite status , [his]662-the boy rank and [his]662-the boy income would have corresponded . But in [his]662-the boy day [the angel of Democracy]981-the angel of democracy had arisen , enshadowing [the classes with leathern wings]982-the classes with leathern wings , and proclaiming , " [All men]4106-all men are equal -- [all men]4106-all men , that is to say , who possess umbrellas , "[662-the boy] and so [he]662-the boy was obliged to assert gentility , lest [he]662-the boy slip into the abyss where nothing counts , and the statements of [Democracy]312-democracy are inaudible .

As [he]662-the boy walked away from [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , [his]662-the boy first care was to prove that [he]662-the boy was as good as [the Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels . Obscurely wounded in [his]662-the boy pride , [he]662-the boy tried to wound [them]980-they in return . [They]980-they were probably not [ladies]983-ladies . Would [real ladies]984-real ladies have asked [him]662-the boy to tea ? [They]980-they were certainly ill - natured and cold . At each step [his]662-the boy feeling of superiority increased . Would [a real lady]985-a real lady have talked about stealing an umbrella ? Perhaps [they]980-they were [thieves]986-thieves after all , and if [he]662-the boy had gone into [the house]3796-the house [they]980-they would have clapped a chloroformed handkerchief over [his]662-the boy face . [He]662-the boy walked on complacently as far as [the Houses of Parliament]988-the houses of parliament . There an empty stomach asserted itself , and told [him]662-the boy that [he]662-the boy was [a fool]3951-a fool .

" Evening , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast . "[3951-a fool]

" Evening , [Mr. Dealtry]314-mr. dealtry . "[3951-a fool]

" Nice evening . "[3951-a fool]

" Evening . "[3951-a fool]

[Mr. Dealtry]314-mr. dealtry , [a fellow clerk]990-a fellow clerk , passed on , and [Leonard]311-leonard stood wondering whether [he]662-the boy would take [the tram]991-the tram as far as a penny would take [him]662-the boy , or whether [he]662-the boy would walk . [He]662-the boy decided to walk -- it is no good giving in , and [he]662-the boy had spent money enough at [Queen s Hall]52-queen s hall -- and [he]662-the boy walked over [Westminster Bridge]55-westminster bridge , in front of [St. Thomas s Hospital]56-st. thomas s hospital , and through [the immense tunnel that passes under [the South - Western main line]993-the south - western main line at [Vauxhall]57-vauxhall]992-the immense tunnel that passes under the south - western main line at vauxhall . In [the tunnel]994-the tunnel [he]662-the boy paused and listened to the roar of [the trains]995-the trains . A sharp pain darted through [his]662-the boy head , and [he]662-the boy was conscious of the exact form of [his]662-the boy eye sockets . [He]662-the boy pushed on for another mile , and did not slacken speed until [he]662-the boy stood at the entrance of [a road called [Camelia Road]58-camelia road]996-a road called camelia road which was at present [[his]662-the boy home]997-his home .

Here [he]662-the boy stopped again , and glanced suspiciously to right and left , like a rabbit that is going to bolt into its hole . [A block of flats]998-a block of flats , constructed with extreme cheapness , towered on either hand . Farther down [the road]999-the road [two more blocks]1000-two more blocks were being built , and beyond these [an old house]1001-an old house was being demolished to accommodate [another pair]1002-another pair . It was the kind of scene that may be observed all over [London]2-london , whatever [the locality]1003-the locality -- bricks and mortar rising and falling with the restlessness of the water in a fountain as [the city]1004-the city receives more and more men upon [[her]1004-the city soil]1005-her soil . [Camelia Road]58-camelia road would soon stand out like [a fortress]1006-a fortress , and command , for a little , an extensive view . Only for a little . Plans were out for the erection of [[flats]558-flats in [Magnolia Road]59-magnolia road]1008-flats in magnolia road also . And again a few years , and [all the flats in [either road]1010-either road]1009-all the flats in either road might be pulled down , and [new buildings]1011-new buildings , of a vastness at present unimaginable , might arise where they had fallen .

" Evening , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast . "[315-mr. cunningham]

" Evening , [Mr. Cunningham]315-mr. cunningham . "[315-mr. cunningham]

" Very serious thing this decline of the birth - rate in [Manchester]48-manchester . "[315-mr. cunningham]

" [I]315-mr. cunningham beg [your]315-mr. cunningham pardon ? "[315-mr. cunningham]

" Very serious thing this decline of the birth - rate in [Manchester]48-manchester , "[315-mr. cunningham] repeated [Mr. Cunningham]315-mr. cunningham , tapping the Sunday paper , in which the calamity in question had just been announced to [him]315-mr. cunningham .

" Ah , yes , "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard , who was not going to let on that [he]311-leonard had not bought a Sunday paper .

" If this kind of thing goes on [the population of [England]34-england]4108-the population of england will be stationary in 1960 . "[315-mr. cunningham]

" [You]311-leonard don t say so . "[1018-other men]

" [I]315-mr. cunningham call it a very serious thing , eh ? "[315-mr. cunningham]

" Good - evening , [Mr. Cunningham]315-mr. cunningham . "[1018-other men]

" Good - evening , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast . "[315-mr. cunningham]

Then [Leonard]311-leonard entered [[Block B]60-block b of [the flats]945-the flats]1012-block b of the flats , and turned , not [upstairs]575-upstairs , but down , into what is known to [house]1015-house [agents]1016-agents as [a semi - basement]1017-a semi - basement , and to [other men]1018-other men as [a cellar]1019-a cellar . [He]311-leonard opened the door , and cried , " Hullo ! "[311-leonard] with the pseudo geniality of [the Cockney]316-the cockney . There was no reply . " Hullo ! "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard repeated . [The sitting - room]1020-the sitting - room was empty , though the electric light had been left burning . A look of relief came over [his]311-leonard face , and [he]311-leonard flung [himself]311-leonard into the armchair .

[The sitting - room]1020-the sitting - room contained , besides the armchair , two other chairs , a piano , a three - legged table , and a cosy corner . Of the walls , one was occupied by the window , the other by a draped mantelshelf bristling with Cupids . Opposite the window was the door , and beside the door a bookcase , while over the piano there extended one of the masterpieces of [Maud Goodman]317-maud goodman . It was an amorous and not unpleasant little hole when the curtains were drawn , and the lights turned on , and the gas - stove unlit . But it struck that shallow makeshift note that is so often heard in [the dwelling - place]1022-the dwelling - place . It had been too easily gained , and could be relinquished too easily .

As [Leonard]311-leonard was kicking off [his]311-leonard boots [he]311-leonard jarred the three - legged table , and a photograph frame , honourably poised upon it , slid sideways , fell off into the fireplace , and smashed . [He]311-leonard swore in a colourless sort of way , and picked the photograph up . It represented [a young lady]1023-a young lady called [Jacky]318-jacky , and had been taken at the time when [young ladies called [Jacky]318-jacky]1024-young ladies called jacky were often photographed with [their]1024-young ladies called jacky mouths open . Teeth of dazzling whiteness extended along either of [Jacky]318-jacky s jaws , and positively weighed [her]1023-a young lady head sideways , so large were they and so numerous . Take [my]3-germany word for it , that smile was simply stunning , and it is only [you]1025-you and [I]3-germany who will be fastidious , and complain that true joy begins in the eyes , and that the eyes of [Jacky]318-jacky did not accord with [her]1023-a young lady smile , but were anxious and hungry .

[Leonard]311-leonard tried to pull out the fragments of glass , and cut [his]311-leonard fingers and swore again . A drop of blood fell on the frame , another followed , spilling over on to the exposed photograph . [He]311-leonard swore more vigorously , and dashed into [the kitchen]1026-the kitchen , where [he]311-leonard bathed [his]311-leonard hands . [The kitchen]1026-the kitchen was the same size as [the sitting - room]1020-the sitting - room ; beyond [it]1026-the kitchen was [a bedroom]1029-a bedroom . This completed [[his]311-leonard home]997-his home . [He]311-leonard was renting [the flat furnished]1031-the flat furnished ; of all the objects that encumbered [it]1031-the flat furnished none were [his]311-leonard own except the photograph frame , the Cupids , and the books .

" Damn , damn , damnation ! "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard murmured , together with such other words as [he]311-leonard had learnt from [older men]1032-older men . Then [he]311-leonard raised [his]311-leonard hand to [his]311-leonard forehead and said , " Oh , damn it all-- "[311-leonard] which meant something different . [He]311-leonard pulled [himself]311-leonard together . [He]311-leonard drank a little tea , black and silent , that still survived upon an upper shelf . [He]311-leonard swallowed some dusty crumbs of a cake . Then [he]311-leonard went back to [the sitting - room]1020-the sitting - room , settled [himself]311-leonard anew , and began to read a volume of [Ruskin]319-ruskin .

" Seven miles to [the north of [Venice--]3-germany]4109-the north of venice-- "[311-leonard]

How perfectly the famous chapter opens ! How supreme its command of admonition and of poetry ! [The rich man]1034-the rich man is speaking to [us]1035-us from [[his]1034-the rich man gondola]1036-his gondola .

" Seven miles to [the north of [Venice]62-venice]4110-the north of venice the banks of sand which nearer [the city]1004-the city rise little above low - water mark attain by degrees a higher level , and knit themselves at last into [fields of salt morass]4112-fields of salt morass , raised here and there into [shapeless mounds]4113-shapeless mounds , and intercepted by [narrow creeks of sea]4114-narrow creeks of sea . "[1034-the rich man]

[Leonard]311-leonard was trying to form [his]311-leonard style on [Ruskin]319-ruskin ; [he]311-leonard understood [him]319-ruskin to be the greatest master of English Prose . [He]311-leonard read forward steadily , occasionally making a few notes .

" Let [us]4115-us consider a little each of these characters in succession , and first ( for of the shafts enough has been said already ) , what is very peculiar to [this church]4116-this church -- its luminousness . "[1034-the rich man]

Was there anything to be learnt from this fine sentence ? Could [he]311-leonard adapt it to the needs of daily life ? Could [he]311-leonard introduce it , with modifications , when [he]311-leonard next wrote a letter to [[his]311-leonard brother]754-his brother , [the lay - reader]1038-the lay - reader ? For example :

" Let [us]4115-us consider a little each of these characters in succession , and first ( for of the absence of ventilation enough has been said already ) , what is very peculiar to [this flat]4117-this flat -- its obscurity . "[311-leonard]

Something told [him]311-leonard that the modifications would not do ; and that something , had [he]311-leonard known it , was the spirit of English Prose . " [[My]311-leonard flat]4118-my flat is dark as well as stuffy . "[311-leonard] Those were the words for [him]311-leonard .

And the voice in the gondola rolled on , piping melodiously of Effort and Self - Sacrifice , full of high purpose , full of beauty , full even of sympathy and the love of [men]3835-men , yet somehow eluding all that was actual and insistent in [Leonard]311-leonard s life . For it was the voice of one who had never been dirty or hungry , and had not guessed successfully what dirt and hunger are .

[Leonard]311-leonard listened to it with reverence . [He]311-leonard felt that [he]311-leonard was being done good to , and that if [he]311-leonard kept on with [Ruskin]319-ruskin , and [the Queen]1040-the queen s Hall Concerts , and some pictures by [Watts]320-watts , [he]311-leonard would one day push [his]311-leonard head out of [the grey waters]1041-the grey waters and see [the universe]868-the universe . [He]311-leonard believed in sudden conversion , a belief which may be right , but which is peculiarly attractive to a half - baked mind . It is the basis of much popular religion ; in the domain of business it dominates the Stock Exchange , and becomes that " bit of luck "[311-leonard] by which all successes and failures are explained . " If only [I]311-leonard had a bit of luck , the whole thing would come straight ... [He]311-leonard s got [a most magnificent place down at [Streatham]63-streatham]4119-a most magnificent place down at streatham and [a 20 h.p . Fiat]4120-a 20 h.p . fiat , but then , mind [you]4121-you , [he]311-leonard s had luck ... [I]311-leonard m sorry [the wife]3988-the wife s so late , but [she]3988-the wife never has any luck over catching [trains]4123-trains . "[311-leonard] [Leonard]311-leonard was superior to [these people]1043-these people ; [he]311-leonard did believe in effort and in a steady preparation for the change that [he]311-leonard desired . But of a heritage that may expand gradually , [he]311-leonard had no conception ; [he]311-leonard hoped to come to Culture suddenly , much as the Revivalist hopes to come to [Jesus]321-jesus . [Those Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels had come to it ; [they]1043-these people had done the trick ; [their]1043-these people hands were upon the ropes , once and for all . And meanwhile , [[his]311-leonard flat]1044-his flat was dark , as well as stuffy .

Presently there was a noise on the staircase . [He]311-leonard shut up [Margaret]255-margaret s card in the pages of [Ruskin]319-ruskin , and opened the door . [A woman]1045-a woman entered , of whom it is simplest to say that [she]1045-a woman was not respectable . [Her]1045-a woman appearance was awesome . [She]1045-a woman seemed all strings and bell - pulls -- ribbons , chains , bead necklaces that clinked and caught and a boa of azure feathers hung round [her]1045-a woman neck , with the ends uneven . [Her]1045-a woman throat was bare , wound with a double row of pearls , [her]1045-a woman arms were bare to the elbows , and might again be detected at the shoulder , through cheap lace . [Her]1045-a woman hat , which was flowery , resembled those punnets , covered with flannel , which [we]1046-we sowed with mustard and cress in [our]1046-we childhood , and which germinated here yes , and there no . [She]1045-a woman wore it on the back of [her]1045-a woman head . As for [her]1045-a woman hair , or rather hairs , they are too complicated to describe , but one system went down [her]1045-a woman back , lying in a thick pad there , while another , created for a lighter destiny , rippled around [her]1045-a woman forehead . The face -- the face does not signify . It was the face of the photograph , but older , and the teeth were not so numerous as [the photographer]1047-the photographer had suggested , and certainly not so white . Yes , [Jacky]318-jacky was past [her]1045-a woman prime , whatever that prime may have been . [She]1045-a woman was descending quicker than [most women]1048-most women into the colourless years , and the look in [her]1045-a woman eyes confessed it .

" What ho ! "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard , greeting [the apparition]1049-the apparition with much spirit , and helping it off with its boa .

" It really is too bad when [a fellow]4132-a fellow isn t trusted . " That s what [I]1063-she am , [Jacky]318-jacky . [I]1063-she don t take any heed of what [any one]4050-any one says . [I]1063-she just go straight forward , [I]1063-she do . " [I]311-leonard ll tell [you]4143-you another thing too . [I]311-leonard care a good deal about improving [myself]311-leonard by means of Literature and Art , and so getting a wider outlook . To all [his]1062-you moods [Jacky]318-jacky remained equally indifferent . When supper was ready -- and not before -- [she]1063-she emerged from [the bedroom]1057-the bedroom , saying : " But [you]1062-you do love [me]1063-she , don t [you]1062-you ? "[1063-she]

[They]1065-they began with a soup square , which [Leonard]311-leonard had just dissolved in some hot water . It was followed by the tongue -- a freckled cylinder of meat , with a little jelly at the top , and a great deal of yellow fat at the bottom -- ending with another square dissolved in water ( jelly : pineapple ) , which [Leonard]311-leonard had prepared earlier in the day . [Jacky]318-jacky ate contentedly enough , occasionally looking at [[her]1063-she man]1066-her man with those anxious eyes , to which nothing else in [her]1063-she appearance corresponded , and which yet seemed to mirror [her]1063-she soul . And [Leonard]311-leonard managed to convince [his]311-leonard stomach that it was having a nourishing meal .

After supper [they]1065-they smoked cigarettes and exchanged a few statements . [She]1063-she observed that [her]1063-she " likeness "[1063-she] had been broken . [He]311-leonard found occasion to remark , for the second time , that [he]311-leonard had come straight back [home]894-home after the concert at [Queen s Hall]52-queen s hall . Presently [she]1063-she sat upon [his]311-leonard knee . [The inhabitants of [Camelia Road]58-camelia road]1068-the inhabitants of camelia road tramped to and fro outside the window , just on a level with [their]1068-the inhabitants of camelia road heads , and [the family in the flat on the ground - floor]1069-the family in the flat on the ground - floor began to sing , " Hark , [my]1069-the family in the flat on the ground - floor soul , it is [the Lord]4148-the lord . "[1069-the family in the flat on the ground - floor]

" That tune fairly gives [me]311-leonard the hump , "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard .

[Jacky]318-jacky followed this , and said that , for [her]1063-she part , [she]1063-she thought it a lovely tune .

" No ; [I]311-leonard ll play [you]318-jacky something lovely . Get up , [dear]3859-dear , for a minute . "[311-leonard]

[He]311-leonard went to the piano and jingled out a little Grieg . [He]311-leonard played badly and vulgarly , but the performance was not without its effect , for [Jacky]318-jacky said [she]1063-she thought [she]1063-she d be going to bed . As [she]1063-she receded , a new set of interests possessed [the boy]662-the boy , and [he]662-the boy began to think of what had been said about music by that odd [Miss Schlegel]254-helen -- the one that twisted [her]254-helen face about so when [she]254-helen spoke . Then the thoughts grew sad and envious . There was [the girl named [Helen]254-helen , who had pinched [his]662-the boy umbrella]1071-the girl named helen , who had pinched his umbrella , and the German girl who had smiled at [him]662-the boy pleasantly , and [Herr]288-herr liesecke [some one]3973-some one , and [Aunt]1073-aunt [some one]3973-some one , and [the brother]1075-the brother -- all , all with [their]1076-their hands on the ropes . [They]1076-their had all passed up [that narrow , rich staircase at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]1077-that narrow , rich staircase at wickham place to [some ample room]1078-some ample room , whither [he]662-the boy could never follow [them]1076-their , not if [he]662-the boy read for ten hours a day . Oh , it was no good , this continual aspiration . [Some]1079-some are born cultured ; [the rest]1080-the rest had better go in for whatever comes easy . To see life steadily and to see it whole was not for the likes of [him]662-the boy .

[Ruskin]319-ruskin had visited [Torcello]323-torcello by this time , and was ordering [[his]319-ruskin gondoliers]1083-his gondoliers to take [him]319-ruskin to [Murano]64-murano . CHAPTER VII

" Oh , [Margaret]255-margaret , "[546-her aunt] cried [[her]1082-her aunt]546-her aunt next morning , " such a most unfortunate thing has happened . [I]546-her aunt could not get [you]255-margaret alone . "[546-her aunt]

The most unfortunate thing was not very serious . [One of [the flats in [the ornate block opposite]1088-the ornate block opposite]1087-the flats in the ornate block opposite]1086-one of the flats in the ornate block opposite had been taken furnished by [the Wilcox family]1089-the wilcox family , " coming up , no doubt , in the hope of getting into [London]2-london society . "[546-her aunt] That [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt should be the first to discover the misfortune was not remarkable , for [she]264-mrs. munt was so interested in [the flats]945-the flats , that [she]264-mrs. munt watched [their]945-the flats every mutation with unwearying care . In theory [she]264-mrs. munt despised [them]945-the flats -- [they]945-the flats took away that old - world look -- [they]945-the flats cut off [the sun -- flats house]1091-the sun -- flats house [a flashy type of person]1092-a flashy type of person . But if the truth had been known , [she]264-mrs. munt found [her]264-mrs. munt visits to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place twice as amusing since [Wickham Mansions]65-wickham mansions had arisen , and would in a couple of days learn more about [them]65-wickham mansions than [[her]264-mrs. munt nieces]565-her nieces in a couple of months , or [[her]264-mrs. munt nephew]929-her nephew in a couple of years . [She]264-mrs. munt would stroll across and make [friends]3831-friends with [the porters]1096-the porters , and inquire what the rents were , exclaiming for example : " What ! a hundred and twenty for [a basement]4150-a basement ? [You]1096-the porters ll never get it ! "[1096-the porters] And [they]1096-the porters would answer : " [One]3797-one can but try , [madam]4152-madam . "[1096-the porters] The passenger lifts , the arrangement for coals ( a great temptation for [a dishonest porter]1097-a dishonest porter ) , were all familiar matters to [her]264-mrs. munt , and perhaps a relief from the politico - economical - esthetic atmosphere that reigned at [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels .

[Margaret]255-margaret received the information calmly , and did not agree that it would throw a cloud over poor [Helen]254-helen s life .

" Oh , but [Helen]254-helen isn t [a girl with no interests]4153-a girl with no interests , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret explained . " [She]254-helen has plenty of other things and [other people to think about]4154-other people to think about . "[255-margaret]

" For [a clever girl]4156-a clever girl , [dear]3859-dear , how very oddly [you]3859-dear do talk . " Of course [she]254-helen must bow . But look here ; let s do the flowers . [I]255-margaret was going to say , the will to be interested in [him]4159-him has died , and what else matters ? CHAPTER VIII

The friendship between [Margaret]255-margaret and [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox , which was to develop so quickly and with such strange results , may perhaps have had its beginnings at [Speyer]6-speyer , in the spring . Perhaps [the elder lady]1132-the elder lady , as [she]1132-the elder lady gazed at [the vulgar , ruddy cathedral]1133-the vulgar , ruddy cathedral , and listened to the talk of [[her]1132-the elder lady husband]1134-her husband and [Helen]254-helen , may have detected in [the other and less charming of [the sisters]775-the sisters]1135-the other and less charming of the sisters a deeper sympathy , a sounder judgment . [She]1132-the elder lady was capable of detecting such things . Perhaps it was [she]1132-the elder lady who had desired [the Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels to be invited to [Howards End]1-howards end , and [Margaret]255-margaret whose presence [she]255-margaret had particularly desired . All this is speculation ; [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox has left few clear indications behind [her]257-mrs. wilcox . It is certain that [she]257-mrs. wilcox came to call at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place a fortnight later , the very day that [Helen]254-helen was going with [[her]254-helen cousin]860-her cousin to [Stettin]49-stettin .

" [Helen]254-helen ! "[285-fraulein mosebach] cried [Fraulein Mosebach]285-fraulein mosebach in awestruck tones ( [she]285-fraulein mosebach was now in [[her]285-fraulein mosebach cousin]860-her cousin s confidence)--"his mother has forgiven [you]254-helen ! "[285-fraulein mosebach] And then , remembering that in [England]34-england [the new - comer]1139-the new - comer ought not to call before [she]1139-the new - comer is called upon , [she]285-fraulein mosebach changed [her]285-fraulein mosebach tone from awe to disapproval , and opined that [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox was [keine Dame]331-keine dame .

[A male]1140-a male -- [even such a male as [Tibby]259-tibby]1141-even such a male as tibby -- was enough to stop the foolery . The barrier of sex , though decreasing among [the civilised]1142-the civilised , is still high , and higher on the side of [women]743-women . [Helen]254-helen could tell [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister all , and [[her]254-helen cousin]860-her cousin much about [Paul]256-paul ; [she]254-helen told [[her]254-helen brother]576-her brother nothing . It was not prudishness , for [she]254-helen now spoke of " [the Wilcox ideal]4226-the wilcox ideal "[254-helen] with laughter , and even with a growing brutality . Nor was it precaution , for [Tibby]259-tibby seldom repeated any news that did not concern [himself]259-tibby . It was rather the feeling that [she]254-helen betrayed a secret into the camp of [men]3835-men , and that , however trivial it was on this side of the barrier , it would become important on that . So [she]254-helen stopped , or rather began to fool on other subjects , until [[her]254-helen long - suffering relatives]1148-her long - suffering relatives drove [her]254-helen [upstairs]575-upstairs . "[285-fraulein mosebach]

That evening [Margaret]255-margaret took decisive action . [The house]3796-the house was very quiet , and the fog -- [we]1153-we are in [November]68-november now -- pressed against the windows like an excluded ghost . [Frieda]287-frieda and [Helen]254-helen and all [their]1154-their luggages had gone . [Tibby]259-tibby , who was not feeling well , lay stretched on a sofa by the fire . [Margaret]255-margaret sat by [him]259-tibby , thinking . [Her]255-margaret mind darted from impulse to impulse , and finally marshalled [them]1155-them all in review . [The practical person]1156-the practical person , who knows what [he]1156-the practical person wants at once , and generally knows nothing else , will accuse [her]255-margaret of indecision . But this was the way [her]255-margaret mind worked . And when [she]255-margaret did act , [no one]633-no one could accuse [her]255-margaret of indecision then . [She]255-margaret hit out as lustily as if [she]255-margaret had not considered the matter at all . The letter that [she]255-margaret wrote [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox glowed with the native hue of resolution . The pale cast of thought was with [her]255-margaret a breath rather than a tarnish , a breath that leaves the colours all the more vivid when it has been wiped away .

" [DEAR MRS . WILCOX]512-mrs. wilcox , "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret have to write something discourteous . It would be better if [we]4228-we did not meet . "[255-margaret]

" [I]889-the youth fear that [you]512-mrs. wilcox will not agree with this ; indeed , [I]889-the youth know that [you]512-mrs. wilcox will not , since [you]512-mrs. wilcox have been good enough to call on [us]4228-we . " [M. J. SCHLEGEL]334-m. j. schlegel . "[255-margaret]

" [RUTH WILCOX]256-paul . "[255-margaret]

[Margaret]255-margaret s cheeks burnt . [She]255-margaret could not finish [her]255-margaret breakfast . [She]255-margaret was on fire with shame . [Helen]254-helen had told [her]255-margaret that [the youth]889-the youth was leaving [England]34-england , but other things had seemed more important , and [she]255-margaret had forgotten . All [her]255-margaret absurd anxieties fell to the ground , and in [their]1159-their place arose the certainty that [she]255-margaret had been rude to [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox . Rudeness affected [Margaret]255-margaret like a bitter taste in the mouth . It poisoned life . At times it is necessary , but woe to [those who employ it without due need]1160-those who employ it without due need . [She]255-margaret flung on a hat and shawl , just like [a poor woman]1161-a poor woman , and plunged into the fog , which still continued . [Her]255-margaret lips were compressed , the letter remained in [her]255-margaret hand , and in this state [she]255-margaret crossed [the street]951-the street , entered [the marble vestibule of [the flats]945-the flats]1163-the marble vestibule of the flats , eluded [the concierges]1165-the concierges , and ran up the stairs till [she]255-margaret reached [the second floor]1166-the second floor . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox bowed gravely . [She]512-mrs. wilcox was offended , and did not pretend to the contrary . The conversation again shifted . At the time it seemed little more than aimless chatter . [She]1180-she was interested when [[her]1180-she hostess]1181-her hostess explained that [Howards End]1-howards end was [[her]1180-she own property]1182-her own property . [Margaret]255-margaret could not bear being bored . [She]255-margaret grew inattentive , played with the photograph frame , dropped it , smashed [Dolly]1184-dolly s glass , apologised , was pardoned , cut [her]255-margaret finger thereon , was pitied , and finally said [she]255-margaret must be going -- there was all [the housekeeping]1185-the housekeeping to do , and [she]255-margaret had to interview [[Tibby]259-tibby s riding - master]1186-tibby s riding - master .

Then the curious note was struck again .

" Good - bye , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , good - bye . Thank [you]254-helen for coming . [You]254-helen have cheered [me]255-margaret up . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret m so glad ! "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret wonder . [I]255-margaret wondered at [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret M sure ! "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret almost think-- "[255-margaret]

" Yes ? "[255-margaret] asked [Margaret]255-margaret , for there was a long pause -- a pause that was somehow akin to the flicker of the fire , the quiver of the reading - lamp upon [their]1188-their hands , the white blur from the window ; a pause of shifting and eternal shadows .

" [I]255-margaret almost think [you]254-helen forget [you]254-helen re [a girl]4170-a girl . "[255-margaret]

[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox smiled .

CHAPTER IX

[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox can not be accused of giving [Margaret]255-margaret much information about life . And [Margaret]255-margaret , on the other hand , has made a fair show of modesty , and has pretended to an inexperience that [she]255-margaret certainly did not feel . [She]255-margaret had kept [house]1015-house for over ten years ; [she]255-margaret had entertained , almost with distinction ; [she]255-margaret had brought up [a charming sister]1190-a charming sister , and was bringing up [a brother]1191-a brother . Surely , if experience is attainable , [she]255-margaret had attained it . Yet the little luncheon - party that [she]255-margaret gave in [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox s honour was not a success . [The new friend]1192-the new friend did not blend with [the " one or two delightful people "[1193-the " one or two delightful people " who had been asked to meet her] who had been asked to meet [her]255-margaret]1193-the " one or two delightful people " who had been asked to meet her , and the atmosphere was one of polite bewilderment . [Her]255-margaret tastes were simple , [her]255-margaret knowledge of culture slight , and [she]255-margaret was not interested in [the New English Art Club]1194-the new english art club , nor in the dividing - line between Journalism and Literature , which was started as a conversational hare . [The delightful people]1195-the delightful people darted after it with cries of joy , [Margaret]255-margaret leading [them]1195-the delightful people , and not till the meal was half over did [they]1195-the delightful people realise that [the principal guest]1196-the principal guest had taken no part in the chase . There was no common topic . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , whose life had been spent in the service of [husband]1197-husband and [sons]1198-sons , had little to say to [strangers who had never shared it , and whose age was half [her]255-margaret own]1199-strangers who had never shared it , and whose age was half her own . Clever talk alarmed [her]512-mrs. wilcox , and withered [her]512-mrs. wilcox delicate imaginings ; it was the social counterpart of [a motor - car]1200-a motor - car , all jerks , and [she]512-mrs. wilcox was a wisp of hay , a flower . Twice [she]512-mrs. wilcox deplored the weather , twice criticised the train service on [the Great Northern Railway]1201-the great northern railway . [They]1195-the delightful people vigorously assented , and rushed on , and when [she]512-mrs. wilcox inquired whether there was any news of [Helen]254-helen , [[her]512-mrs. wilcox hostess]1181-her hostess was too much occupied in placing [Rothenstein]344-rothenstein to answer . "[255-margaret] [Margaret]255-margaret checked [herself]255-margaret and said , " Yes , thank [you]255-margaret ; [I]255-margaret heard on Tuesday . "[255-margaret] But the demon of vociferation was in [her]512-mrs. wilcox , and the next moment [she]512-mrs. wilcox was off again .

" Only on Tuesday , for [they]4292-they live right away at [Stettin]49-stettin . Did [you]255-margaret ever know [any one living at [Stettin]49-stettin]4293-any one living at stettin ? "[255-margaret]

" Never , "[512-mrs. wilcox] said [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox gravely , while [[her]512-mrs. wilcox neighbour]1203-her neighbour , [a young man low down in [the Education Office]1205-the education office]1204-a young man low down in the education office , began to discuss what people who lived at [Stettin]49-stettin ought to look like . " [People at [Stettin]49-stettin]4294-people at stettin drop things into [boats]4295-boats out of [overhanging warehouses]4296-overhanging warehouses . [The town]4299-the town isn t interesting , except for a clock that rolls its eyes , and the view of [the Oder]75-the oder , which truly is something special . [The river]4300-the river , or rather [rivers]4301-rivers -- there seem to be dozens of them -- are intense blue , and the plain they run through an intensest green . "[255-margaret]

" Indeed ! That sounds like a most beautiful view , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen . "[1204-a young man low down in the education office]

" So [I]255-margaret say , but [Helen]254-helen , who will muddle things , says no , it s like music . The course of [the Oder]75-the oder is to be like music . "[255-margaret]

" What do [the overhanging warehouses]4304-the overhanging warehouses make of that ? "[717-the man] asked [the man]717-the man , laughing .

" [They]4304-the overhanging warehouses make a great deal of it , "[255-margaret] replied [Margaret]255-margaret , unexpectedly rushing off on a new track . " [I]255-margaret think it s affectation to compare [the Oder]75-the oder to music , and so do [you]512-mrs. wilcox , but [the overhanging warehouses of Stettin]4305-the overhanging warehouses of stettin take beauty seriously , which [we]4306-we don t , and [the average Englishman]4307-the average englishman doesn t , and despises [all who do]4308-all who do . " Is anything gained by that ? "[255-margaret]

" Yes , yes . [The German]327-a german is always on the lookout for beauty . " [I]1207-i am not sure that [I]1207-i agree . Do [you]512-mrs. wilcox ? "[1207-i] said [he]1207-i , turning to [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox .

[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had no idea ; [she]512-mrs. wilcox paid little attention to grounds . [She]512-mrs. wilcox was not intellectual , nor even alert , and it was odd that , all the same , [she]512-mrs. wilcox should give the idea of greatness . [Margaret]255-margaret , zigzagging with [[her]255-margaret friends]1208-her friends over Thought and Art , was conscious of a personality that transcended [their]1208-her friends own and dwarfed [their]1208-her friends activities . Yet [she]255-margaret and daily life were out of focus ; one or the other must show blurred . And at lunch [she]255-margaret seemed more out of focus than usual , and nearer the line that divides daily life from a life that may be of greater importance .

" [You]4317-you will admit , though , that [the Continent]77-the continent -- it seems silly to speak of [the Continent]77-the continent , but really it is all more like [itself]77-the continent than any part of it is like [England]34-england . CHAPTER X

Several days passed .

Was [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox one of [the unsatisfactory people]1218-the unsatisfactory people -- there are many of [them]1218-the unsatisfactory people -- who dangle intimacy and then withdraw it ? [They]1218-the unsatisfactory people evoke [our]1219-our interests and affections , and keep the life of the spirit dawdling round [them]1218-the unsatisfactory people . Then [they]1218-the unsatisfactory people withdraw . When physical passion is involved , there is a definite name for such behaviour -- flirting -- and if carried far enough it is punishable by law . But no law -- not public opinion even -- punishes [those who coquette with friendship]1220-those who coquette with friendship , though the dull ache that [they]1218-the unsatisfactory people inflict , the sense of misdirected effort and exhaustion , may be as intolerable . Was [she]255-margaret one of these ?

[Margaret]255-margaret feared so at first , for , with [a Londoner]350-a londoner s impatience , [she]255-margaret wanted everything to be settled up immediately . [She]255-margaret mistrusted the periods of quiet that are essential to true growth . Desiring to book [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox as [a friend]1221-a friend , [she]255-margaret pressed on the ceremony , pencil , as it were , in hand , pressing the more because [the rest of [the family]1117-the family]1222-the rest of the family were away , and the opportunity seemed favourable . But [the elder woman]1224-the elder woman would not be hurried . [She]255-margaret refused to fit in with [the [Wickham]79-wickham Place set]1225-the wickham place set , or to reopen discussion of [Helen]254-helen and [Paul]256-paul , whom [Margaret]255-margaret would have utilised as a short - cut . [She]255-margaret took [her]255-margaret time , or perhaps let time take [her]255-margaret , and when the crisis did come all was ready .

The crisis opened with a message : Would [Miss Schlegel]254-helen come shopping ? Christmas was nearing , and [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox felt behindhand with the presents . [She]255-margaret had taken some more days in bed , and must make up for lost time . [Margaret]255-margaret accepted , and at eleven o clock one cheerless morning [they]1226-we started out in a brougham .

" First of all , "[255-margaret] began [Margaret]255-margaret , " [we]1226-we must make a list and tick off [the people]4342-the people s names . [[My]255-margaret aunt]4230-my aunt always does , and this fog may thicken up any moment . Have [you]512-mrs. wilcox any ideas ? "[255-margaret]

" [I]512-mrs. wilcox thought [we]1226-we would go to [Harrods]80-harrods or [the Haymarket Stores]4344-the haymarket stores , "[512-mrs. wilcox] said [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox rather hopelessly . " Everything is sure to be there . [I]512-mrs. wilcox am not [a good shopper]4345-a good shopper . The din is so confusing , and [[your]255-margaret aunt]3965-your aunt is quite right -- [one]3797-one ought to make a list . Take [my]512-mrs. wilcox notebook , then , and write [your]255-margaret own name at the top of the page . "[512-mrs. wilcox]

" Oh , hooray ! "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , writing it . " How very kind of [you]255-margaret to start with [me]255-margaret ! "[255-margaret] But [she]255-margaret did not want to receive anything expensive . [Their]1227-their acquaintance was singular rather than intimate , and [she]255-margaret divined that [the Wilcox clan]1228-the wilcox clan would resent any expenditure on [outsiders]678-outsiders ; [the more compact families]1230-the more compact families do . [She]255-margaret did not want to be thought a second [Helen]254-helen , who would snatch presents since [she]254-helen could not snatch [young men]855-young men , nor to be exposed like [a second Aunt Juley]1232-a second aunt juley , to the insults of [Charles]258-charles . A certain austerity of demeanour was best , and [she]255-margaret added : " [I]255-margaret don t really want a Yuletide gift , though . In fact , [I]255-margaret d rather not . "[255-margaret]

" Why ? "[255-margaret]

" Because [I]255-margaret ve odd ideas about [Christmas]351-christmas . Because [I]255-margaret have all that money can buy . [I]255-margaret want [more people]4348-more people , but no more things . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret should like to give [you]255-margaret something worth [your]255-margaret acquaintance , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , in memory of [your]255-margaret kindness to [me]255-margaret during [my]255-margaret lonely fortnight . It has so happened that [I]255-margaret have been left alone , and [you]255-margaret have stopped [me]255-margaret from brooding . [I]255-margaret am too apt to brood . "[255-margaret]

" If that is so , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , " if [I]255-margaret have happened to be of use to [you]255-margaret , which [I]255-margaret didn t know , [you]255-margaret can not pay [me]255-margaret back with anything tangible . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret suppose not , but [one]3797-one would like to . Perhaps [I]255-margaret shall think of something as [we]1234-they go about . "[255-margaret]

[Her]1233-her name remained at the head of the list , but nothing was written opposite it . [They]1234-they drove from [shop]1235-shop to [shop]1235-shop . The air was white , and when [they]1234-they alighted it tasted like cold pennies . At times [they]1234-they passed through a clot of grey . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox s vitality was low that morning , and it was [Margaret]255-margaret who decided on a horse for [this little girl]1237-this little girl , a golliwog for that , for [[the rector]1238-the rector s wife]1239-the rector s wife a copper warming - tray . " [We]1234-they always give [the servants]4350-the servants money . "[1239-the rector s wife] " Yes , do [you]1238-the rector , yes , much easier , "[255-margaret] replied [Margaret]255-margaret but felt the grotesque impact of the unseen upon [the seen]1240-the seen , and saw issuing from [a forgotten manger at Bethlehem this torrent of coins and toys]1241-a forgotten manger at bethlehem this torrent of coins and toys . Vulgarity reigned . [Public - houses]1242-public - houses , besides [their]1242-public - houses usual exhortation against temperance reform , invited [men]3835-men to " Join [our]1234-they Christmas goose club"--one[1242-public - houses] bottle of gin , etc . , or two , according to subscription . A poster of [a woman in tights]1244-a woman in tights heralded the Christmas pantomime , and [little red devils , who had come in again that year]1245-little red devils , who had come in again that year , were prevalent upon the Christmas - cards . [Margaret]255-margaret was [no morbid idealist]1246-no morbid idealist . [She]255-margaret did not wish this spate of business and self - advertisement checked . It was only the occasion of it that struck [her]255-margaret with amazement annually . How [many of [these vacillating shoppers]1248-these vacillating shoppers]1247-many of these vacillating shoppers and [tired shop - assistants]1249-tired shop - assistants realised that it was a divine event that drew [them]1247-many of these vacillating shoppers together ? [She]255-margaret realised it , though standing outside in the matter . [She]255-margaret was not [a Christian]1250-a christian in the accepted sense ; [she]255-margaret did not believe that [God]274-god had ever worked among [us]1251-we as [a young artisan]1252-a young artisan . [These people]1043-these people , or [most of [them]1043-these people]1254-most of them , believed it , and if pressed , would affirm it in words . But the visible signs of [their]1043-these people belief were [Regent Street]81-regent street or [Drury Lane]82-drury lane , a little mud displaced , a little money spent , a little food cooked , eaten , and forgotten . Inadequate . But in public who shall express the unseen adequately ? It is private life that holds out the mirror to infinity ; personal intercourse , and that alone , that ever hints at a personality beyond [our]1251-we daily vision .

" No , [I]255-margaret do like Christmas on the whole , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret announced . " In its clumsy way , it does approach Peace and Goodwill . But oh , it is clumsier every year . "[255-margaret]

" Is it ? [I]1260-a friend , bent on the same errand am only used to country Christmases . "[1260-a friend , bent on the same errand]

" [We]1251-we are usually in [London]2-london , and play the game with vigour -- carols at [the Abbey]4351-the abbey , clumsy midday meal , clumsy dinner for [the maids]4060-the maids , followed by Christmas - tree and dancing of [poor children]4353-poor children , with songs from [Helen]254-helen . [The drawing - room]4101-the drawing - room does very well for that . [We]1251-we put the tree in [the powder - closet]4355-the powder - closet , and draw a curtain when the candles are lighted , and with the looking - glass behind it looks quite pretty . [I]255-margaret wish [we]1251-we might have [a powder - closet in [[our]1251-we next house]4357-our next house]4356-a powder - closet in our next house . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox was silenced . In growing discomfort [they]1266-they drove homewards . [The city]1004-the city seemed Satanic , [the narrower streets]1268-the narrower streets oppressing like [the galleries of [a mine]1270-a mine]1269-the galleries of a mine .

No harm was done by the fog to trade , for it lay high , and the lighted windows of [the shops]1271-the shops were thronged with [customers]1272-customers . It was rather a darkening of the spirit which fell back upon itself , to find a more grievous darkness within . [Margaret]255-margaret nearly spoke a dozen times , but something throttled [her]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret felt petty and awkward , and [her]255-margaret meditations on Christmas grew more cynical . Peace ? It may bring other gifts , but is there [a single Londoner to whom Christmas is peaceful]1273-a single londoner to whom christmas is peaceful ? The craving for excitement and for elaboration has ruined that blessing . Goodwill ? Had [she]255-margaret seen any example of it in [the hordes of [purchasers]1275-purchasers]1274-the hordes of purchasers ? Or in [herself]255-margaret ? [She]255-margaret had failed to respond to this invitation merely because it was a little queer and imaginative -- [she]255-margaret , whose birthright it was to nourish imagination ! Better to have accepted , to have tired [themselves]1266-they a little by the journey , than coldly to reply , " Might [I]255-margaret come some other day ? "[255-margaret] [Her]255-margaret cynicism left [her]255-margaret . There would be no other day . [This shadowy woman]1276-this shadowy woman would never ask [her]255-margaret again .

[They]1277-they parted at [the Mansions]1278-the mansions . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox went in after due civilities , and [Margaret]255-margaret watched [the tall , lonely figure]1279-the tall , lonely figure sweep up [the hall]948-the hall to [the lift]1281-the lift . As the glass doors closed on it [she]255-margaret had the sense of an imprisonment The beautiful head disappeared first , still buried in the muff ; the long trailing skirt followed . [A woman of undefinable rarity]1282-a woman of undefinable rarity was going up heavenward , like [a specimen in a bottle]1283-a specimen in a bottle . And into what a heaven -- a vault as of hell , sooty black , from which soot descended !

At lunch [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother , seeing [her]255-margaret inclined for silence insisted on talking . [Tibby]259-tibby was not ill - natured , but from babyhood something drove [him]259-tibby to do the unwelcome and the unexpected . Now [he]259-tibby gave [her]255-margaret a long account of the day - school that [he]259-tibby sometimes patronised . The account was interesting , and [she]255-margaret had often pressed [him]259-tibby for it before , but [she]255-margaret could not attend now , for [her]255-margaret mind was focussed on the invisible . [She]255-margaret discerned that [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , though [a loving wife]1285-a loving wife and [mother]3944-mother , had only one passion in life -- [[her]512-mrs. wilcox house]1287-her house -- and that the moment was solemn when [she]255-margaret invited [a friend]1221-a friend to share this passion with [her]255-margaret . To answer " another day "[3951-a fool] was to answer as [a fool]3951-a fool . " Another day "[3951-a fool] will do for brick and mortar , but not for the Holy of Holies into which [Howards End]1-howards end had been transfigured . [Her]255-margaret own curiosity was slight . [She]255-margaret had heard more than enough about it in the summer . The nine windows , the vine , and the wych - elm had no pleasant connections for [her]255-margaret , and [she]255-margaret would have preferred to spend the afternoon at a concert . But imagination triumphed . While [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother held forth [she]255-margaret determined to go , at whatever cost , and to compel [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox to go , too . When lunch was over [she]255-margaret stepped over to [the flats]945-the flats .

[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had just gone away for the night .

[Margaret]255-margaret said that it was of no consequence , hurried [downstairs]578-downstairs , and took a hansom to [King s Cross]15-king s cross . [She]255-margaret was convinced that the escapade was important , though it would have puzzled [her]255-margaret to say why . There was question of imprisonment and escape , and though [she]255-margaret did not know the time of [the train]3864-the train , [she]255-margaret strained [her]255-margaret eyes for [St. Pancras]25-st. pancras s clock .

CHAPTER XI

The funeral was over . [The carriages]1310-the carriages had rolled away through the soft mud , and only [the poor]906-the poor remained . [They]1309-both of them approached to the newly - dug shaft and looked [their]1309-both of them last at the coffin , now almost hidden beneath the spadefuls of clay . It was [their]1309-both of them moment . [Most of [them]1309-both of them]1254-most of them were [women from [the dead woman]1314-the dead woman s district]1313-women from the dead woman s district , to whom black garments had been served out by [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles s orders . Pure curiosity had brought [others]802-others . [They]1309-both of them thrilled with the excitement of a death , and of a rapid death , and stood in groups or moved between the graves , like drops of ink . [The son of one of [them]1309-both of them]1316-the son of one of them , [a wood - cutter]1317-a wood - cutter , was perched high above [their]1309-both of them heads , pollarding one of the churchyard elms . From where [he]1316-the son of one of them sat [he]1316-the son of one of them could see [the village of [Hilton]32-hilton]1318-the village of hilton , strung upon [the North Road]33-the north road , with [[its]33-the north road [accreting suburbs]1320-accreting suburbs]1319-its accreting suburbs ; the sunset beyond , scarlet and orange , winking at [him]1316-the son of one of them beneath brows of grey ; [the church]1321-the church ; [the plantations]1322-the plantations ; and behind [him]1316-the son of one of them [an unspoilt country of [fields and farms]1324-fields and farms]1323-an unspoilt country of fields and farms . But [he]1316-the son of one of them , too , was rolling the event luxuriously in [his]1316-the son of one of them mouth . [He]1316-the son of one of them tried to tell [[his]1316-the son of one of them mother]1325-his mother down below all that [he]1316-the son of one of them had felt when [he]1316-the son of one of them saw the coffin approaching : how [he]1316-the son of one of them could not leave [his]1316-the son of one of them work , and yet did not like to go on with it ; how [he]1316-the son of one of them had almost slipped out of the tree , [he]1316-the son of one of them was so upset ; [the rooks]1326-the rooks had cawed , and no wonder -- it was as if [rooks]1327-rooks knew too . [[His]1316-the son of one of them mother]1325-his mother claimed the prophetic power [herself]1325-his mother -- [she]1325-his mother had seen a strange look about [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox for some time . [London]2-london had done the mischief , said [others]802-others . [She]1325-his mother had been [a kind lady]1330-a kind lady ; [[her]1325-his mother grandmother]1331-her grandmother had been kind , too -- [a plainer person , but very kind]1332-a plainer person , but very kind . Ah , [the old sort]1333-the old sort was dying out ! [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles , [he]258-charles was [a kind gentleman]1334-a kind gentleman . [They]1335-they advanced to the topic again and again , dully , but with exaltation . The funeral of [a rich person]1336-a rich person was to [them]1335-they what the funeral of [Alcestis]356-alcestis or [Ophelia]357-ophelia is to [the educated]1337-the educated . It was Art ; though remote from life , it enhanced life s values , and [they]1335-they witnessed it avidly .

[The grave - diggers]1338-the grave - diggers , who had kept up an undercurrent of disapproval -- [they]1338-the grave - diggers disliked [Charles]258-charles ; it was not a moment to speak of such things , but [they]1338-the grave - diggers did not like [Charles Wilcox]258-charles -- [the grave - diggers]1338-the grave - diggers finished [their]1338-the grave - diggers work and piled up the wreaths and crosses above it . The sun set over [Hilton]32-hilton ; the grey brows of the evening flushed a little , and were cleft with one scarlet frown . Chattering sadly to [each other]3998-each other , [the mourners]1341-the mourners passed through the lych - gate and traversed [the chestnut avenues that led down to [the village]3925-the village]1342-the chestnut avenues that led down to the village . [The young wood - cutter]1344-the young wood - cutter stayed a little longer , poised above the silence and swaying rhythmically . At last the bough fell beneath [his]1344-the young wood - cutter saw . With a grunt , [he]1344-the young wood - cutter descended , [his]1344-the young wood - cutter thoughts dwelling no longer on death , but on love , for [he]1344-the young wood - cutter was mating . [He]1344-the young wood - cutter stopped as [he]1344-the young wood - cutter passed [the new grave]1345-the new grave ; a sheaf of tawny chrysanthemums had caught [his]1344-the young wood - cutter eye . " [They]4401-they didn t ought to have coloured flowers at buryings , "[1344-the young wood - cutter] [he]1344-the young wood - cutter reflected . Trudging on a few steps , [he]1344-the young wood - cutter stopped again , looked furtively at the dusk , turned back , wrenched a chrysanthemum from the sheaf , and hid it in [his]1344-the young wood - cutter pocket .

After [him]1344-the young wood - cutter came silence absolute . [[The cottage]1346-the cottage that abutted on [the churchyard]1348-the churchyard]1347-the cottage that abutted on the churchyard was empty , and [no other house]1349-no other house stood near . Hour after hour the scene of the interment remained without an eye to witness it . Clouds drifted over [it]1350-it from the west ; or [the church]1321-the church may have been [a ship]1352-a ship , high - prowed , steering with all its company towards infinity . Towards morning the air grew colder , the sky clearer , the surface of the earth hard and sparkling above the prostrate dead . [The wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy]1353-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy , reflected : " [They]4402-they lilies , they chrysants ; it s a pity [I]1353-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy didn t take them all . "[1353-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy]

Up at [Howards End]1-howards end [they]1354-they were attempting breakfast . [Charles]258-charles and [Evie]262-evie sat in [the dining - room]3978-the dining - room , with [Mrs. Charles]359-charles . [[Their]1354-they father]788-their father , who could not bear to see a face , breakfasted [upstairs]575-upstairs . [He]788-their father suffered acutely . Pain came over [him]788-their father in spasms , as if it was physical , and even while [he]788-their father was about to eat , [his]788-their father eyes would fill with tears , and [he]788-their father would lay down the morsel untasted .

[He]788-their father remembered [[his]788-their father wife]1358-his wife s even goodness during thirty years . Not anything in detail -- not courtship or early raptures -- but just the unvarying virtue , that seemed to [him]788-their father [a woman]1045-a woman s noblest quality . [So many women]1360-so many women are capricious , breaking into odd flaws of passion or frivolity . Not so [[his]788-their father wife]1358-his wife . Year after year , summer and winter , as [bride]1362-bride and [mother]3944-mother , [she]1358-his wife had been the same , [he]788-their father had always trusted [her]1358-his wife . [Her]1358-his wife tenderness ! [Her]1358-his wife innocence ! The wonderful innocence that was [hers]1358-his wife by the gift of [God]274-god . [Ruth]354-ruth knew no more of worldly wickedness and wisdom than did the flowers in [[her]354-ruth garden]1364-her garden , or the grass in [[her]354-ruth field]1365-her field . [Her]354-ruth idea of business--"Henry , why do [people who have enough money]4403-people who have enough money try to get more money ? "[354-ruth] [Her]354-ruth idea of politics--"I am sure that if [the mothers of [various nations]4405-various nations]4404-the mothers of various nations could meet , there would be no more wars , "[354-ruth] [Her]354-ruth idea of religion -- ah , this had been a cloud , but a cloud that passed . [She]354-ruth came of Quaker stock , and [he]788-their father and [[his]788-their father family]804-his family , formerly [Dissenters]1367-dissenters , were now [members of [the Church of England]88-the church of england]1368-members of the church of england . [The rector]1238-the rector s sermons had at first repelled [her]354-ruth , and [she]354-ruth had expressed a desire for " a more inward light , "[354-ruth] adding , " not so much for [myself]359-charles as for [baby]4406-baby "[359-charles] ( [Charles]359-charles ) . Inward light must have been granted , for [he]788-their father heard no complaints in later years . [They]1370-they brought up [[their]1370-they three children]1371-their three children without dispute . [They]1370-they had never disputed .

[She]354-ruth lay under [the earth]1372-the earth now . [She]354-ruth had gone , and as if to make [her]354-ruth going the more bitter , had gone with a touch of mystery that was all unlike [her]354-ruth . " Why didn t [you]354-ruth tell [me]788-their father [you]354-ruth knew of it ? "[788-their father] [he]788-their father had moaned , and [her]354-ruth faint voice had answered : " [I]788-their father didn t want to , [Henry]355-henry -- [I]788-their father might have been wrong -- and [every one]4407-every one hates illnesses . "[788-their father] [He]788-their father had been told of the horror by [a strange doctor , whom [she]354-ruth had consulted during [his]788-their father absence from [town]4380-town]1373-a strange doctor , whom she had consulted during his absence from town . Was this altogether just ? Without fully explaining , [she]354-ruth had died . It was a fault on [her]354-ruth part , and -- tears rushed into [his]788-their father eyes -- what a little fault ! It was the only time [she]354-ruth had deceived [him]788-their father in those thirty years .

[He]788-their father rose to [his]788-their father feet and looked out of the window , for [Evie]262-evie had come in with the letters , and [he]788-their father could meet [no one]633-no one s eye . Ah yes -- [she]354-ruth had been [a good woman]1376-a good woman -- [she]354-ruth had been steady . [He]788-their father chose the word deliberately . To [him]788-their father steadiness included all praise . [He]788-their father [himself]788-their father , gazing at [the wintry garden]1377-the wintry garden , is in appearance [a steady man]1378-a steady man . [His]788-their father face was not as square as [[his]788-their father son]1379-his son s , and , indeed , the chin , though firm enough in outline , retreated a little , and the lips , ambiguous , were curtained by a moustache . But there was no external hint of weakness . The eyes , if capable of kindness and good - fellowship , if ruddy for the moment with tears , were the eyes of [one who could not be driven]1380-one who could not be driven . The forehead , too , was like [Charles]359-charles s. High and straight , brown and polished , merging abruptly into temples and skull , it had the effect of a bastion that protected [his]788-their father head from [the world]745-the world . At times it had the effect of a blank wall . [He]788-their father had dwelt behind [it]1382-it , intact and happy , for fifty years . " [Father]353-father s eaten nothing , "[877-the girl] [she]877-the girl announced , sitting down with wrinkled brows behind the tea - urn .

"[788-their father] Then [he]788-their father took up the Times , and for some time there was no sound except the clink of cup against saucer and of knife on plate .

[Poor Mrs. Charles]359-charles sat between [her]359-charles silent companions terrified at the course of events , and a little bored . [She]359-charles was [a rubbishy little creature]1386-a rubbishy little creature , and [she]359-charles knew it . A telegram had dragged [her]359-charles from [Naples]71-naples to the death - bed of [a woman whom [she]359-charles had scarcely known]1387-a woman whom she had scarcely known . A word from [[her]359-charles husband]1134-her husband had plunged [her]359-charles into mourning . [She]359-charles desired to mourn inwardly as well , but [she]359-charles wished that [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , since fated to die , could have died before the marriage , for then less would have been expected of [her]359-charles . [Brother]363-brother and [sister]1393-sister were not callous . [They]1394-they spoke thus , partly because [they]1394-they desired to keep [Chalkeley]362-chalkeley up to the mark -- a healthy desire in its way -- partly because [they]1394-they avoided the personal note in life . [All Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes did . It did not seem to [them]260-the wilcoxes of supreme importance . Or it may be as [Helen]254-helen supposed : [they]1394-they realised its importance , but were afraid of it . Panic and emptiness , could one glance behind . [They]1394-they were not callous , and [they]1394-they left the breakfast - table with aching hearts . [[Their]1394-they mother]1395-their mother never had come in to breakfast . It was in [the other rooms]1396-the other rooms , and especially in [the garden]3800-the garden , that [they]1394-they felt [her]1395-their mother loss most . As [Charles]359-charles went out to [the garage]1398-the garage , [he]363-brother was reminded at every step of [the woman who had loved [him]363-brother and whom [he]363-brother could never replace]1399-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace . How [she]1395-their mother had disliked improvements , yet how loyally [she]1395-their mother had accepted them when made ! [He]363-brother and [[his]363-brother father]3994-his father -- what trouble [they]1394-they had had to get [this very garage]1401-this very garage ! And so with [Evie]262-evie , as [she]262-evie stood talking to [the cook]1404-the cook . [Their]1394-they grief , though less poignant than [[their]1394-they father]788-their father s , grew from deeper roots , for [a wife]1409-a wife may be replaced ; [a mother]1410-a mother never . [Charles]359-charles would go back to [the office]3911-the office . There was little at [Howards End]1-howards end . The contents of [[his]717-the man mother]1325-his mother s will had long been known to [them]1394-they . There were no legacies , no annuities , none of the posthumous bustle with which some of [the dead]1413-the dead prolong [their]1394-they activities . Trusting [[her]1405-her mother husband]1134-her husband , [she]1405-her mother had left [him]1134-her husband everything without reserve . [Her]1405-her mother watercolours [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles intended to reserve for [Paul]256-paul , while [Evie]262-evie would take the jewellery and lace . How easily [she]1405-her mother slipped out of life ! [Charles]258-charles thought the habit laudable , though [he]258-charles did not intend to adopt it [himself]258-charles , whereas [Margaret]255-margaret would have seen in it an almost culpable indifference to earthly fame . Cynicism -- not the superficial cynicism that snarls and sneers , but the cynicism that can go with courtesy and tenderness -- that was the note of [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox s will . [She]1405-her mother wanted not to vex [people]3992-people . That accomplished , [the earth]1372-the earth might freeze over [her]1405-her mother for ever .

No , there was nothing for [Charles]258-charles to wait for . In silence [they]1453-they drew up to the breakfast - table . The events of yesterday -- indeed , of this morning suddenly receded into a past so remote that [they]1453-they seemed scarcely to have lived in it . Heavy breathings were heard . [They]1453-they were calming [themselves]1453-they . [Charles]258-charles , to steady [them]1453-they further , read the enclosure out loud : " A note in [[my]258-charles mother]4456-my mother s handwriting , in an envelope addressed to [[my]258-charles father]3913-my father , sealed . Inside : [I]258-charles should like [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ( [Margaret]255-margaret ) to have Howards End . No date , no signature . Forwarded through [the matron of [that nursing home]4459-that nursing home]4458-the matron of that nursing home . Now , the question is-- "[258-charles]

[Dolly]1454-dolly interrupted [him]258-charles . " But [I]1454-dolly say that note isn t legal . [Houses]4042-houses ought to be done by [a lawyer]4461-a lawyer , [Charles]258-charles , surely . "[1454-dolly]

[[Her]1454-dolly husband]1134-her husband worked [his]258-charles jaw severely . Little lumps appeared in front of either ear -- a symptom that [she]1454-dolly had not yet learnt to respect , and [she]1454-dolly asked whether [she]1454-dolly might see the note . [Charles]258-charles looked at [[his]258-charles father]3994-his father for permission , who said abstractedly , " Give it [her]1454-dolly . "[258-charles] [She]1454-dolly seized it , and at once exclaimed : " Why , it s only in pencil ! [I]1454-dolly said so . Pencil never counts . "[1454-dolly]

" [We]4462-we know that it is not legally binding , [Dolly]4463-dolly , "[258-charles] said [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles , speaking from out of [[his]258-charles fortress]1457-his fortress . " [We]4462-we are aware of that . Legally , [I]258-charles should be justified in tearing it up and throwing it into the fire . Of course , [[my]258-charles dear]3879-my dear , [we]4462-we consider [you]4463-dolly as [one of [the family]1117-the family]4465-one of the family , but it will be better if [you]4463-dolly do not interfere with what [you]4463-dolly do not understand . "[258-charles]

[Charles]258-charles , vexed both with [[his]258-charles father]3994-his father and [[his]258-charles wife]1358-his wife , then repeated : " The question is-- "[258-charles] [He]258-charles had cleared a space of the breakfast - table from plates and knives , so that [he]258-charles could draw patterns on the tablecloth . " The question is whether [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , during the fortnight [we]4462-we were all away , whether [she]254-helen unduly-- "[258-charles] [He]258-charles stopped .

" [I]3994-his father don t think that , "[3994-his father] said [[his]258-charles father]3994-his father , whose nature was nobler than [[his]3994-his father son]1379-his son s.

" Don t think what ? "[258-charles]

" That [she]254-helen would have -- that it is a case of undue influence . No , to [my]3994-his father mind the question is the -- the invalid s condition at the time [she]254-helen wrote . "[3994-his father]

" [[My]258-charles dear father]4467-my dear father , consult [an expert]4468-an expert if [you]4467-my dear father like , but [I]258-charles don t admit it is [[my]258-charles mother]4456-my mother s writing . "[258-charles]

" Why , [you]3994-his father just said it was ! "[1462-dolly] cried [Dolly]1462-dolly .

" Never mind if [I]3994-his father did , "[3994-his father] [he]3994-his father blazed out ; " and hold [your]1463-the poor little wife tongue . "[3994-his father]

[The poor little wife]1463-the poor little wife coloured at this , and , drawing [her]1463-the poor little wife handkerchief from [her]1463-the poor little wife pocket , shed a few tears . [No one]633-no one noticed [her]1463-the poor little wife . [Evie]262-evie was scowling like [an angry boy]1465-an angry boy . [The two men]1466-the two men were gradually assuming the manner of [the committee - room]1467-the committee - room . [They]1466-the two men were both at [their]1466-the two men best when serving on committees . [They]1466-the two men did not make the mistake of handling human affairs in the bulk , but disposed of [them]1466-the two men item by item , sharply . Caligraphy was the item before [them]1466-the two men now , and on it [they]1466-the two men turned [their]1466-the two men well - trained brains . [Charles]258-charles , after a little demur , accepted the writing as genuine , and [they]1466-the two men passed on to the next point . It is the best -- perhaps the only -- way of dodging emotion . [They]1466-the two men were [the average human article]1468-the average human article , and had [they]1466-the two men considered the note as a whole it would have driven [them]1466-the two men miserable or mad . Considered item by item , the emotional content was minimised , and all went forward smoothly . The clock ticked , the coals blazed higher , and contended with the white radiance that poured in through the windows . [Unnoticed]1469-unnoticed , the sun occupied [his]258-charles sky , and the shadows of the tree stems , extraordinarily solid , fell like trenches of purple across [the frosted lawn]1470-the frosted lawn . It was a glorious winter morning . [Evie]262-evie s fox terrier , who had passed for white , was only a dirty grey dog now , so intense was the purity that surrounded [him]258-charles . [He]258-charles was discredited , but the blackbirds that [he]258-charles was chasing glowed with Arabian darkness , for all the conventional colouring of life had been altered . Inside , the clock struck ten with a rich and confident note . Other clocks confirmed it , and the discussion moved towards its close .

To follow it is unnecessary . It is rather a moment when [the commentator]1471-the commentator should step forward . Ought [the Wilcoxes]4005-the wilcoxes to have offered [[their]4005-the wilcoxes home]1473-their home to [Margaret]255-margaret ? [I]3-germany think not . The appeal was too flimsy . It was not legal ; it had been written in illness , and under the spell of a sudden friendship ; it was contrary to [the dead woman]1314-the dead woman s intentions in the past , contrary to [her]1314-the dead woman very nature , so far as that nature was understood by [them]1466-the two men . To [them]1466-the two men [Howards End]1-howards end was [a house]3903-a house : [they]1466-the two men could not know that to [her]1314-the dead woman it had been a spirit , for which [she]1314-the dead woman sought [a spiritual heir]1476-a spiritual heir . And -- pushing one step farther in these mists -- may [they]1466-the two men not have decided even better than [they]1466-the two men supposed ? Is it credible that the possessions of the spirit can be bequeathed at all ? Has the soul offspring ? A wych - elm tree , a vine , a wisp of hay with dew on it -- can passion for such things be transmitted where there is no bond of blood ? No ; [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes are not to be blamed . The problem is too terrific , and [they]1466-the two men could not even perceive a problem . No ; it is natural and fitting that after due debate [they]1466-the two men should tear the note up and throw it on to [[their]1466-the two men dining - room fire]1477-their dining - room fire . [The practical moralist]1478-the practical moralist may acquit [them]1466-the two men absolutely . [He]1478-the practical moralist who strives to look deeper may acquit [them]1466-the two men -- almost . For one hard fact remains . [They]1466-the two men did neglect a personal appeal . [The woman who had died]1479-the woman who had died did say to [them]1466-the two men , " Do this , "[1466-the two men] and [they]1466-the two men answered , " [We]1466-the two men will not . "[1466-the two men]

The incident made a most painful impression on [them]1466-the two men . [Grief]367-grief mounted into the brain and worked there disquietingly . Yesterday [they]1466-the two men had lamented : " [She]1479-the woman who had died was [a dear mother]4470-a dear mother , [a true wife]4471-a true wife ; in [our]1466-the two men absence [she]1479-the woman who had died neglected [her]1479-the woman who had died health and died . "[1466-the two men] To - day [they]1466-the two men thought : " [She]1479-the woman who had died was not as true , as dear , as [we]1466-the two men supposed . "[1466-the two men] The desire for a more inward light had found expression at last , the unseen had impacted on the seen , and all that [they]1466-the two men could say was " Treachery . "[1466-the two men] [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had been treacherous to [the family]1117-the family , to the laws of property , to [her]512-mrs. wilcox own written word . How did [she]512-mrs. wilcox expect [Howards End]1-howards end to be conveyed to [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ? Was [[her]512-mrs. wilcox husband]1134-her husband , to whom it legally belonged , to make it over to [her]512-mrs. wilcox as a free gift ? Was [the said Miss Schlegel]254-helen to have a life interest in it , or to own it absolutely ? Was there to be no compensation for [the garage]1398-the garage and other improvements that [they]1466-the two men had made under the assumption that all would be theirs some day ? Treacherous ! treacherous and absurd ! When [we]1483-we think [the dead]1413-the dead both treacherous and absurd , [we]1483-we have gone far towards reconciling [ourselves]1483-we to [their]1466-the two men departure . That note , scribbled in pencil , sent through [the matron]1451-the matron , was unbusinesslike as well as cruel , and decreased at once the value of [the woman who had written it]1486-the woman who had written it .

" How ? "[1391-his sister] asked [[his]258-charles sister]1391-his sister .
