" What [a horrid woman]4478-a horrid woman ! "[1488-dolly] And [Dolly]1488-dolly , who had recovered , cried , " Why , [she]254-helen may be coming down to turn [us]4479-us out now ! "[1488-dolly]

[Charles]258-charles put [her]1488-dolly right . " [I]258-charles wish [she]254-helen would , "[258-charles] [he]258-charles said ominously . " [I]258-charles could then deal with [her]254-helen . "[258-charles]

" So could [I]3994-his father , "[3994-his father] echoed [[his]258-charles father]3994-his father , who was feeling rather in the cold . [Charles]258-charles had been kind in undertaking the funeral arrangements and in telling [him]3994-his father to eat [his]258-charles breakfast , but [the boy]662-the boy as [he]662-the boy grew up was a little dictatorial , and assumed the post of [chairman]1491-chairman too readily . " [I]1491-chairman could deal with [her]254-helen , if [she]254-helen comes , but [she]254-helen won t come . [You]1491-chairman re all a bit hard on [Miss Schlegel]254-helen . "[1491-chairman]

" That Paul business was pretty scandalous , though . "[1491-chairman]

" [I]1492-i want no more of the Paul business , [Charles]258-charles , as [I]1492-i said at the time , and besides , it is quite apart from this business . [Margaret Schlegel]255-margaret has been officious and tiresome during this terrible week , and [we]4480-we have all suffered under [her]255-margaret , but upon [my]1492-i soul [she]255-margaret s honest . [She]255-margaret s NOT in collusion with [the matron]1451-the matron . [I]1492-i m absolutely certain of it . Nor was [she]255-margaret with [the doctor]577-the doctor , [I]1492-i m equally certain of that . [She]254-helen did not hide anything from [us]4480-we , for up to that very afternoon [she]254-helen was as ignorant as [we]4480-we are . [She]254-helen , like [ourselves]4480-we , was [a dupe--]4483-a dupe-- "[1492-i] [He]1492-i stopped for a moment . " [You]1492-i see , [Charles]258-charles , in [her]254-helen terrible pain [[your]258-charles mother]4439-your mother put [us]4480-we all in false positions . [Charles]258-charles and [[his]258-charles father]3994-his father sometimes disagreed . But [they]1495-they always parted with an increased regard for [one another]3933-one another , and [each]1497-each desired [no doughtier comrade]1498-no doughtier comrade when it was necessary to voyage for a little past the emotions . So [the sailors of [Ulysses]89-ulysses]1499-the sailors of ulysses voyaged past [the Sirens]1500-the sirens , having first stopped [one another]3933-one another s ears with wool .

CHAPTER XII

[Charles]258-charles need not have been anxious . [Miss Schlegel]254-helen had never heard of [[his]258-charles mother]1325-his mother s strange request . [She]254-helen was to hear of it in after years , when [she]254-helen had built up [her]254-helen life differently , and it was to fit into position as the headstone of the corner . [Her]254-helen mind was bent on other questions now , and by [her]254-helen also it would have been rejected as the fantasy of [an invalid]1503-an invalid .

[She]254-helen was parting from [these Wilcoxes]3887-these wilcoxes for the second time . [Paul]256-paul and [[his]256-paul mother]1325-his mother , ripple and great wave , had flowed into [her]254-helen life and ebbed out of it for ever . [The ripple]1506-the ripple had left no traces behind ; the wave had strewn at [her]254-helen feet fragments torn from the unknown . [A curious seeker]1507-a curious seeker , [she]254-helen stood for a while at the verge of [the sea that tells so]1508-the sea that tells so little , but tells a little , and watched the outgoing of this last tremendous tide . [[Her]254-helen friend]1509-her friend had vanished in agony , but not , [she]254-helen believed , in degradation . [Her]254-helen withdrawal had hinted at other things besides disease and pain . Some leave [our]1510-our life with tears , others with an insane frigidity ; [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had taken the middle course , which only rarer natures can pursue . [She]512-mrs. wilcox had kept proportion . [She]512-mrs. wilcox had told a little of [her]512-mrs. wilcox grim secret to [[her]512-mrs. wilcox friends]1208-her friends , but not too much ; [she]512-mrs. wilcox had shut up [her]512-mrs. wilcox heart -- almost , but not entirely . It is thus , if there is any rule , that [we]1510-our ought to die -- neither as [victim]1512-victim nor as fanatic , but as [the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that [he]1514-he is entering , and [the shore]1515-the shore that [he]1514-he must leave]1513-the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that he is entering , and the shore that he must leave .

The last word -- whatever it would be -- had certainly not been said in [Hilton churchyard]1516-hilton churchyard . [She]512-mrs. wilcox had not died [there]884-there . A funeral is not death , any more than baptism is birth or marriage union . All three are the clumsy devices , coming now too late , now too early , by which [Society]1518-society would register the quick motions of [man]3959-man . In [Margaret]255-margaret s eyes [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had escaped registration . [She]512-mrs. wilcox had gone out of life vividly , [her]512-mrs. wilcox own way , and no dust was so truly dust as the contents of that heavy coffin , lowered with ceremonial until it rested on the dust of [the earth]1372-the earth , no flowers so utterly wasted as the chrysanthemums that the frost must have withered before morning . [Margaret]255-margaret had once said [she]255-margaret " loved superstition . "[255-margaret] It was not true . [Few women]1521-few women had tried more earnestly to pierce the accretions in which body and soul are enwrapped . The death of [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had helped [her]255-margaret in [her]255-margaret work . [She]255-margaret saw a little more clearly than hitherto what [a human being]1522-a human being is , and to what [he]1522-a human being may aspire . Truer relationships gleamed . Perhaps the last word would be hope -- hope even on this side of the grave .

Meanwhile , [she]255-margaret could take an interest in [the survivors]1523-the survivors . In spite of [her]255-margaret Christmas duties , in spite of [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother , [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes continued to play a considerable part in [her]255-margaret thoughts . [She]255-margaret had seen so much of [them]260-the wilcoxes in the final week . [They]260-the wilcoxes were not " [[her]255-margaret sort]4490-her sort , "[260-the wilcoxes] [they]260-the wilcoxes were often suspicious and stupid , and deficient where [she]255-margaret excelled ; but collision with [them]260-the wilcoxes stimulated [her]255-margaret , and [she]255-margaret felt an interest that verged into liking , even for [Charles]258-charles . [She]255-margaret desired to protect [them]260-the wilcoxes , and often felt that [they]260-the wilcoxes could protect [her]255-margaret , excelling where [she]255-margaret was deficient . Once past the rocks of emotion , [they]260-the wilcoxes knew so well what to do , whom to send for ; [their]260-the wilcoxes hands were on all the ropes , [they]260-the wilcoxes had grit as well as grittiness and [she]255-margaret valued grit enormously . [They]260-the wilcoxes led a life that [she]255-margaret could not attain to -- the outer life of " telegrams and anger , "[260-the wilcoxes] which had detonated when [Helen]254-helen and [Paul]256-paul had touched in June , and had detonated again the other week . To [Margaret]255-margaret this life was to remain a real force . [She]255-margaret could not despise it , as [Helen]254-helen and [Tibby]259-tibby affected to do . It fostered such virtues as neatness , decision , and obedience , virtues of the second rank , no doubt , but they have formed [our]1525-our civilisation . [They]260-the wilcoxes form character , too ; [Margaret]255-margaret could not doubt it ; [they]260-the wilcoxes keep the soul from becoming sloppy . How dare [Schlegels]267-the schlegels despise [Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes , when it takes all sorts to make [a world]1526-a world ?

" Don t brood too much , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret wrote to [Helen]254-helen , " on the superiority of the unseen to the seen . It s true , but to brood on it is medieval . [Our]1525-our business is not to contrast [the two]1179-the two , but to reconcile [them]1179-the two . "[255-margaret]

[Helen]254-helen replied that [she]254-helen had no intention of brooding on such a dull subject . What did [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister take [her]254-helen for ? The weather was magnificent . [She]254-helen and [the Mosebachs]370-the mosebachs had gone tobogganing on [the only hill that [Pomerania]90-pomerania]1528-the only hill that pomerania boasted . It was fun , but over - crowded , for [the rest of [Pomerania]90-pomerania]1529-the rest of pomerania had gone [there]884-there too . [Helen]254-helen loved [the country]4215-the country , and [her]254-helen letter glowed with physical exercise and poetry . [She]254-helen spoke of the scenery , quiet , yet august ; of [the snow - clad fields , with [their]1532-the snow - clad fields , with their scampering herds of deer scampering herds of deer]1532-the snow - clad fields , with their scampering herds of deer ; of [the river]4300-the river and [[its]4300-the river quaint entrance into [the Baltic Sea]91-the baltic sea]1534-its quaint entrance into the baltic sea ; of [the Oderberge]92-the oderberge , only three hundred feet high , from which one slid all too quickly back into [the Pomeranian plains]1535-the pomeranian plains , and yet these [Oderberge]92-the oderberge were [real mountains]1536-real mountains , with [pine - forests]1537-pine - forests , [streams]1538-streams , and views complete . " It isn t size that counts so much as the way things are arranged . "[254-helen] In another paragraph [she]254-helen referred to [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox sympathetically , but the news had not bitten into [her]254-helen . [She]254-helen had not realised the accessories of death , which are in a sense more memorable than death itself . The atmosphere of precautions and recriminations , and in the midst a human body growing more vivid because it was in pain ; the end of that body in [Hilton churchyard]32-hilton ; the survival of something that suggested hope , vivid in its turn against life s workaday cheerfulness;--all these were lost to [Helen]254-helen , who only felt that [a pleasant lady]1539-a pleasant lady could now be pleasant no longer . [She]254-helen returned to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place full of [her]254-helen own affairs -- [she]254-helen had had another proposal -- and [Margaret]255-margaret , after a moment s hesitation , was content that this should be so .

The proposal had not been a serious matter . It was the work of [Fraulein Mosebach]285-fraulein mosebach , who had conceived the large and patriotic notion of winning back [[her]285-fraulein mosebach cousins]1540-her cousins to [the Fatherland]280-the fatherland by matrimony . [England]34-england had played [Paul Wilcox]256-paul , and lost ; [Germany]3-germany played [Herr Forstmeister]371-herr forstmeister some one -- [Helen]254-helen could not remember [his]371-herr forstmeister name . [Herr Forstmeister]371-herr forstmeister lived in [a wood]1541-a wood , and , standing on [the summit of [the Oderberge]92-the oderberge]1542-the summit of the oderberge , [he]371-herr forstmeister had pointed out [[his]371-herr forstmeister house]1543-his house to [Helen]254-helen , or rather , had pointed out the wedge of pines in which [it]1543-his house lay . [She]254-helen had exclaimed , " Oh , how lovely ! That s the place for [me]254-helen ! "[254-helen] and in the evening [Frieda]287-frieda appeared in [[her]287-frieda bedroom]1544-her bedroom . " [I]287-frieda have a message , [dear [Helen]254-helen]4492-dear helen , "[287-frieda] etc . , and so [she]287-frieda had , but had been very nice when [Helen]254-helen laughed ; quite understood -- [a forest]1545-a forest too solitary and damp -- quite agreed , but [Herr Forstmeister]371-herr forstmeister believed [he]371-herr forstmeister had assurance to the contrary . [Germany]3-germany had lost , but with good - humour ; holding the manhood of [the world]745-the world , [she]254-helen felt bound to win . " And there will even be some one for [Tibby]259-tibby , "[254-helen] concluded [Helen]254-helen . " There now , [Tibby]259-tibby , think of that ; [Frieda]287-frieda is saving up [a little girl]4493-a little girl for [you]259-tibby , in pig - tails and white worsted stockings but the feet of the stockings are pink as if [the little girl]4494-the little girl had trodden in strawberries . [I]254-helen ve talked too much . [My]254-helen head aches . Now [you]259-tibby talk . "[254-helen]

[Tibby]259-tibby consented to talk . [He]259-tibby too was full of [his]259-tibby own affairs , for [he]259-tibby had just been up to try for a scholarship at [Oxford]96-oxford . [The men]1547-the men were down , and [the candidates]1548-the candidates had been housed in [various colleges]1549-various colleges , and had dined in [hall]3788-hall . [Tibby]259-tibby was sensitive to beauty , the experience was new , and [he]259-tibby gave a description of [his]259-tibby visit that was almost glowing . [The august and mellow University]1551-the august and mellow university , soaked with the richness of [the western counties]1552-the western counties that [it]1551-the august and mellow university has served for a thousand years , appealed at once to [the boy]662-the boy s taste ; it was the kind of thing [he]259-tibby could understand , and [he]259-tibby understood it all the better because it was empty . [Oxford]96-oxford is -- [Oxford]96-oxford ; not a mere receptacle for youth , like [Cambridge]97-cambridge . Perhaps it wants [[its]1551-the august and mellow university inmates]4096-its inmates to love [it]1551-the august and mellow university rather than to love [one another]3933-one another ; such at all events was to be its effect on [Tibby]259-tibby . [[His]259-tibby sisters]1556-his sisters sent [him]259-tibby [there]884-there that [he]259-tibby might make [friends]3831-friends , for [they]1556-his sisters knew that [his]259-tibby education had been cranky , and had severed [him]259-tibby from [other boys]1559-other boys and [men]3835-men . [He]259-tibby made [no friends]1561-no friends . [[His]259-tibby [Oxford]96-oxford]1562-his oxford remained [Oxford]96-oxford empty , and [he]259-tibby took into life with [him]259-tibby , not the memory of a radiance , but the memory of a colour scheme .

It pleased [Margaret]255-margaret to hear [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother and [sister]1393-sister talking . [They]1556-his sisters did not get on overwell as a rule . For a few moments [she]255-margaret listened to [them]1556-his sisters , feeling elderly and benign .

Then something occurred to [her]255-margaret , and [she]255-margaret interrupted .

" [Helen]254-helen , [I]1556-his sisters told [you]254-helen about poor [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox ; that sad business ? "[1556-his sisters]

" Yes . "[1556-his sisters]

" [I]1556-his sisters have had a correspondence with [[her]512-mrs. wilcox son]4495-her son . [He]4495-her son was winding up [the estate]4496-the estate , and wrote to ask [me]1556-his sisters whether [[his]4495-her son mother]1325-his mother had wanted [me]1556-his sisters to have anything . [I]1556-his sisters thought it good of [him]4495-her son , considering [I]1556-his sisters knew [her]512-mrs. wilcox so little . " [I]1556-his sisters hope [Charles]258-charles took the hint . "[1556-his sisters]

" Yes -- that is to say , [[her]512-mrs. wilcox husband]1134-her husband wrote later on , and thanked [me]1556-his sisters for being a little kind to [her]512-mrs. wilcox , and actually gave [me]1556-his sisters [her]512-mrs. wilcox silver vinaigrette . Don t [you]1556-his sisters think that is extraordinarily generous ? It has made [me]1556-his sisters like [him]4495-her son very much . [I]1556-his sisters like [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles . [He]258-charles is taking up [his]258-charles work -- rubber -- it is a big business . [Charles]258-charles is married -- [a pretty little creature]4500-a pretty little creature , but [she]4500-a pretty little creature doesn t seem wise . [They]4498-they took on [the flat]1061-the flat , but now [they]4498-they have gone off to [a house of [their]4498-they own]4502-a house of their own . "[1556-his sisters]

[Helen]254-helen , after a decent pause , continued [her]254-helen account of [Stettin]49-stettin . How quickly a situation changes ! In June [she]254-helen had been in a crisis ; even in November [she]254-helen could blush and be unnatural ; now it was January and the whole affair lay forgotten . Looking back on the past six months , [Margaret]255-margaret realised the chaotic nature of [our]1565-our daily life , and its difference from the orderly sequence that has been fabricated by [historians]1566-historians . Actual life is full of false clues and sign - posts that lead nowhere . With infinite effort [we]1565-our nerve [ourselves]1565-our for a crisis that never comes . The most successful career must show a waste of strength that might have removed mountains , and the most unsuccessful is not that of [the man who is taken unprepared , but of [him]1568-him who has prepared and is never taken]1567-the man who is taken unprepared , but of him who has prepared and is never taken . On a tragedy of that kind [our]1565-our national morality is duly silent . It assumes that preparation against danger is in itself a good , and that [men]3835-men , like [nations]1570-nations , are the better for staggering through life fully armed . The tragedy of preparedness has scarcely been handled , save by [the Greeks]373-the greeks . Life is indeed dangerous , but not in the way morality would have [us]1565-our believe . It is indeed unmanageable , but the essence of it is not a battle . It is unmanageable because it is a romance , and its essence is romantic beauty . [Margaret]255-margaret hoped that for the future [she]255-margaret would be less cautious , not more cautious , than [she]255-margaret had been in the past .

CHAPTER XIII

Over two years passed , and [the Schlegel household]1571-the schlegel household continued to lead [its]1571-the schlegel household life of cultured , but not ignoble , ease , still swimming gracefully on the grey tides of [London]2-london . Concerts and plays swept past [them]1571-the schlegel household , money had been spent and renewed , reputations won and lost , and [the city]1004-the city [herself]1004-the city , emblematic of [their]1571-the schlegel household lives , rose and fell in a continual flux , while [[her]1004-the city shallows]1573-her shallows washed more widely against [the hills of [Surrey]83-surrey]1574-the hills of surrey and over [the fields of [Hertfordshire]73-hertfordshire]1575-the fields of hertfordshire . [This famous building]1576-this famous building had arisen , that was doomed . To - day [Whitehall]98-whitehall had been transformed ; it would be the turn of [Regent Street]81-regent street to - morrow . And month by month [the roads]3928-the roads smelt more strongly of petrol , and were more difficult to cross , and [human beings]760-human beings heard each other speak with greater difficulty , breathed less of the air , and saw less of the sky . [Nature]374-nature withdrew ; the leaves were falling by midsummer ; the sun shone through dirt with an admired obscurity .

To speak against [London]2-london is no longer fashionable . [The Earth]99-the earth as an artistic cult has had [its]99-the earth day , and the literature of the near future will probably ignore [the country]4215-the country and seek inspiration from [the town]4299-the town . [One]3797-one can understand the reaction . Of [Pan]375-pan and the elemental forces , [the public]1582-the public has heard a little too much -- [they]1582-the public seem Victorian , while [London]2-london is [Georgian]100-georgian -- and those who care for [the earth]1372-the earth with sincerity may wait long ere the pendulum swings back to [her]1372-the earth again . Certainly [London]2-london fascinates . [One]3797-one visualises it as a tract of quivering grey , intelligent without purpose , and excitable without love ; as a spirit that has altered before it can be chronicled ; as a heart that certainly beats , but with no pulsation of humanity . It lies beyond everything ; [Nature]374-nature , with all [her]374-nature cruelty , comes nearer to [us]1585-we than do [these crowds of men]1586-these crowds of men . [A friend]1221-a friend explains [himself]1221-a friend ; [the earth]1372-the earth is explicable -- from [her]374-nature [we]1585-we came , and [we]1585-we must return to [her]374-nature . But who can explain [Westminster Bridge Road]101-westminster bridge road or [Liverpool Street]18-liverpool street in the morning -- [the city]1004-the city inhaling -- or [the same thoroughfares]1590-the same thoroughfares in the evening -- [the city]1004-the city exhaling [her]374-nature exhausted air ? [We]1585-we reach in desperation beyond the fog , beyond the very stars , the voids of [the universe]868-the universe are ransacked to justify [the monster , and stamped with a human face]1593-the monster , and stamped with a human face . [London]2-london is religion s opportunity -- not the decorous religion of [theologians]1594-theologians , but anthropomorphic , crude . Yes , the continuous flow would be tolerable if [a man of [our]1585-we own sort]1595-a man of our own sort -- not any one pompous or tearful -- were caring for [us]1585-we up in the sky .

[The Londoner]350-a londoner seldom understands [[his]350-a londoner city]1596-his city until it sweeps [him]350-a londoner , too , away from [[his]350-a londoner moorings]1597-his moorings , and [Margaret]255-margaret s eyes were not opened until the lease of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place expired . [She]255-margaret had always known that it must expire , but the knowledge only became vivid about nine months before the event . Then [the house]3796-the house was suddenly ringed with pathos . [It]3796-the house had seen so much happiness . Why had [it]3796-the house to be swept away ? In [the streets of [the city]1004-the city]1599-the streets of the city [she]255-margaret noted for the first time the architecture of hurry and heard the language of hurry on the mouths of [its inhabitants]1601-its inhabitants -- clipped words , formless sentences , potted expressions of approval or disgust . Month by month things were stepping livelier , but to what goal ? [The population]1602-the population still rose , but what was the quality of [the men born]1603-the men born ? [The particular millionaire who owned [the freehold of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]1605-the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect [Babylonian flats]1606-babylonian flats upon [it]1605-the freehold of wickham place]1604-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it -- what right had [he]1604-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it to stir so large a portion of the quivering jelly ? [He]1604-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it was not [a fool]3951-a fool -- [she]255-margaret had heard [him]1604-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it expose [Socialism]376-socialism -- but true insight began just where [his]1604-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it intelligence ended , and [one]3797-one gathered that this was the case with [most millionaires]1609-most millionaires . What right had [such men]1610-such men -- But [Margaret]255-margaret checked [herself]255-margaret . That way lies madness . Thank goodness , [she]255-margaret , too , had some money , and could purchase [a new home]1611-a new home .

[Tibby]259-tibby , now in [his]259-tibby second year at [Oxford]96-oxford , was down for the Easter vacation , and [Margaret]255-margaret took the opportunity of having a serious talk with [him]259-tibby . Did [he]259-tibby at all know where [he]259-tibby wanted to live ? [Tibby]259-tibby didn t know that [he]259-tibby did know . Did [he]259-tibby at all know what [he]259-tibby wanted to do ? [He]259-tibby was equally uncertain , but when pressed remarked that [he]259-tibby should prefer to be quite free of any profession . [Margaret]255-margaret was not shocked , but went on sewing for a few minutes before [she]255-margaret replied :

" [I]255-margaret was thinking of [Mr. Vyse]377-mr. vyse . [He]377-mr. vyse never strikes [me]255-margaret as particularly happy . "[255-margaret]

" But was the dawn wonderful ? "[254-helen] asked [Helen]254-helen .

With unforgettable sincerity [he]1644-his replied , " No . "[1644-his] The word flew again like a pebble from the sling . Down toppled all that had seemed ignoble or literary in [his]1644-his talk , down toppled tiresome R. L. S. and the " love of [the earth]1372-the earth "[1644-his] and [his]1644-his silk top - hat . In the presence of [these women]1645-these women [Leonard]311-leonard had arrived , and [he]311-leonard spoke with a flow , an exultation , that [he]311-leonard had seldom known .

" The dawn was only grey , it was nothing to mention . "[922-a lady]

" Just a grey evening turned upside down . [I]922-a lady know . "[922-a lady]

" --and [I]922-a lady was too tired to lift up [my]922-a lady head to look at it , and so cold too . [I]922-a lady m glad [I]922-a lady did it , and yet at the time it bored [me]922-a lady more than [I]922-a lady can say . And besides -- [you]4603-you can believe [me]922-a lady or not as [you]4603-you choose -- [I]922-a lady was very hungry . That dinner at [Wimbledon]113-wimbledon -- [I]922-a lady meant it to last [me]922-a lady all night like other dinners . [I]922-a lady never thought that walking would make such a difference . Why , when [you]4603-you re walking [you]4603-you want , as it were , a breakfast and luncheon and tea during the night as well , and [I]922-a lady d nothing but a packet of Woodbines . [Lord]4604-lord , [I]922-a lady did feel bad ! Looking back , it wasn t what [you]4603-you may call enjoyment . It was more a case of sticking to it . [I]922-a lady did stick . [I]922-a lady -- [I]922-a lady was determined . Oh , hang it all ! what s the good -- [I]922-a lady mean , the good of living in [a room]3793-a room for ever ? There one goes on day after day , same old game , same up and down to [town]4380-town , until [you]4603-you forget there is any other game . [You]4603-you ought to see once in a way what s going on outside , if it s only nothing particular after all . "[922-a lady]

" [I]254-helen should just think [you]1647-you ought , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen , sitting on the edge of the table .

The sound of [a lady]922-a lady s voice recalled [him]1647-you from sincerity , and [he]1647-you said : " Curious it should all come about from reading something of [Richard Jefferies]393-jefferies . "[1647-you]

" Excuse [me]1647-you , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast , but [you]1647-you re wrong there . It didn t. It came from something far greater . "[1647-you]

But [she]254-helen could not stop [him]1647-you . [Borrow]394-the george was imminent after [Jefferies]393-jefferies -- [Borrow]394-the george , [Thoreau]395-thoreau , and sorrow . [R. L. S.]392-r. l. brought up the rear , and the outburst ended in a swamp of books . No disrespect to these great names . The fault is [ours]1648-ours , not [theirs]393-jefferies . [They]1649-they mean [us]1648-ours to use them for sign - posts , and are not to blame if , in [our]1648-ours weakness , [we]1648-ours mistake the sign - post for the destination . And [Leonard]311-leonard had reached the destination . [He]311-leonard had visited [the county of Surrey]1650-the county of surrey when darkness covered [its]1650-the county of surrey amenities , and [its]1650-the county of surrey cosy villas had re - entered ancient night . Every twelve hours this miracle happens , but [he]311-leonard had troubled to go and see for [himself]311-leonard . Within [his]311-leonard cramped little mind dwelt something that was greater than [Jefferies]393-jefferies books -- the spirit that led [Jefferies]393-jefferies to write them ; and [his]311-leonard dawn , though revealing nothing but monotones , was part of the eternal sunrise that shows [George Borrow Stonehenge]394-the george .

" Then [you]255-margaret don t think [I]311-leonard was foolish ? "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard asked becoming again [the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom [Nature]374-nature intended [him]311-leonard]1651-the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom nature intended him .

" Heavens , no ! "[255-margaret] replied [Margaret]255-margaret .

" Heaven help [us]4607-we if [we]4607-we do ! "[254-helen] replied [Helen]254-helen .

" [I]1651-the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom nature intended him m very glad [you]255-margaret say that . "[1651-the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom nature intended him]

" No , it wasn t foolish ! "[254-helen] cried [Helen]254-helen , [her]254-helen eyes aflame . " [You]255-margaret ve pushed back the boundaries ; [I]254-helen think it splendid of [you]255-margaret . "[254-helen]

Here the door - bell rang . [The hansom]1652-the hansom had come to take [them]1653-them to [their]1653-them evening party .

" Oh , bother , not to say dash -- [I]254-helen had forgotten [we]4607-we were dining out ; but do , do , come round again and have a talk . "[254-helen] " Yes , [you]311-leonard must -- do , "[255-margaret] echoed [Margaret]255-margaret .

[Leonard]311-leonard , with extreme sentiment , replied : " No , [I]311-leonard shall not . It s better like this . "[311-leonard]

" Why better ? "[255-margaret] asked [Margaret]255-margaret .

" No , it is better not to risk a second interview . [I]311-leonard shall always look back on this talk with [you]255-margaret as one of the finest things in [my]311-leonard life . Really . " That s rather a sad view of life , surely . "[311-leonard]

" Things so often get spoiled . "[311-leonard]

" [I]254-helen know , "[254-helen] flashed [Helen]254-helen , " but [people]3992-people don t. "[254-helen]

[He]311-leonard could not understand this . [He]311-leonard continued in a vein which mingled true imagination and false . What [he]311-leonard said wasn t wrong , but it wasn t right , and a false note jarred . One little twist , [they]1654-they felt , and the instrument might be in tune . One little strain , and it might be silent for ever . [He]311-leonard thanked [the ladies]957-the ladies very much , but [he]311-leonard would not call again . There was a moment s awkwardness , and then [Helen]254-helen said : " Go , then ; perhaps [you]311-leonard know best ; but never forget [you]311-leonard re better than [Jefferies]393-jefferies . "[254-helen] And [he]311-leonard went . [[Their]1654-they hansom]1656-their hansom caught [him]311-leonard up at [the corner]1657-the corner , passed with a waving of hands , and vanished with its accomplished load into the evening .

[London]2-london was beginning to illuminate [herself]2-london against the night . Electric lights sizzled and jagged in [the main thoroughfares]1658-the main thoroughfares , gas - lamps in [the side streets]1659-the side streets glimmered a canary gold or green . The sky was a crimson battlefield of spring , but [London]2-london was not afraid . [Her]2-london smoke mitigated the splendour , and the clouds down [Oxford Street]116-oxford street were a delicately painted ceiling , which adorned while it did not distract . [She]2-london had never known the clear - cut armies of the purer air . [Leonard]311-leonard hurried through [her]2-london tinted wonders , very much part of the picture . [His]1660-his was a grey life , and to brighten it [he]311-leonard had ruled off a few corners for romance . [The Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels -- or , to speak more accurately , [his]311-leonard interview with [them]1661-them -- were to fill such a corner , nor was it by any means the first time that [he]311-leonard had talked intimately to [strangers]4067-strangers . The habit was analogous to a debauch , an outlet , though the worst of outlets , for instincts that would not be denied . Terrifying [him]311-leonard , it would beat down [his]311-leonard suspicions and prudence until [he]311-leonard was confiding secrets to [people whom [he]311-leonard had scarcely seen]1663-people whom he had scarcely seen . It brought [him]311-leonard many fears and some pleasant memories . Perhaps the keenest happiness [he]311-leonard had ever known was during a railway journey to [Cambridge]97-cambridge , where [a decent - mannered undergraduate]1664-a decent - mannered undergraduate had spoken to [him]311-leonard . [They]1665-they had got into conversation , and gradually [Leonard]311-leonard flung reticence aside , told some of [his]311-leonard domestic troubles and hinted at the rest . [The undergraduate]1666-the undergraduate , supposing [they]1665-they could start a friendship , asked [him]311-leonard to " coffee after [hall]3788-hall , "[311-leonard] which [he]311-leonard accepted , but afterwards grew shy , and took care not to stir from [the commercial hotel where [he]311-leonard lodged]1667-the commercial hotel where he lodged . [He]311-leonard did not want Romance to collide with [the Porphyrion]396-the porphyrion , still less with [Jacky]318-jacky , and [people with fuller , happier lives]1668-people with fuller , happier lives are slow to understand this . To [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels , as to [the undergraduate]1666-the undergraduate , [he]311-leonard was [an interesting creature]1670-an interesting creature , of whom [they]1665-they wanted to see more . But [they]1665-they to [him]311-leonard were [denizens of Romance]1671-denizens of romance , who must keep to the corner [he]311-leonard had assigned [them]1665-they , pictures that must not walk out of [their]1665-they frames .

[His]311-leonard behaviour over [Margaret]255-margaret s visiting - card had been typical . [His]311-leonard had scarcely been a tragic marriage . Where there is no money and no inclination to violence tragedy can not be generated . [He]311-leonard could not leave [[his]311-leonard wife]1358-his wife , and [he]311-leonard did not want to hit [her]1358-his wife . Petulance and squalor were enough . Here " that card "[1358-his wife] had come in . [Leonard]311-leonard , though furtive , was untidy , and left it lying about . [Jacky]318-jacky found it , and then began , " What s that card , eh ? "[318-jacky] " Yes , don t [you]318-jacky wish [you]318-jacky knew what that card was ? "[318-jacky] " [Len]311-leonard , who s [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ? "[318-jacky] etc . Months passed , and the card , now as a joke , now as a grievance , was handed about , getting dirtier and dirtier . It followed [them]1673-them when [they]1673-them moved from [Camelia Road]58-camelia road to [Tulse Hill]117-tulse hill . It was submitted to [third parties]1674-third parties . A few inches of pasteboard , it became the battlefield on which the souls of [Leonard]311-leonard and [[his]311-leonard wife]1358-his wife contended . Why did [he]311-leonard not say , " [A lady]922-a lady took [my]311-leonard umbrella , [another]4612-another gave [me]311-leonard this that [I]311-leonard might call for [my]311-leonard umbrella "[311-leonard] ? Because [Jacky]318-jacky would have disbelieved [him]311-leonard ? Partly , but chiefly because [he]311-leonard was sentimental . No affection gathered round the card , but it symbolised the life of culture , that [Jacky]318-jacky should never spoil . At night [he]311-leonard would say to [himself]311-leonard , " Well , at all events , [she]1358-his wife doesn t know about that card . [Yah]4613-yah ! done [her]1358-his wife there ! "[311-leonard]

[Poor Jacky]318-jacky ! [she]1358-his wife was not a bad sort , and had a great deal to bear . [She]1358-his wife drew [her]1358-his wife own conclusion -- [she]1358-his wife was only capable of drawing one conclusion -- and in the fulness of time [she]1358-his wife acted upon it . All the Friday [Leonard]311-leonard had refused to speak to [her]1358-his wife , and had spent the evening observing the stars . On the Saturday [he]311-leonard went up , as usual , to [town]4380-town , but [he]311-leonard came not back Saturday night , nor Sunday morning , nor Sunday afternoon . The inconvenience grew intolerable , and though [she]1358-his wife was now of a retiring habit , and shy of [women]743-women , [she]1358-his wife went up to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . [Leonard]311-leonard returned in [her]1358-his wife absence . The card , the fatal card , was gone from the pages of [Ruskin]319-ruskin , and [he]311-leonard guessed what had happened .

" Well ? "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard had exclaimed , greeting [her]1358-his wife with peals of laughter . " [I]311-leonard know where [you]1358-his wife ve been , but [you]1358-his wife don t know where [I]311-leonard ve been . "[311-leonard]

[Jacky]318-jacky sighed , said , " [Len]311-leonard , [I]318-jacky do think [you]311-leonard might explain , "[318-jacky] and resumed domesticity .

Explanations were difficult at this stage , and [Leonard]311-leonard was too silly -- or it is tempting to write , too sound [a chap]1678-a chap to attempt them . [His]311-leonard reticence was not entirely the shoddy article that [a business life]1679-a business life promotes , the reticence that pretends that nothing is something , and hides behind the Daily Telegraph . [The adventurer]1680-the adventurer , also , is reticent , and it is an adventure for [a clerk to walk for a few hours in darkness]1681-a clerk to walk for a few hours in darkness . [You]1682-you may laugh at [him]1680-the adventurer , [you]1682-you who have slept nights out on the veldt , with [your]1682-you rifle beside [you]1682-you and all the atmosphere of adventure pat . And [you]1682-you also may laugh who think adventures silly . But do not be surprised if [Leonard]311-leonard is shy whenever [he]311-leonard meets [you]1682-you , and if [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels rather than [Jacky]318-jacky hear about the dawn .

That [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels had not thought [him]311-leonard foolish became a permanent joy . [He]311-leonard was at [his]311-leonard best when [he]311-leonard thought of them . It buoyed [him]311-leonard as [he]311-leonard journeyed home beneath fading heavens . Somehow the barriers of wealth had fallen , and there had been -- [he]311-leonard could not phrase it -- a general assertion of the wonder of [the world]745-the world . " [My]1684-the mystic conviction , "[1684-the mystic] says [the mystic]1684-the mystic , " gains infinitely the moment another soul will believe in it , "[1684-the mystic] and [they]1685-they had agreed that there was something beyond life s daily grey . [He]311-leonard took off [his]311-leonard top - hat and smoothed it thoughtfully . [He]311-leonard had hitherto supposed the unknown to be books , literature , clever conversation , culture . [One]3797-one raised [oneself]3797-one by study , and got upsides with [the world]745-the world . But in that quick interchange a new light dawned . Was that " something "[311-leonard] walking in the dark among [the suburban hills]1688-the suburban hills ?

[He]311-leonard discovered that [he]311-leonard was going bareheaded down [Regent Street]81-regent street . [London]2-london came back with a rush . [Few]1689-few were about at this hour , but [all whom [he]311-leonard passed]1690-all whom he passed looked at [him]311-leonard with a hostility that was the more impressive because it was unconscious . [He]311-leonard put [his]311-leonard hat on . It was too big ; [his]311-leonard head disappeared like a pudding into a basin , the ears bending outwards at the touch of the curly brim . [He]311-leonard wore it a little backwards , and its effect was greatly to elongate the face and to bring out the distance between the eyes and the moustache . Thus equipped , [he]311-leonard escaped criticism . [No one]633-no one felt uneasy as [he]311-leonard titupped along [the pavements]1692-the pavements , the heart of [a man]569-a man ticking fast in [his]311-leonard chest .

CHAPTER XV

[The sisters]775-the sisters went out to dinner full of [their]775-the sisters adventure , and when [they]775-the sisters were both full of the same subject , there were few dinner - parties that could stand up against [them]775-the sisters . [This particular one]1695-this particular one , which was [all ladies]1696-all ladies , had more kick in it than most , but succumbed after a struggle . [Helen]254-helen at one part of the table , [Margaret]255-margaret at the other , would talk of [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast and of [no one else]1697-no one else , and somewhere about the entree [their]775-the sisters monologues collided , fell ruining , and became common property . Nor was this all . The dinner - party was really an informal discussion club ; there was a paper after it , read amid coffee - cups and laughter in [the drawing - room]4101-the drawing - room , but dealing more or less thoughtfully with some topic of general interest . After the paper came a debate , and in this debate [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast also figured , appearing now as a bright spot in civilisation , now as a dark spot , according to the temperament of [the speaker]1699-the speaker . The subject of the paper had been , " How ought [I]600-the reader to dispose of [my]600-the reader money ? "[600-the reader] [the reader]600-the reader professing to be [a millionaire]1701-a millionaire on the point of death , inclined to bequeath [her]600-the reader fortune for the foundation of [local art galleries]1702-local art galleries , but open to conviction from other sources . The various parts had been assigned beforehand , and some of the speeches were amusing . [The hostess]1703-the hostess assumed the ungrateful role of " [[the millionaire]4614-the millionaire s eldest son]4615-the millionaire s eldest son , "[1703-the hostess] and implored [[her]600-the reader expiring parent]1704-her expiring parent not to dislocate Society by allowing such vast sums to pass out of [the family]1117-the family . Money was the fruit of self - denial , and [the second generation]1706-the second generation had a right to profit by the self - denial of the first . What right had " [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast "[1707-the various philanthropists] to profit ? [The National Gallery]118-the national gallery was good enough for the likes of [him]313-mr. bast . After property had had its say -- a saying that is necessarily ungracious -- [the various philanthropists]1707-the various philanthropists stepped forward . Something must be done for " [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast "[313-mr. bast] ; [his]313-mr. bast conditions must be improved without impairing [his]313-mr. bast independence ; [he]313-mr. bast must have [a free library]1708-a free library , or free tennis - courts ; [his]313-mr. bast rent must be paid in such a way that [he]313-mr. bast did not know it was being paid ; it must be made worth [his]313-mr. bast while to join [the Territorials]1709-the territorials ; [he]313-mr. bast must be forcibly parted from [[his]313-mr. bast uninspiring wife]1710-his uninspiring wife , the money going to [her]1710-his uninspiring wife as compensation ; [he]313-mr. bast must be assigned [a Twin Star]1711-a twin star , [some member of the leisured classes who would watch over [him]313-mr. bast ceaselessly ( groans from [Helen]254-helen]1712-some member of the leisured classes who would watch over him ceaselessly ( groans from helen ) ; [he]313-mr. bast must be given food but no clothes , clothes but no food , a third - return ticket to [Venice]62-venice , without either food or clothes when [he]313-mr. bast arrived [there]884-there . In short , [he]313-mr. bast might be given anything and everything so long as it was not the money itself .

And here [Margaret]255-margaret interrupted .

" Order , order , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ! "[1714-the reader of the paper] said [the reader of the paper]1714-the reader of the paper . " [You]254-helen are here , [I]1714-the reader of the paper understand , to advise [me]1714-the reader of the paper in the interests of [the Society for the Preservation of [Places of Historic Interest]4617-places of historic interest]4616-the society for the preservation of places of historic interest or [Natural Beauty]119-natural beauty . [I]1714-the reader of the paper can not have [you]254-helen speaking out of [your]254-helen role . It makes [my]1714-the reader of the paper poor head go round , and [I]1714-the reader of the paper think [you]254-helen forget that [I]1714-the reader of the paper am very ill . "[1714-the reader of the paper]

" [Your]254-helen head won t go round if only [you]254-helen ll listen to [my]255-margaret argument , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret . " Why not give [him]4618-him the money itself ? [You]254-helen re supposed to have about thirty thousand a year . "[255-margaret]

" Have [I]1714-the reader of the paper ? [I]1714-the reader of the paper thought [I]1714-the reader of the paper had a million . "[1714-the reader of the paper]

" Wasn t a million [your]254-helen capital ? Dear [me]255-margaret ! [we]4619-we ought to have settled that . Still , it doesn t matter . Whatever [you]254-helen ve got , [I]255-margaret order [you]254-helen to give [as many poor men]4620-as many poor men as [you]254-helen can three hundred a year each . "[255-margaret]

" But that would be pauperising [them]1716-them , "[1715-an earnest girl] said [an earnest girl]1715-an earnest girl , who liked [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels , but thought [them]1716-them a little unspiritual at times .

" Not if [you]254-helen gave [them]1716-them so much . A big windfall would not pauperise [a man]569-a man . It is these little driblets , distributed among [too many]4622-too many , that do the harm . Money s educational . It s far more educational than the things it buys . "[255-margaret] There was a protest . " In a sense , "[255-margaret] added [Margaret]255-margaret , but the protest continued . " Well , isn t the most civilized thing going , [the man who has learnt to wear [his]4623-the man who has learnt to wear his income income]4623-the man who has learnt to wear his income properly ? "[255-margaret]

" Exactly what [your]254-helen [Mr. Basts]397-the basts won t do . "[255-margaret]

" Give [them]1716-them a chance . Give [them]1716-them money . Don t dole [them]1716-them out poetry - books and railway - tickets like babies . Give [them]1716-them the wherewithal to buy these things . When [your]254-helen Socialism comes it may be different , and [we]4624-we may think in terms of commodities instead of cash . Till it comes give [people]3992-people cash , for it is the warp of civilisation , whatever the woof may be . The imagination ought to play upon money and realise it vividly , for it s the -- the second most important thing in [the world]745-the world . It is so slurred over and hushed up , there is so little clear thinking -- oh , political economy , of course , but so few of [us]4624-we think clearly about [our]4624-we own private incomes , and admit that independent thoughts are in nine cases out of ten the result of independent means . [Money]398-money : give [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast money , and don t bother about [his]313-mr. bast ideals . [He]313-mr. bast ll pick up those for [himself]313-mr. bast . "[255-margaret]

[She]255-margaret leant back while [the more earnest members of the club]1717-the more earnest members of the club began to misconstrue [her]255-margaret . [The female mind]1718-the female mind , though cruelly practical in daily life , can not bear to hear ideals belittled in conversation , and [Miss Schlegel]254-helen was asked however [she]254-helen could say such dreadful things , and what it would profit [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast if [he]313-mr. bast gained [the whole world]4140-the whole world and lost [his]313-mr. bast own soul . [She]254-helen answered , " Nothing , but [he]313-mr. bast would not gain [his]313-mr. bast soul until [he]313-mr. bast had gained a little of [the world]745-the world . "[1717-the more earnest members of the club] Then [they]1717-the more earnest members of the club said , " No , [we]1717-the more earnest members of the club do not believe it , "[1717-the more earnest members of the club] and [she]254-helen admitted that [an overworked clerk]1720-an overworked clerk may save [his]1720-an overworked clerk soul in the superterrestrial sense , where the effort will be taken for the deed , but [she]254-helen denied that [he]1720-an overworked clerk will ever explore the spiritual resources of [this world]1721-this world , will ever know the rarer joys of the body , or attain to clear and passionate intercourse with [[his]1720-an overworked clerk fellows]1722-his fellows . [Others]802-others had attacked the fabric of Society -- Property , Interest , etc . ; [she]254-helen only fixed [her]254-helen eyes on [a few human beings]1724-a few human beings , to see how , under present conditions , [they]1724-a few human beings could be made happier . Doing good to [humanity]1725-humanity was useless : the many - coloured efforts thereto spreading over [the vast area]1726-the vast area like films and resulting in an universal grey . To do good to one , or , as in this case , to [a few]1727-a few , was the utmost [she]254-helen dare hope for .

Between [the idealists]1728-the idealists , and [the political economists]1729-the political economists , [Margaret]255-margaret had a bad time . Disagreeing elsewhere , [they]1729-the political economists agreed in disowning [her]255-margaret , and in keeping the administration of [the millionaire]4614-the millionaire s money in [their]1729-the political economists own hands . [The earnest girl]1731-the earnest girl brought forward a scheme of " personal supervision and mutual help , "[1731-the earnest girl] the effect of which was to alter [poor people]4191-poor people until [they]4191-poor people became exactly like [people who were not so poor]1733-people who were not so poor . [Margaret]255-margaret weakly admitted the claim , and another claim was at once set up by [Helen]254-helen , who declared that [she]254-helen had been [[the millionaire]4614-the millionaire s housemaid]1738-the millionaire s housemaid for over forty years , overfed and underpaid ; was nothing to be done for [her]254-helen , so corpulent and poor ? Then [she]254-helen died . The serious parts of the discussion had been of higher merit than the playful -- in a men s debate is the reverse more general?--but the meeting broke up hilariously enough , and [a dozen happy ladies]1741-a dozen happy ladies dispersed to [[their]1741-a dozen happy ladies homes]596-their homes .

[Helen]254-helen and [Margaret]255-margaret walked with [the earnest girl]1731-the earnest girl as far as [Battersea Bridge Station]120-battersea bridge station , arguing copiously all the way . When [she]1731-the earnest girl had gone [they]1744-we were conscious of an alleviation , and of the great beauty of the evening . [They]1744-we turned back towards [Oakley Street]121-oakley street . The lamps and the plane - trees , following the line of [the embankment]1745-the embankment , struck a note of dignity that is rare in [English cities]1746-english cities . The seats , almost deserted , were here and there occupied by [gentlefolk in evening dress]1747-gentlefolk in evening dress , who had strolled out from [the houses behind]1748-the houses behind to enjoy fresh air and the whisper of the rising tide . CHAPTER XVI

[Leonard]311-leonard had no idea . [He]311-leonard understood [his]311-leonard own corner of the machine , but nothing beyond it . [A woman]1045-a woman and [two men]1853-two men -- [they]1850-their had formed the magic triangle of sex , and [the male]1854-the male was thrilled to jealousy , in case [the female]1855-the female was attracted by [another male]1856-another male . [Evie]262-evie had grown up handsome . CHAPTER XVII

The Age of [Property]1873-property holds bitter moments even for [a proprietor]1874-a proprietor . When a move is imminent , furniture becomes ridiculous , and [Margaret]255-margaret now lay awake at nights wondering where , where on earth [they]4005-the wilcoxes and all [their]4005-the wilcoxes belongings would be deposited in September next . Chairs , tables , pictures , books , that had rumbled down to [them]4005-the wilcoxes through the generations , must rumble forward again like a slide of rubbish to which [she]255-margaret longed to give the final push , and send toppling into [the sea]811-the sea . But there were all [[their]4005-the wilcoxes father]788-their father s books -- [they]4005-the wilcoxes never read them , but they were [[their]4005-the wilcoxes father]788-their father s , and must be kept . There was [the marble - topped chiffonier]1878-the marble - topped chiffonier -- [[their]4005-the wilcoxes mother]1395-their mother had set [store]1880-store by it , [they]4005-the wilcoxes could not remember why . Round every knob and cushion in [the house]3796-the house gathered a sentiment that was at times personal , but more often a faint piety to the dead , a prolongation of rites that might have ended at the grave .

It was absurd , if [you]1882-you came to think of it ; [Helen]254-helen and [Tibby]259-tibby came to think of it ; [Margaret]255-margaret was too busy with [the house - agents]1883-the house - agents . The feudal ownership of [land]1884-land did bring dignity , whereas the modern ownership of movables is reducing [us]1885-us again to [a nomadic horde]1886-a nomadic horde . [We]1885-us are reverting to the civilisation of luggage , and [historians of the future]1887-historians of the future will note how [the middle classes]1888-the middle classes accreted possessions without taking root in [the earth]1372-the earth , and may find in this the secret of [their]1888-the middle classes imaginative poverty . [The Schlegels]267-the schlegels were certainly [the poorer for the loss of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]1890-the poorer for the loss of wickham place . [It]1891-it had helped to balance [their]4005-the wilcoxes lives , and almost to counsel [them]4005-the wilcoxes . Nor is [their]4005-the wilcoxes ground - landlord spiritually the richer . [He]1892-his has built [flats]558-flats on [[its]1892-his site]1894-its site , [[his]1892-his motor - cars]1895-his motor - cars grow swifter , [his]1892-his exposures of Socialism more trenchant . But [he]1892-his has spilt the precious distillation of the years , and no chemistry of [his]1892-his can give it back to society again .

[Margaret]255-margaret grew depressed ; [she]255-margaret was anxious to settle on [a house]3903-a house before [they]4005-the wilcoxes left [town]4380-town to pay [their]4005-the wilcoxes annual visit to [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt . [She]255-margaret enjoyed this visit , and wanted to have [her]255-margaret mind at ease for it . [Swanage]12-swanage , though dull , was stable , and this year [she]255-margaret longed more than usual for [its]12-swanage fresh air and for [the magnificent downs that guard [it]12-swanage on the north]1898-the magnificent downs that guard it on the north . But [London]2-london thwarted [her]255-margaret ; in [its]2-london atmosphere [she]255-margaret could not concentrate . [London]2-london only stimulates , it can not sustain ; and [Margaret]255-margaret , hurrying over [its]2-london surface for [a house]3903-a house without knowing what sort of [a house]3903-a house [she]255-margaret wanted , was paying for many a thrilling sensation in the past . [She]255-margaret could not even break loose from culture , and [her]255-margaret time was wasted by concerts which it would be a sin to miss , and invitations which it would never do to refuse . At last [she]255-margaret grew desperate ; [she]255-margaret resolved that [she]255-margaret would go nowhere and be at [home]894-home to [no one]633-no one until [she]255-margaret found [a house]3903-a house , and broke the resolution in half an hour .

Once [she]255-margaret had humorously lamented that [she]255-margaret had never been to [[Simpson]411-simpson s restaurant in [the Strand]141-the strand]1904-simpson s restaurant in the strand . Now a note arrived from [Miss Wilcox]404-miss wilcox , asking [her]255-margaret to lunch [there]884-there . [Mr Cahill]410-mr. cahill was coming and [the three]1625-the three would have such a jolly chat , and perhaps end up at [the Hippodrome]1907-the hippodrome . [Margaret]255-margaret had no strong regard for [Evie]262-evie , and no desire to meet [[her]255-margaret fiance]1908-her fiance , and [she]255-margaret was surprised that [Helen]254-helen , who had been far funnier about [Simpson s]411-simpson , had not been asked instead . But the invitation touched [her]255-margaret by its intimate tone . [She]255-margaret must know [Evie Wilcox]262-evie better than [she]255-margaret supposed , and declaring that [she]255-margaret " simply must , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret accepted .

But when [she]255-margaret saw [Evie]262-evie at the entrance of [the restaurant]1909-the restaurant , staring fiercely at nothing after the fashion of [athletic women]1910-athletic women , [her]255-margaret heart failed [her]255-margaret anew . [Miss Wilcox]404-miss wilcox had changed perceptibly since [her]404-miss wilcox engagement . [Her]404-miss wilcox voice was gruffer , [her]404-miss wilcox manner more downright , and [she]404-miss wilcox was inclined to patronise [the more foolish virgin]1911-the more foolish virgin . [Margaret]255-margaret was silly enough to be pained at this . Depressed at [her]255-margaret isolation , [she]255-margaret saw not only [houses]4042-houses and furniture , but the vessel of life itself slipping past [her]255-margaret , with [people like [Evie]262-evie]1913-people like evie and [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill on board .

There are moments when virtue and wisdom fail [us]1914-us , and one of them came to [her]255-margaret at [Simpson s]411-simpson in [the Strand]1915-the strand . As [she]255-margaret trod the staircase , narrow , but carpeted thickly , as [she]255-margaret entered [the eating - room]1916-the eating - room , where saddles of mutton were being trundled up to [expectant clergymen]1917-expectant clergymen , [she]255-margaret had a strong , if erroneous , conviction of [her]255-margaret own futility , and wished [she]255-margaret had never come out of [[her]255-margaret backwater]1918-her backwater , where nothing happened except art and literature , and where [no one]633-no one ever got married or succeeded in remaining engaged . Then came a little surprise . " [Father]353-father might be of [the party]4832-the party -- yes , [father]699-father was . "[255-margaret] With a smile of pleasure [she]255-margaret moved forward to greet [him]410-mr. cahill , and [her]255-margaret feeling of loneliness vanished .

" [I]410-mr. cahill thought [I]410-mr. cahill d get round if [I]410-mr. cahill could , "[410-mr. cahill] said [he]410-mr. cahill . " [Evie]262-evie told [me]410-mr. cahill of [her]262-evie little plan , so [I]410-mr. cahill just slipped in and secured a table . Always secure a table first . [Evie]262-evie , don t pretend [you]262-evie want to sit by [[your]262-evie old father]4834-your old father , because [you]262-evie don t. " No , after [houses]4042-houses , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , edging past [him]410-mr. cahill into the box . " [I]255-margaret m hungry , not tired ; [I]255-margaret want to eat heaps . "[255-margaret]

" That s good . What ll [you]410-mr. cahill have ? "[410-mr. cahill]

" Fish pie , "[255-margaret] said [she]255-margaret , with a glance at the menu .

" Fish pie ! Fancy coming for fish pie to [Simpson]411-simpson s. It s not a bit the thing to go for here . "[410-mr. cahill]

" Go for something for [me]255-margaret , then , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , pulling off [her]255-margaret gloves . [Her]255-margaret spirits were rising , and [his]410-mr. cahill reference to [Leonard Bast]311-leonard had warmed [her]255-margaret curiously .

" Saddle of mutton , "[410-mr. cahill] said [he]410-mr. cahill after profound reflection ; " and cider to drink . That s the type of thing . [I]410-mr. cahill like [this place]4837-this place , for a joke , once in a way . [It]4837-this place is so thoroughly Old English . Don t [you]410-mr. cahill agree ? "[410-mr. cahill]

" Yes , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , who didn t. The order was given , the joint rolled up , and [the carver]1920-the carver , under [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles s direction , cut the meat where it was succulent , and piled [their]1921-their plates high . [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill insisted on sirloin , but admitted that [he]410-mr. cahill had made a mistake later on . [He]410-mr. cahill and [Evie]262-evie soon fell into a conversation of the " No , [I]1922-those who are engaged in it didn t ; yes , [you]410-mr. cahill did "[1922-those who are engaged in it] type -- conversation which , though fascinating to [those who are engaged in it]1922-those who are engaged in it , neither desires nor deserves the attention of [others]802-others .

" It s a golden rule to tip [the carver]1920-the carver . [Tip]412-tip everywhere s [my]1922-those who are engaged in it motto . "[1922-those who are engaged in it]

In time [they]1934-they finished lunch , and [Margaret]255-margaret , who had excused [herself]255-margaret from [the Hippodrome]1907-the hippodrome , took [her]255-margaret leave . [He]3855-the father and [she]1931-her were advancing out of [[their]1934-they respective families]1937-their respective families towards a more intimate acquaintance . It had begun long ago . CHAPTER XVIII

As [they]1934-they were seated at [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley s breakfast - table at [The Bays]1944-the bays , parrying [her]263-aunt juley excessive hospitality and enjoying the view of [the bay]1945-the bay , a letter came for [Margaret]255-margaret and threw [her]255-margaret into perturbation . It was from [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles . [It]1946-it announced an " important change "[258-charles] in [his]258-charles plans . Owing to [Evie]262-evie s marriage , [he]258-charles had decided to give up [[his]258-charles house in [Ducie Street]130-ducie street]1947-his house in ducie street , and was willing to let [it]1947-his house in ducie street on a yearly tenancy . It was a businesslike letter , and stated frankly what [he]258-charles would do for [them]1934-they and what [he]258-charles would not do . Also the rent . If [they]1934-they approved , [Margaret]255-margaret was to come up AT ONCE -- the words were underlined , as is necessary when dealing with [women]743-women -- and to go over [the house]3796-the house with [him]258-charles . If [they]1934-they disapproved , a wire would oblige , as [he]258-charles should put it into the hands of [an agent]1950-an agent .

The letter perturbed , because [she]255-margaret was not sure what it meant . If [he]258-charles liked [her]255-margaret , if [he]258-charles had manoeuvred to get [her]255-margaret to [Simpson s]411-simpson , might this be a manoeuvre to get [her]255-margaret to [London]2-london , and result in an offer of marriage ? [She]255-margaret put it to [herself]255-margaret as indelicately as possible , in the hope that [her]255-margaret brain would cry , " Rubbish , [you]258-charles re [a self - conscious fool]4888-a self - conscious fool ! "[255-margaret] But [her]255-margaret brain only tingled a little and was silent , and for a time [she]255-margaret sat gazing at the mincing waves , and wondering whether the news would seem strange to [the others]3989-the others .

As soon as [she]255-margaret began speaking , the sound of [her]255-margaret own voice reassured [her]255-margaret . There could be nothing in it . The replies also were typical , and in the burr of conversation [her]255-margaret fears vanished .

Then [Margaret]255-margaret spoke rather seriously . " [I]255-margaret think , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret said , " that [our]4902-we race is degenerating . [We]4902-we can not settle even this little thing ; what will it be like when [we]4902-we have to settle a big one ? "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret was thinking of [father]699-father . " [[Your]255-margaret father]3943-your father may have been able to change countries , "[264-mrs. munt] said [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt with asperity , " and that may or may not be a good thing . " [Helen]254-helen may be right . "[254-helen]

" Of course [she]254-helen s right , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen .

[Helen]254-helen might be right , but [she]254-helen did not go up to [London]2-london . [Margaret]255-margaret did that . An interrupted holiday is the worst of the minor worries , and [one]3797-one may be pardoned for feeling morbid when a business letter snatches one away from [the sea]811-the sea and [friends]3831-friends . [She]255-margaret could not believe that [[her]255-margaret father]822-her father had ever felt the same . [Her]255-margaret eyes had been troubling [her]255-margaret lately , so that [she]255-margaret could not read in [the train]3864-the train and it bored [her]255-margaret to look at the landscape , which [she]255-margaret had seen but yesterday . At [Southampton]152-southampton [she]255-margaret " waved "[255-margaret] to [Frieda]287-frieda ; [Frieda]287-frieda was on [her]287-frieda way down to join [them]1959-them at [Swanage]12-swanage , and [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt had calculated that [[their]1959-them trains]1960-their trains would cross . But [Frieda]287-frieda was looking the other way , and [Margaret]255-margaret travelled on to [town]4380-town feeling solitary and old - maidish . How like [an old maid]4216-an old maid to fancy that [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles was courting [her]255-margaret ! [She]255-margaret had once visited [a spinster -- poor , silly , and unattractive -- whose mania it was that every man who approached [her]255-margaret]1963-a spinster -- poor , silly , and unattractive -- whose mania it was that every man who approached her fell in love . How [Margaret]255-margaret s heart had bled for the deluded thing ! How [she]255-margaret had lectured , reasoned , and in despair acquiesced ! " [I]255-margaret may have been deceived by [the curate]4922-the curate , [[my]255-margaret dear]3879-my dear , but [the young fellow who brings the midday post]4924-the young fellow who brings the midday post really is fond of [me]255-margaret , and has , as a matter of fact-- "[255-margaret] It had always seemed to [her]255-margaret the most hideous corner of old age , yet [she]255-margaret might be driven into it [herself]255-margaret by the mere pressure of virginity .

[Mr. Wilcox]258-charles met [her]255-margaret at [Waterloo]23-waterloo [himself]258-charles . [She]255-margaret felt certain that [he]258-charles was not the same as usual ; for one thing , [he]258-charles took offence at everything [she]255-margaret said .

" This is awfully kind of [you]258-charles , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret began , " but [I]255-margaret m afraid it s not going to do . [The house]3796-the house has not been built that suits [the Schlegel family]4926-the schlegel family . "[255-margaret]

" What ! Have [you]258-charles come up determined not to deal ? "[255-margaret]

" Not exactly . "[255-margaret]

" Not exactly ? In that case let s be starting . "[255-margaret]

[She]255-margaret lingered to admire the motor , which was new , and a fairer creature than the vermilion giant that had borne [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley to [her]263-aunt juley doom three years before .

" Presumably it s very beautiful , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret said . " How do [you]258-charles like it , [Crane]364-crane ? "[255-margaret]

" [Evie]262-evie ! "[1964-her host] [he]1964-her host echoed in injured tones . " [You]255-margaret won t see [her]262-evie . [She]262-evie s gone out with [Cahill]410-mr. cahill . " [You]258-charles are not as unpractical as [you]258-charles pretend . [I]258-charles shall never believe it . "[258-charles]

[Margaret]255-margaret laughed . But [she]255-margaret was -- quite as unpractical . [She]255-margaret could not concentrate on details . [Parliament]424-parliament , [the Thames]425-the thames , [the irresponsive chauffeur]1965-the irresponsive chauffeur , would flash into the field of [house]1015-house - hunting , and all demand some comment or response . It is impossible to see modern life steadily and see it whole , and [she]255-margaret had chosen to see it whole . [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles saw steadily . [He]258-charles never bothered over the mysterious or the private . [The Thames]425-the thames might run inland from [the sea]811-the sea , [the chauffeur]1445-the chauffeur might conceal all passion and philosophy beneath [his]258-charles unhealthy skin . [They]1969-they knew [their]1969-they own business , and [he]258-charles knew [his]258-charles .

Yet [she]255-margaret liked being with [him]258-charles . [He]258-charles was not a rebuke , but a stimulus , and banished morbidity . Some twenty years [her]255-margaret senior , [he]258-charles preserved a gift that [she]255-margaret supposed [herself]255-margaret to have already lost -- not youth s creative power , but its self - confidence and optimism . [He]258-charles was so sure that it was a very pleasant world . [His]258-charles complexion was robust , [his]258-charles hair had receded but not thinned , the thick moustache and the eyes that [Helen]254-helen had compared to brandy - balls had an agreeable menace in them , whether they were turned towards [the slums]1970-the slums or towards the stars . Some day -- in the millennium -- there may be no need for [his]258-charles type . At present , homage is due to it from those who think [themselves]1971-themselves superior , and who possibly are .

" At all events [you]255-margaret responded to [my]258-charles telegram promptly , "[258-charles] [he]258-charles remarked .

But the atmosphere was so charged with emotion that [people]3992-people only seemed to exist on [her]255-margaret account , and [she]255-margaret was surprised that [Crane]364-crane did not realise this , and turn round . Always a good judge of character for business purposes , [he]258-charles seemed this afternoon to enlarge [[his]258-charles field]1976-his field , and to note qualities outside neatness , obedience , and decision .

" [I]255-margaret want to go over [the whole house]4950-the whole house , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret announced when [they]1977-they arrived . "[255-margaret]

" Right . [The dining - room]3978-the dining - room . "[1977-they] And [they]1977-they began [their]1977-they survey .

[The dining - room]3978-the dining - room was big , but over - furnished . [Chelsea]151-chelsea would have moaned aloud . [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles had eschewed those decorative schemes that wince , and relent , and refrain , and achieve beauty by sacrificing comfort and pluck . After so much self - colour and self - denial , [Margaret]255-margaret viewed with relief the sumptuous dado , the frieze , the gilded wall - paper , amid whose foliage parrots sang . It would never do with [her]255-margaret own furniture , but those heavy chairs , that immense sideboard loaded with presentation plate , stood up against its pressure like [men]3835-men . [The room]1100-the room suggested [men]3835-men , and [Margaret]255-margaret , keen to derive [the modern capitalist]1982-the modern capitalist from [the warriors and hunters of the past]1983-the warriors and hunters of the past , saw [it]1100-the room as [an ancient guest - hall]1984-an ancient guest - hall , where [the lord]4148-the lord sat at meat among [[his]4148-the lord thanes]1986-his thanes . [They]1994-they proceeded to [the drawing - room]4101-the drawing - room . [Chelsea]151-chelsea managed better [here]3846-here . [It]151-chelsea was sallow and ineffective . [One]3797-one could visualise [the ladies]957-the ladies withdrawing to it , while [[their]957-the ladies lords]1999-their lords discussed life s realities below , to the accompaniment of cigars . Had [[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox s drawing - room at [Howards End]1-howards end]2000-mrs. wilcox s drawing - room at howards end looked thus ? But the proposal was not to rank among [the world]745-the world s great love scenes .

" [Miss Schlegel"--his]4959-miss schlegel"--his[255-margaret] voice was firm--"I have had [you]255-margaret up on false pretences . [I]255-margaret want to speak about a much more serious matter than [a house]3903-a house . "[255-margaret]

" Could [you]2003-you be induced to share [my]255-margaret -- is it probable-- "[255-margaret]

[He]2003-you began to stammer . " [Miss Schlegel]254-helen -- [Margaret]255-margaret [you]2003-you don t understand . "[2003-you]

" Oh yes ! Indeed , yes ! "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret .

" [I]2003-you am asking [you]2003-you to be [[my]2003-you wife]4135-my wife . "[2003-you]

So deep already was [her]255-margaret sympathy , that when [he]2003-you said , " [I]2003-you am asking [you]255-margaret to be [[my]2003-you wife]4135-my wife , "[2003-you] [she]255-margaret made [herself]255-margaret give a little start . [She]255-margaret must show surprise if [he]2003-you expected it . An immense joy came over [her]255-margaret . It was indescribable . It had nothing to do with humanity , and most resembled the all - pervading happiness of fine weather . Fine weather is due to the sun , but [Margaret]255-margaret could think of no central radiance here . [She]255-margaret stood in [[his]2003-you drawing - room]2004-his drawing - room happy , and longing to give happiness . On leaving [him]2003-you [she]255-margaret realised that the central radiance had been love .

" [You]2003-you aren t offended , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ? "[255-margaret]

" How could [I]255-margaret be offended ? "[255-margaret]

There was a moment s pause . [He]2003-you was anxious to get rid of [her]255-margaret , and [she]255-margaret knew it . [She]255-margaret had too much intuition to look at [him]2003-you as [he]2003-you struggled for possessions that money can not buy . [He]2003-you desired comradeship and affection , but [he]2003-you feared [them]2005-i , and [she]255-margaret , who had taught [herself]255-margaret only to desire , and could have clothed the struggle with beauty , held back , and hesitated with [him]2003-you .

" Good - bye , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret continued . " [You]2003-you will have a letter from [me]255-margaret -- [I]255-margaret am going back to [Swanage]12-swanage to - morrow . "[255-margaret]

" That would be most kind . "[255-margaret]
