Mists were rising from [the river]4300-the river , and presently it became invisible , though it whispered more loudly . There had been a heavy downpour in [the Welsh hills]2592-the welsh hills .

CHAPTER XXVI

Next morning a fine mist covered [the peninsula]2512-the peninsula . The weather promised well , and the outline of [the castle mound]2568-the castle mound grew clearer each moment that [Margaret]255-margaret watched [it]2568-the castle mound . Presently [she]255-margaret saw [the keep]2590-the keep , and the sun painted the rubble gold , and charged the white sky with blue . The shadow of [the house]3796-the house gathered itself together , and fell over [the garden]3800-the garden . A cat looked up at [her]255-margaret window and mewed . Lastly [the river]4300-the river appeared , still holding the mists between [its]4300-the river banks and [its]4300-the river overhanging alders , and only visible as far as [a hill]2599-a hill , which cut off [its]4300-the river upper reaches .

[Margaret]255-margaret was fascinated by [Oniton]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret had said that [she]255-margaret loved it , but it was rather its romantic tension that held [her]255-margaret . [The rounded Druids of whom [she]255-margaret had caught glimpses in [her]255-margaret drive]2600-the rounded druids of whom she had caught glimpses in her drive , the rivers hurrying down from [them]2600-the rounded druids of whom she had caught glimpses in her drive to [England]34-england , [the carelessly modelled masses of [the lower hills]2602-the lower hills]2601-the carelessly modelled masses of the lower hills , thrilled [her]255-margaret with poetry . [The house]3796-the house was insignificant , but the prospect from it would be an eternal joy , and [she]255-margaret thought of [all the friends [she]255-margaret would have to stop in it]2604-all the friends she would have to stop in it , and of the conversion of [Henry]355-henry [himself]355-henry to a rural life . Society , too , promised favourably . [The rector of [the parish]2606-the parish]2605-the rector of the parish had dined with [them]2607-them last night , and [she]255-margaret found that [he]2605-the rector of the parish was [a friend of [[her]255-margaret father]822-her father s]2608-a friend of her father s , and so knew what to find in [her]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret liked [him]2605-the rector of the parish . [He]2605-the rector of the parish would introduce [her]255-margaret to [the town]4299-the town . While , on [her]255-margaret other side , [Sir James Bidder]463-sir james bidder sat , repeating that [she]255-margaret only had to give the word , and [he]463-sir james bidder would whip up [the county families]2611-the county families for twenty miles round . Whether [Sir James]463-sir james bidder , who was [Garden Seeds]478-garden seeds , had promised what [he]463-sir james bidder could perform , [she]255-margaret doubted , but so long as [Henry]355-henry mistook [them]2611-the county families for [the county families]2611-the county families when [they]2611-the county families did call , [she]255-margaret was content .

[Charles Wilcox]258-charles and [Albert Fussell]337-albert fussell now crossed [the lawn]3816-the lawn . [They]2614-they were going for a morning dip , and [a servant]2615-a servant followed [them]2614-they with [their]2614-they bathing - suits . [She]255-margaret had meant to take a stroll [herself]255-margaret before breakfast , but saw that the day was still sacred to [men]3835-men , and amused [herself]255-margaret by watching [their]3835-men contretemps . In the first place the key of [the bathing - shed]2617-the bathing - shed could not be found . [Charles]258-charles stood by the riverside with folded hands , tragical , while [the servant]2462-the servant shouted , and was misunderstood by [another servant in [the garden]3800-the garden]2619-another servant in the garden . Then came a difficulty about a springboard , and soon [three people]2621-three people were running backwards and forwards over [the meadow]3817-the meadow , with orders and counter orders and recriminations and apologies . If [Margaret]255-margaret wanted to jump from [a motor - car]1200-a motor - car , [she]255-margaret jumped ; if [Tibby]259-tibby thought paddling would benefit [his]259-tibby ankles , [he]259-tibby paddled ; if [a clerk]2624-a clerk desired adventure , [he]259-tibby took a walk in the dark . But [these athletes]2625-these athletes seemed paralysed . [They]2625-these athletes could not bathe without [their]2625-these athletes appliances , though the morning sun was calling and the last mists were rising from [the dimpling stream]2626-the dimpling stream . Had [they]2625-these athletes found the life of the body after all ? [She]255-margaret thought of the bathing arrangements as they should be in [her]255-margaret day -- no worrying of [servants]3975-servants , no appliances , beyond good sense . [Her]255-margaret reflections were disturbed by [the quiet child]2480-the quiet child , who had come out to speak to the cat , but was now watching [her]255-margaret watch [the men]1547-the men . " [Miss Wilcox]404-miss wilcox is up-- "[2175-the child] [the child]2175-the child whispered , and then became unintelligible .

[They]2637-they screamed , [they]2637-they laughed , [they]2637-they sang , and the dog barked .

[Margaret]255-margaret screamed a little too , but without conviction . [She]255-margaret could not feel that a wedding was so funny . Perhaps something was missing in [her]255-margaret equipment .

[Henry]355-henry was already installed ; [he]355-henry ate slowly and spoke little , and was , in [Margaret]255-margaret s eyes , [the only member of [[their]2637-they party]854-their party who dodged emotion successfully . [She]255-margaret had abandoned any plan of action . [She]255-margaret must remain [herself]255-margaret , for [his]2669-the butler sake as well as [her]255-margaret own , since [a shadowy wife]2673-a shadowy wife degrades [the husband whom [she]255-margaret accompanies]2674-the husband whom she accompanies ; and [she]255-margaret must assimilate for reasons of common honesty , since [she]255-margaret had no right to marry [a man]569-a man and make [him]569-a man uncomfortable . There had been a great many refusals , and after all it was not a very big affair -- not as big as [Margaret]255-margaret s would be . [She]255-margaret left [him]468-colonel fussell without a word . For it was not [her]255-margaret tragedy ; it was [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox s.

CHAPTER XXVII

[Helen]254-helen began to wonder why [she]254-helen had spent a matter of eight pounds in making [some people]4040-some people ill and [others]802-others angry . Now that the wave of excitement was ebbing , and had left [her]254-helen , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast , and [Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast stranded for the night in [a Shropshire hotel]2779-a shropshire hotel , [she]254-helen asked [herself]254-helen what forces had made the wave flow . At all events , no harm was done . [Margaret]255-margaret would play the game properly now , and though [Helen]254-helen disapproved of [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister s methods , [she]254-helen knew that [the Basts]397-the basts would benefit by [them]2781-them in the long - run .

" [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles is so illogical , "[254-helen] [she]254-helen explained to [Leonard]311-leonard , who had put [[his]311-leonard wife]1358-his wife to bed , and was sitting with [her]1358-his wife in [the empty coffee - room]2783-the empty coffee - room . " If [we]5404-we told [him]258-charles it was [his]258-charles duty to take [you]1358-his wife on , [he]258-charles might refuse to do it . The fact is , [he]258-charles isn t properly educated . [I]254-helen don t want to set [you]311-leonard against [him]258-charles , but [you]311-leonard ll find [him]258-charles a trial . "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen can never thank [you]1358-his wife sufficiently , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , "[254-helen] was all that [Leonard]311-leonard felt equal to .

" [I]254-helen believe in personal responsibility . Don t [you]1358-his wife ? And in personal everything . [I]254-helen hate -- [I]254-helen suppose [I]254-helen oughtn t to say that -- but [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes are on the wrong tack surely . Or perhaps it isn t [their]260-the wilcoxes fault . Perhaps the little thing that says [I]254-helen is missing out of the middle of [their]260-the wilcoxes heads , and then it s a waste of time to blame [them]260-the wilcoxes . There s a nightmare of a theory that says a special race is being born which will rule the rest of [us]5405-us in the future just because it lacks the little thing that says [I.]254-helen Had [you]311-leonard heard that ? "[254-helen]

" [I]2784-his benefactress get no time for reading . "[2784-his benefactress]

" Had [you]311-leonard thought it , then ? That there are [two kinds of people]5406-two kinds of people -- [[our]5405-us kind , who live straight from the middle of [their]260-the wilcoxes heads , and [the other kind who can t]5408-the other kind who can t , because [their]5408-the other kind who can t heads have no middle]5407-our kind , who live straight from the middle of their heads , and the other kind who can t , because their heads have no middle ? [They]260-the wilcoxes can t say I. [They]260-the wilcoxes AREN T in fact , and so [they]260-the wilcoxes re [supermen]5409-supermen . [Pierpont Morgan]487-pierpont morgan has never said [I]254-helen in [his]487-pierpont morgan life . "[254-helen]

[Leonard]311-leonard roused [himself]311-leonard . If [[his]311-leonard benefactress]2784-his benefactress wanted intellectual conversation , [she]2784-his benefactress must have it . [She]2784-his benefactress was more important than [his]311-leonard ruined past . " [I]311-leonard never got on to [Nietzsche]488-nietzsche , "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard said . " But [I]311-leonard always understood that [those supermen]5410-those supermen were rather what [you]2784-his benefactress may call [egoists]5411-egoists . "[311-leonard]

" Oh no , that s wrong , "[254-helen] replied [Helen]254-helen . " [No superman]5412-no superman ever said [I]254-helen want , because [I]254-helen want must lead to the question , Who am [I]254-helen ? and so to [Pity]489-pity and to Justice . [He]5412-no superman only says want . Want [Europe]45-europe , if [he]5412-no superman s [Napoleon]279-napoleon ; want [wives]5413-wives , if [he]5412-no superman s [Bluebeard]490-bluebeard ; want [Botticelli]491-botticelli , if [he]5412-no superman s [Pierpont Morgan]487-pierpont morgan . Never the [I]254-helen ; and if [you]5414-you could pierce through the superman , [you]5414-you d find panic and emptiness in the middle . "[254-helen]

[Leonard]311-leonard was silent for a moment . Then [he]311-leonard said : " May [I]311-leonard take it , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , that [you]254-helen and [I]311-leonard are both the sort that say [I]311-leonard ? "[311-leonard]

" Of course . "[311-leonard]

" And [[your]254-helen sister]4244-your sister , too ? "[311-leonard]

" Of course , "[254-helen] repeated [Helen]254-helen , a little sharply . [She]254-helen was annoyed with [Margaret]255-margaret , but did not want [her]255-margaret discussed . " [All presentable people]5416-all presentable people say [I.]311-leonard "[254-helen]

" But [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles -- [he]258-charles is not perhaps-- "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen don t know that it s any good discussing [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles either . "[254-helen]

" Quite so , quite so , "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard agreed . [Helen]254-helen asked [herself]254-helen why [she]254-helen had snubbed [him]311-leonard . Once or twice during the day [she]254-helen had encouraged [him]311-leonard to criticise , and then had pulled [him]311-leonard up short . Was [she]254-helen afraid of [him]311-leonard presuming ? If so , it was disgusting of [her]254-helen .

But [he]311-leonard was thinking the snub quite natural . Everything [she]254-helen did was natural , and incapable of causing offence . While [the Miss Schlegels]267-the schlegels were together [he]311-leonard had felt [them]2785-them scarcely human -- a sort of admonitory whirligig . But [a Miss Schlegel]254-helen alone was different . [She]254-helen was in [Helen]254-helen s case unmarried , in [Margaret]255-margaret s about to be married , in neither case an echo of [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister . A light had fallen at last into [this rich upper world]2787-this rich upper world , and [he]311-leonard saw that [it]2787-this rich upper world was full of [men]3835-men and [women]743-women , some of whom were more friendly to [him]311-leonard than [others]802-others . [Helen]254-helen had become " [his]311-leonard "[254-helen] [Miss Schlegel , who scolded [him]311-leonard and corresponded with [him]311-leonard , and had swept down yesterday with grateful vehemence]254-helen . [Margaret]255-margaret , though not unkind , was severe and remote . [He]311-leonard would not presume to help [her]255-margaret , for instance . [He]311-leonard had never liked [her]255-margaret , and began to think that [his]311-leonard original impression was true , and that [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister did not like [her]255-margaret either . [Helen]254-helen was certainly lonely . [She]254-helen , who gave away so much , was receiving too little . [Leonard]311-leonard was pleased to think that [he]311-leonard could spare [her]254-helen vexation by holding [his]311-leonard tongue and concealing what [he]311-leonard knew about [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles . [Jacky]318-jacky had announced [her]254-helen discovery when [he]318-jacky fetched [her]254-helen from [the lawn]3816-the lawn . After the first shock , [he]318-jacky did not mind for [himself]318-jacky . By now [he]318-jacky had no illusions about [[his]318-jacky wife]1358-his wife , and this was only one new stain on the face of a love that had never been pure . To keep perfection perfect , that should be [his]318-jacky ideal , if the future gave [him]318-jacky time to have ideals . [Helen]254-helen , and [Margaret]255-margaret for [Helen]254-helen s sake , must not know .

[Helen]254-helen disconcerted [him]318-jacky by turning the conversation to [[his]318-jacky wife]1358-his wife . " [Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast -- does [she]1358-his wife ever say [I]1358-his wife ? "[1358-his wife] [she]1358-his wife asked , half mischievously , and then , " Is [she]1358-his wife very tired ? "[1358-his wife]

" It s better [she]1358-his wife stops in [[her]1358-his wife room]5417-her room , "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard .

" Shall [I]1358-his wife sit up with [her]1358-his wife ? "[1358-his wife]

" No , thank [you]318-jacky ; [she]1358-his wife does not need company . "[1358-his wife]

" [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast , what kind of woman is [[your]318-jacky wife]4576-your wife ? "[1358-his wife]

[Leonard]311-leonard blushed up to [his]311-leonard eyes .

" [You]1358-his wife ought to know [my]1358-his wife ways by now . Does that question offend [you]1358-his wife ? "[1358-his wife]

" No , oh no , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , no . "[1358-his wife]

" Because [I]1358-his wife love honesty . Don t pretend [your]1358-his wife marriage has been a happy one . [You]1358-his wife and [she]1358-his wife can have nothing in common . "[1358-his wife]

[He]311-leonard did not deny it , but said shyly : " [I]311-leonard suppose that s pretty obvious ; but [Jacky]318-jacky never meant to do [anybody]2762-anybody any harm . When things went wrong , or [I]311-leonard heard things , [I]311-leonard used to think it was [her]1358-his wife fault , but , looking back , it s more mine . [I]311-leonard needn t have married [her]1358-his wife , but as [I]311-leonard have [I]311-leonard must stick to [her]1358-his wife and keep [her]1358-his wife . "[311-leonard]

" How long have [you]311-leonard been married ? "[1358-his wife]

" Nearly three years . "[311-leonard]

" What did [[your]311-leonard people]5420-your people say ? "[1358-his wife]

" [They]5420-your people will not have anything to do with [us]5420-your people . [They]5420-your people had a sort of family council when [they]5420-your people heard [I]311-leonard was married , and cut [us]5420-your people off altogether . "[311-leonard]

[Helen]254-helen began to pace up and down [the room]1100-the room . " [[My]254-helen good boy]5421-my good boy , what a mess ! "[254-helen] [she]254-helen said gently . " Who are [[your]2796-your people]5420-your people ? "[254-helen]

[He]2796-your could answer this . [[His]2796-your parents]2797-his parents , who were dead , had been in trade ; [[his]2796-your sisters]1556-his sisters had married [commercial travellers]2799-commercial travellers ; [[his]2796-your brother]754-his brother was [a lay - reader]2801-a lay - reader .

[He]2802-you was silent .

" [I]254-helen think [I]254-helen have guessed now , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen very gravely .

" [I]717-the man don t think so , [Miss Schlegel]254-helen ; [I]717-the man hope not . "[717-the man]

" [We]5433-we must be honest , even over these things . [I]717-the man have guessed . [I]717-the man am frightfully , dreadfully sorry , but it does not make the least difference to [me]717-the man . [I]717-the man shall feel just the same to both of [you]5434-you . [I]717-the man blame , not [[your]5434-you wife]4576-your wife for these things , but [men]3835-men . "[717-the man]

[Leonard]311-leonard left it at that -- so long as [she]254-helen did not guess [the man]717-the man . [She]254-helen stood at the window and slowly pulled up the blinds . [The hotel]2474-the hotel looked over [a dark square]2805-a dark square . The mists had begun . When [she]254-helen turned back to [him]717-the man [her]254-helen eyes were shining . " Don t [you]254-helen worry , "[717-the man] [he]717-the man pleaded . " [I]717-the man can t bear that . [We]5437-we shall be all right if [I]717-the man get work . If [I]717-the man could only get work -- something regular to do . Then it wouldn t be so bad again . [I]717-the man don t trouble after books as [I]717-the man used . [I]717-the man can imagine that with regular work [we]5437-we should settle down again . It stops [one]3797-one thinking . "[717-the man]

" Settle down to what ? "[254-helen]

" Oh , just settle down . "[717-the man]

" And that s to be life ! "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen , with a catch in [her]254-helen throat . " How can [you]717-the man , with all the beautiful things to see and do -- with music -- with walking at night-- "[254-helen]

"[717-the man]

" Why not ? "[254-helen] asked [Helen]254-helen , throwing up the window .

" Because [I]254-helen see [one]3797-one must have money . "[254-helen]

" Well , [you]717-the man re wrong . "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen wish [I]254-helen was wrong , but -- [the clergyman]5444-the clergyman -- [he]5444-the clergyman has money of [his]5444-the clergyman own , or else [he]5444-the clergyman s paid ; [the poet]971-the poet or [the musician]5446-the musician -- just the same ; [the tramp]5447-the tramp -- [he]5444-the clergyman s no different . [The tramp]5447-the tramp goes to [the workhouse]5449-the workhouse in the end , and is paid for with [other people]779-other people s money . [Miss Schlegel]254-helen , the real thing s money , and all the rest is a dream . "[254-helen]

" [You]717-the man re still wrong . [You]717-the man ve forgotten [Death]495-death . "[254-helen]

[Leonard]311-leonard could not understand .

" If [we]5451-we lived forever , what [you]717-the man say would be true . But [we]5451-we have to die , [we]5451-we have to leave life presently . Injustice and greed would be the real thing if [we]5451-we lived for ever . As it is , [we]5451-we must hold to other things , because [Death]495-death is coming . [I]254-helen love [Death]495-death -- not morbidly , but because [He]5444-the clergyman explains . [He]5444-the clergyman shows [me]254-helen the emptiness of Money . [Death]495-death and [Money]398-money are the eternal foes . Not [Death]495-death and Life . Never mind what lies behind [Death]495-death , [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast , but be sure that [the poet]971-the poet and [the musician]5446-the musician and [the tramp]5447-the tramp will be happier in it than [the man who has never learnt to say]5455-the man who has never learnt to say , [I]254-helen am [I.]254-helen "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen wonder . "[254-helen]

" [We]5451-we are all in a mist -- [I]254-helen know , but [I]254-helen can help [you]5456-you this far -- [men like [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes]3813-men like the wilcoxes are deeper in the mist than any . [Sane , sound Englishmen]496-sane , sound englishmen ! building up empires , levelling [all the world]5458-all the world into what [they]496-sane , sound englishmen call common sense . But mention [Death]495-death to [them]496-sane , sound englishmen and [they]496-sane , sound englishmen re offended , because [Death]495-death s really [Imperial]497-imperial , and [He]495-death cries out against [them]496-sane , sound englishmen for ever . "[254-helen]

" [I]254-helen am as afraid of [Death]495-death as [any one]4050-any one . "[254-helen]

" But not of the idea of [Death]495-death . "[254-helen]

" But what is the difference ? "[254-helen]

" Infinite difference , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen , more gravely than before .

[Leonard]311-leonard looked at [her]254-helen wondering , and had the sense of great things sweeping out of the shrouded night . But [he]311-leonard could not receive them , because [his]311-leonard heart was still full of little things . As the lost umbrella had spoilt the concert at [Queen s Hall]52-queen s hall , so the lost situation was obscuring the diviner harmonies now . [Death]495-death , Life , and Materialism were fine words , but would [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles take [him]311-leonard on as [a clerk]2624-a clerk ? Talk as [one]3797-one would , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles was king of [this world]1721-this world , [the superman]2809-the superman , with [his]258-charles own morality , whose head remained in the clouds .

" [I]258-charles must be stupid , "[258-charles] [he]258-charles said apologetically .

While to [Helen]254-helen the paradox became clearer and clearer . " [Death]495-death destroys [a man]569-a man : the idea of [Death]495-death saves [him]569-a man . "[258-charles] Behind the coffins and the skeletons that stay the vulgar mind lies something so immense that all that is great in [us]2810-us responds to it . [Men of [the world]745-the world]2811-men of the world may recoil from the charnel - house that [they]2811-men of the world will one day enter , but [Love]434-love knows better . [Death]495-death is [[his]311-leonard foe]2813-his foe , but [[his]311-leonard peer]2814-his peer , and in [their]2815-their age - long struggle the thews of [Love]434-love have been strengthened , and [his]311-leonard vision cleared , until there is [no one who can stand against [him]311-leonard]2816-no one who can stand against him .

" So never give in , "[877-the girl] continued [the girl]877-the girl , and restated again and again the vague yet convincing plea that the Invisible lodges against the Visible . [Her]877-the girl excitement grew as [she]877-the girl tried to cut the rope that fastened [Leonard]311-leonard to [the earth]1372-the earth . Woven of bitter experience , it resisted [her]877-the girl . Presently [the waitress]2819-the waitress entered and gave [her]877-the girl a letter from [Margaret]255-margaret . Another note , addressed to [Leonard]311-leonard , was inside . [They]2820-they read them , listening to the murmurings of [the river]4300-the river .

CHAPTER XXVIII

For many hours [Margaret]255-margaret did nothing ; then [she]255-margaret controlled [herself]255-margaret , and wrote some letters . [She]255-margaret was too bruised to speak to [Henry]355-henry ; [she]255-margaret could pity [him]355-henry , and even determine to marry [him]355-henry , but as yet all lay too deep in [her]255-margaret heart for speech . On the surface the sense of [his]355-henry degradation was too strong . [She]255-margaret could not command voice or look , and the gentle words that [she]255-margaret forced out through [her]255-margaret pen seemed to proceed from [some other person]2822-some other person .

" [[My]255-margaret dearest boy]5461-my dearest boy , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret began , " this is not to part [us]5462-us . It is everything or nothing , and [I]255-margaret mean it to be nothing . It happened long before [we]5462-us ever met , and even if it had happened since , [I]255-margaret should be writing the same , [I]255-margaret hope . [I]255-margaret do understand . "[255-margaret]

But [she]255-margaret crossed out " [I]255-margaret do understand "[255-margaret] ; it struck a false note . [Henry]355-henry could not bear to be understood . [She]255-margaret also crossed out , " It is everything or nothing . "[255-margaret] [Henry]355-henry would resent so strong a grasp of the situation . [She]255-margaret must not comment ; comment is unfeminine .

" [I]255-margaret think that ll about do , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret thought .

Then the sense of [his]355-henry degradation choked [her]255-margaret . Was [he]355-henry worth all this bother ? To have yielded to [a woman of that sort]2823-a woman of that sort was everything , yes , it was , and [she]255-margaret could not be [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife . [She]255-margaret tried to translate [his]355-henry temptation into [her]255-margaret own language , and [her]255-margaret brain reeled . [Men]3835-men must be different even to want to yield to such a temptation . [Her]255-margaret belief in comradeship was stifled , and [she]255-margaret saw life as from [that glass saloon on the Great Western which sheltered male and female alike from the fresh air]2826-that glass saloon on the great western which sheltered male and female alike from the fresh air . Are the sexes really races , each with its own code of morality , and [their]3835-men mutual love a mere device of Nature to keep things going ? Strip human intercourse of the proprieties , and is it reduced to this ? [Her]255-margaret judgment told [her]255-margaret no . [She]255-margaret knew that out of [Nature]374-nature s device [we]2827-we have built a magic that will win [us]2827-we immortality . Far more mysterious than the call of sex to sex is the tenderness that [we]2827-we throw into that call ; far wider is the gulf between [us]2827-we and [the farmyard]1860-the farmyard than between [the farmyard]1860-the farmyard and the garbage that nourishes it . [We]2827-we are evolving , in ways that Science can not measure , to ends that [Theology]436-theology dares not contemplate . " [Men]3835-men did produce one jewel , "[1810-the gods] [the gods]1810-the gods will say , and , saying , will give [us]2827-we immortality . [Margaret]255-margaret knew all this , but for the moment [she]255-margaret could not feel it , and transformed the marriage of [Evie]262-evie and [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill into a carnival of [fools]2831-fools , and [her]255-margaret own marriage -- too miserable to think of that , [she]255-margaret tore up the letter , and then wrote another :

" [DEAR MR . BAST]313-mr. bast , "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret have spoken to [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles about [you]313-mr. bast , as [I]255-margaret promised , and am sorry to say that [he]258-charles has no vacancy for [you]313-mr. bast . "[255-margaret]

" [Yours]313-mr. bast truly , "[255-margaret]

" [M. J. SCHLEGEL]334-m. j. schlegel . "[255-margaret]

[She]255-margaret enclosed this in a note to [Helen]254-helen , over which [she]255-margaret took less trouble than [she]255-margaret might have done ; but [her]255-margaret head was aching , and [she]255-margaret could not stop to pick [her]255-margaret words :

" [DEAR HELEN]498-helen , "[255-margaret]

" Give [him]258-charles this . [The Basts]397-the basts are no good . [Henry]355-henry found [the woman]718-the woman drunk on [the lawn]3816-the lawn . [I]255-margaret am having [a room]3793-a room got ready for [you]255-margaret here , and will [you]255-margaret please come round at once on getting this ? [The Basts]397-the basts are not at all the type [we]5467-we should trouble about . [I]255-margaret may go round to [them]2832-them [myself]255-margaret in the morning , and do anything that is fair . "[255-margaret]

" M. "[255-margaret]

In writing this , [Margaret]255-margaret felt that [she]255-margaret was being practical . Something might be arranged for [the Basts]397-the basts later on , but [they]2832-them must be silenced for the moment . [She]255-margaret hoped to avoid a conversation between [the woman]718-the woman and [Helen]498-helen . [She]255-margaret rang the bell for [a servant]2615-a servant , but [no one]633-no one answered it ; [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles and [the Warringtons]2696-the warringtons were gone to bed , and [the kitchen]1026-the kitchen was abandoned to [Saturnalia]499-saturnalia . Consequently [she]255-margaret went over to [the George]394-the george [herself]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret did not enter [the hotel]2474-the hotel , for discussion would have been perilous , and , saying that the letter was important , [she]255-margaret gave it to [the waitress]2819-the waitress . As [she]255-margaret recrossed [the square]2840-the square [she]255-margaret saw [Helen]498-helen and [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast looking out of the window of [the coffee - room]2476-the coffee - room , and feared [she]255-margaret was already too late . [Her]255-margaret task was not yet over ; [she]255-margaret ought to tell [Henry]355-henry what [she]255-margaret had done .

This came easily , for [she]255-margaret saw [him]355-henry in [the hall]948-the hall . The night wind had been rattling the pictures against the wall , and the noise had disturbed [him]355-henry .

" Who s [there]884-there ? "[355-henry] [he]355-henry called , quite [the householder]2843-the householder .

[Margaret]255-margaret walked in and past [him]355-henry .

" [I]255-margaret have asked [Helen]498-helen to sleep , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret said . " [She]498-helen is best [here]3846-here ; so don t lock the front - door . "[255-margaret]

" [I]355-henry thought [some one]3973-some one had got in , "[355-henry] said [Henry]355-henry .

" At the same time [I]2843-the householder told [the man]717-the man that [we]5472-we could do nothing for [him]717-the man . [I]2843-the householder don t know about later , but now [the Basts]397-the basts must clearly go . "[2843-the householder]

[He]2844-he tapped a little gong , which had been bought to summon [the servants]4350-the servants .

" [You]2843-the householder must make more noise than that if [you]2843-the householder want [them]4350-the servants to hear . "[2843-the householder]

[Henry]355-henry opened a door , and down [the corridor]2846-the corridor came shouts of laughter . " Far too much screaming there , "[355-henry] [he]355-henry said , and strode towards [it]2847-it . [Margaret]255-margaret went [upstairs]575-upstairs , uncertain whether to be glad that [they]2849-they had met , or sorry . [They]2849-they had behaved as if nothing had happened , and [her]255-margaret deepest instincts told [her]255-margaret that this was wrong . For [his]355-henry own sake , some explanation was due .

And yet -- what could an explanation tell [her]255-margaret ? A date , a place , a few details , which [she]255-margaret could imagine all too clearly . Now that the first shock was over , [she]255-margaret saw that there was every reason to premise [a Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast . [Henry]355-henry s inner life had long laid open to [her]255-margaret -- [his]355-henry intellectual confusion , [his]355-henry obtuseness to personal influence , [his]355-henry strong but furtive passions . Should [she]255-margaret refuse [him]355-henry because [his]355-henry outer life corresponded ? Perhaps . Perhaps , if the dishonour had been done to [her]255-margaret , but it was done long before [her]255-margaret day . [She]255-margaret struggled against the feeling . [She]255-margaret told [herself]255-margaret that [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox s wrong was [her]255-margaret own . But [she]255-margaret was not [a barren theorist]574-a barren theorist . As [she]255-margaret undressed , [her]255-margaret anger , [her]255-margaret regard for the dead , [her]255-margaret desire for a scene , all grew weak . [Henry]355-henry must have it as [he]355-henry liked , for [she]255-margaret loved [him]355-henry , and some day [she]255-margaret would use [her]255-margaret love to make [him]355-henry [a better man]2851-a better man .

Pity was at the bottom of [her]255-margaret actions all through this crisis . Pity , if [one]3797-one may generalise , is at the bottom of [woman]3834-woman . When [[men]3835-men like [us]2856-us]2855-men like us , it is for [our]2856-us better qualities , and however tender [their]3835-men liking , [we]2856-us dare not be unworthy of it , or [they]3835-men will quietly let [us]2856-us go . But unworthiness stimulates [woman]3834-woman . It brings out [her]3834-woman deeper nature , for good or for evil .

Here was the core of the question . [Henry]355-henry must be forgiven , and made better by love ; nothing else mattered . [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox , [that unquiet yet kindly ghost]2858-that unquiet yet kindly ghost , must be left to [her]257-mrs. wilcox own wrong . To [her]257-mrs. wilcox everything was in proportion now , and [she]257-mrs. wilcox , too , would pity [the man who was blundering up and down [their]2860-their lives]2859-the man who was blundering up and down their lives . Had [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox known of [his]355-henry trespass ? An interesting question , but [Margaret]255-margaret fell asleep , tethered by affection , and lulled by the murmurs of [the river]4300-the river that descended all the night from [Wales]135-wales . [She]255-margaret felt [herself]255-margaret at one with [[her]255-margaret future home]2437-her future home , colouring it and coloured by it , and awoke to see , for the second time , [Oniton Castle]217-oniton castle conquering the morning mists .

CHAPTER XXIX

" [Henry dear--]355-henry "[255-margaret] was [her]255-margaret greeting .

[He]355-henry had finished [his]355-henry breakfast , and was beginning the Times . [[His]355-henry sister - in - law]2411-his sister - in - law was packing . " [You]255-margaret re referring to last evening , "[355-henry] [he]355-henry said huskily . " [I]355-henry have released [you]255-margaret from [your]255-margaret engagement . " [I]355-henry am unworthy of [you]254-helen , "[355-henry] [he]355-henry began . [She]254-helen kissed [his]355-henry hand . "[355-henry]

" It is difficult for [us]5483-we , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret ; " but if [we]5483-we are worth marrying , [we]5483-we do guess . "[255-margaret]

" Not to [me]255-margaret . "[255-margaret]

[He]2869-he laughed bitterly . [Margaret]255-margaret went to the sideboard and helped [herself]255-margaret to one of the breakfast dishes . Gravely [she]2875-she considered this claim . Had [he]2874-he ? Had [he]2874-he suffered tortures of remorse , or had it been , " There ! that s over . Now for respectable life again "[2874-he] ? [Henry]355-henry was anxious to be terrible , but had not got it in [him]355-henry . [He]355-henry was [a good average Englishman]2879-a good average englishman , who had slipped . The really culpable point -- [his]355-henry faithlessness to [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox -- never seemed to strike [him]355-henry . [She]2875-she longed to mention [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox .

And bit by bit the story was told [her]2875-she . It was a very simple story . Ten years ago was the time , [a garrison town in [Cyprus]146-cyprus [the place]5183-the place]2880-a garrison town in cyprus the place . "[2875-she] [She]2875-she chose [her]2875-she words carefully , and so saved [him]355-henry from panic . [Margaret]255-margaret looked intently at [the butler]2669-the butler . On [her]255-margaret return from [the George]5373-the george [the building operations]2892-the building operations were complete , and [the old Henry]355-henry fronted [her]255-margaret , competent , cynical , and kind . [He]355-henry had made a clean breast , had been forgiven , and the great thing now was to forget [his]355-henry failure , and to send it the way of other unsuccessful investments . [Their]2894-they memory hampered [him]318-jacky . [He]318-jacky could scarcely attend to [Margaret]255-margaret , who brought back disquieting news from [the George]394-the george . [Margaret]255-margaret took [his]2896-he arm . The beautiful weather soothed [her]255-margaret . But the wheels of [Evie]262-evie s wedding were still at work , tossing [the guests]4092-the guests outwards as deftly as [they]4092-the guests had drawn [them]4092-the guests in , and [she]255-margaret could not be with [him]2896-he long . It had been arranged that [they]2898-they should motor to [Shrewsbury]208-shrewsbury , whence [he]2896-he would go north , and [she]255-margaret back to [London]2-london with [the Warringtons]500-the warringtons . For a fraction of time [she]255-margaret was happy . Then [her]255-margaret brain recommenced .

" [I]255-margaret am afraid there has been gossiping of some kind at [the George]394-the george . [Helen]254-helen would not have left unless [she]254-helen had heard something . " Yes -- yes , [Henry]355-henry ? "[255-margaret]

" Yes , [I]255-margaret m practical , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret murmured , stooping over the mowing - machine and playing with the grass which trickled through [her]255-margaret fingers like sand .

[He]2896-he had silenced [her]255-margaret , but [her]255-margaret fears made [him]2896-he uneasy . Not for the first time , [he]2896-he was threatened with blackmail . [He]2896-he was rich and supposed to be moral ; [the Basts]397-the basts knew that [he]2896-he was not , and might find it profitable to hint as much .

" At all events , [you]255-margaret mustn t worry , "[2896-he] [he]2896-he said . " This is [a man]569-a man s business . "[2896-he] [He]2896-he thought intently . " On no account mention it to [anybody]2762-anybody . "[2896-he]

[Margaret]255-margaret flushed at advice so elementary , but [he]2896-he was really paving the way for a lie . If necessary [he]2896-he would deny that [he]2896-he had ever known [Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast , and prosecute [her]389-mrs. bast for libel . Perhaps [he]2896-he never had known [her]389-mrs. bast . Here was [Margaret]255-margaret , who behaved as if [he]2896-he had not . There [the house]3796-the house . Round [them]2900-them were [half a dozen gardeners , clearing up after [[his]2896-he daughter]1120-his daughter s wedding]2901-half a dozen gardeners , clearing up after his daughter s wedding . All was so solid and spruce , that the past flew up out of sight like a spring - blind , leaving only the last five minutes unrolled .

Glancing at these , [he]2896-he saw that [the car]1432-the car would be round during the next five , and plunged into action . Gongs were tapped , orders issued , [Margaret]255-margaret was sent to dress , and [the housemaid]2904-the housemaid to sweep up the long trickle of grass that [she]389-mrs. bast had left across [the hall]948-the hall . As is [Man]3959-man to [the Universe]220-the universe , so was the mind of [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles to the minds of [some men]2907-some men -- a concentrated light upon a tiny spot , a little Ten Minutes moving self - contained through its appointed years . No Pagan [he]2896-he , who lives for the Now , and may be wiser than [all philosophers]2908-all philosophers . [He]2896-he lived for the five minutes that have past , and the five to come ; [he]2896-he had the business mind .

How did [he]2896-he stand now , as [his]2896-he motor slipped out of Oniton and breasted [the great round hills]2909-the great round hills ? [Margaret]255-margaret had heard a certain rumour , but was all right . [She]255-margaret had forgiven [him]2896-he , [God]274-god bless [her]255-margaret , and [he]2896-he felt [the manlier for it]2910-the manlier for it . [Charles]258-charles and [Evie]262-evie had not heard it , and never must hear . No more must [Paul]256-paul . Over [[his]256-paul children]805-his children [he]256-paul felt great tenderness , which [he]256-paul did not try to track to a cause ; [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox was too far back in [his]256-paul life . [He]256-paul did not connect [her]257-mrs. wilcox with the sudden aching love that [he]256-paul felt for [Evie]262-evie . [Poor little Evie]262-evie ! [he]256-paul trusted that [Cahill]410-mr. cahill would make [her]257-mrs. wilcox [a decent husband]2912-a decent husband .

And [Margaret]255-margaret ? How did [she]255-margaret stand ?

[She]255-margaret had several minor worries . Clearly [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister had heard something . [She]255-margaret dreaded meeting [her]544-her sister in [town]4380-town . And [she]255-margaret was anxious about [Leonard]311-leonard , for whom [they]2915-they certainly were responsible . Nor ought [Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast to starve . But the main situation had not altered . [She]255-margaret still loved [Henry]355-henry . [His]355-henry actions , not [his]355-henry disposition , had disappointed [her]255-margaret , and [she]255-margaret could bear that . And [she]255-margaret loved [[her]255-margaret future [home]894-home]2437-her future home . Standing up in [the car]1432-the car , just where [she]255-margaret had leapt from [it]1432-the car two days before , [she]255-margaret gazed back with deep emotion upon [Oniton]255-margaret . Besides [the Grange]2573-the grange and [the Castle keep]2920-the castle keep , [she]255-margaret could now pick out [the church]1321-the church and the black - and - white gables of [the George]5373-the george . There was [the bridge]1755-the bridge , and [the river]4300-the river nibbling [[its]4300-the river green peninsula]2925-its green peninsula . [She]255-margaret could even see [the bathing - shed]2617-the bathing - shed , but while [she]255-margaret was looking for [Charles]258-charles s new spring - board , [the forehead of [the hill]2527-the hill]2927-the forehead of the hill rose and hid the whole scene .

[She]255-margaret never saw it again . Day and night [the river]4300-the river flows down into [England]34-england , day after day the sun retreats into [the Welsh mountains]2930-the welsh mountains , and the tower chimes , See [the Conquering Hero]502-the conquering hero . But [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes have no part in [the place]5183-the place , nor in [any place]2932-any place . It is not [their]260-the wilcoxes names that recur in [the parish register]2933-the parish register . It is not [their]260-the wilcoxes ghosts that sigh among the alders at evening . [They]260-the wilcoxes have swept into [the valley]2934-the valley and swept out of [it]2934-the valley , leaving a little dust and a little money behind .

CHAPTER XXX

[Tibby]259-tibby was now approaching [his]259-tibby last year at [Oxford]96-oxford . [He]259-tibby had moved out of college , and was contemplating [the Universe]220-the universe , or such portions of it as concerned [him]259-tibby , from [[his]259-tibby comfortable lodgings in [Long Wall]222-long wall]2935-his comfortable lodgings in long wall . [He]259-tibby was not concerned with much . When [a young man]663-a young man is untroubled by passions and sincerely indifferent to public opinion [his]663-a young man outlook is necessarily limited . [Tibby]259-tibby wished neither to strengthen the position of [the rich]977-the rich nor to improve that of [the poor]906-the poor , and so was well content to watch the elms nodding behind [the mildly embattled parapets of [Magdalen]223-magdalen]2939-the mildly embattled parapets of magdalen . There are worse lives . Though selfish , [he]259-tibby was never cruel ; though affected in manner , [he]259-tibby never posed . Like [Margaret]255-margaret , [he]259-tibby disdained the heroic equipment , and it was only after many visits that [men]3835-men discovered [Schlegel]254-helen to possess a character and a brain . [He]259-tibby had done well in Mods , much to the surprise of [those who attended lectures and took proper exercise]2941-those who attended lectures and took proper exercise , and was now glancing disdainfully at [Chinese]503-chinese in case [he]259-tibby should some day consent to qualify as [a Student Interpreter]2942-a student interpreter . [He]259-tibby noticed , in a distant way , that [[his]259-tibby sister]1391-his sister had altered .

An answer came back very civil and quiet in tone -- such an answer as [Tibby]259-tibby [himself]259-tibby would have given . The cheque was returned , the legacy refused , [the writer]2972-the writer being in no need of money . [Tibby]259-tibby forwarded this to [Helen]254-helen , adding in the fulness of [his]259-tibby heart that [Leonard Bast]311-leonard seemed somewhat [a monumental person after all]2973-a monumental person after all . [Helen]254-helen s reply was frantic . [He]259-tibby was to take no notice . [He]259-tibby was to go down at once and say that [she]254-helen commanded acceptance . [He]259-tibby went . A scurf of books and china ornaments awaited [him]259-tibby . [The Basts]397-the basts had just been evicted for not paying [their]2974-their rent , and had wandered [no one]633-no one knew whither . [Helen]254-helen had begun bungling with [her]254-helen money by this time , and had even sold out [her]254-helen shares in [the [Nottingham]27-nottingham and [Derby]28-derby Railway]621-the nottingham and derby railway . For some weeks [she]254-helen did nothing . Then [she]254-helen reinvested , and , owing to the good advice of [[her]254-helen stockbrokers]2977-her stockbrokers , became rather richer than [she]254-helen had been before .

CHAPTER XXXI

[Houses]4042-houses have [their]4042-houses own ways of dying , falling as variously as the generations of [men]3835-men , some with a tragic roar , some quietly , but to an after - life in [the city of ghosts]2980-the city of ghosts , while from [others]802-others -- and thus was the death of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place -- the spirit slips before the body perishes . [It]11-wickham place had decayed in the spring , disintegrating [the girls]626-the girls more than [they]626-the girls knew , and causing either to accost [unfamiliar regions]2983-unfamiliar regions . By September it was a corpse , void of emotion , and scarcely hallowed by the memories of thirty years of happiness . Through [its]11-wickham place round - topped doorway passed furniture , and pictures , and books , until [the last room]2984-the last room was gutted and [the last van]2985-the last van had rumbled away . [It]11-wickham place stood for a week or two longer , open - eyed , as if astonished at [its]11-wickham place own emptiness . Then it fell . [Navvies]509-navvies came , and spilt it back into the grey . With [their]509-navvies muscles and [their]509-navvies beery good temper , [they]509-navvies were not the worst of undertakers for [a house which had always been human]2986-a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end .

The furniture , with a few exceptions , went down into [Hertfordshire]73-hertfordshire , [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles having most kindly offered [Howards End]1-howards end as [a warehouse]2987-a warehouse . [Mr. Bryce]451-mr. bryce had died abroad -- an unsatisfactory affair -- and as there seemed little guarantee that the rent would be paid regularly , [he]451-mr. bryce cancelled the agreement , and resumed possession [himself]451-mr. bryce . Until [he]451-mr. bryce relet [the house]3796-the house , [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels were welcome to stack [their]2989-their furniture in [the garage]1398-the garage and [lower rooms]2991-lower rooms . [Margaret]255-margaret demurred , but [Tibby]259-tibby accepted the offer gladly ; it saved [him]259-tibby from coming to any decision about the future . The plate and the more valuable pictures found [a safer home in [London]2-london]2992-a safer home in london , but the bulk of the things went country - ways , and were entrusted to the guardianship of [Miss Avery]456-miss avery .

Shortly before the move , [[our]2993-our hero]2994-our hero and [heroine]2995-heroine were married . [They]2996-they have weathered the storm , and may reasonably expect peace . To have no illusions and yet to love -- what stronger surety can [a woman]1045-a woman find ? [She]255-margaret had seen [[her]255-margaret husband]1134-her husband s past as well as [his]1134-her husband heart . [She]255-margaret knew [her]255-margaret own heart with a thoroughness that [commonplace people]2999-commonplace people believe impossible . The heart of [Mrs. Wilcox]257-mrs. wilcox was alone hidden , and perhaps it is superstitious to speculate on the feelings of [the dead]1413-the dead . [They]2996-they were married quietly -- really quietly , for as the day approached [she]255-margaret refused to go through another [Oniton]255-margaret . [[Her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother gave [her]255-margaret away , [[her]255-margaret aunt]546-her aunt , who was out of health , presided over a few colourless refreshments . [The Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes were represented by [Charles]258-charles , who witnessed the marriage settlement , and by [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill . [Paul]256-paul did send a cablegram . In a few minutes , and without the aid of music , [the clergyman]5444-the clergyman made [them]2996-they [man]3959-man and [wife]4799-wife , and soon the glass shade had fallen that cuts off [married couples]2089-married couples from [the world]745-the world . [She]255-margaret , [a monogamist]3008-a monogamist , regretted the cessation of some of life s innocent odours ; [he]3959-man , whose instincts were polygamous , felt morally braced by the change and less liable to the temptations that had assailed [him]3959-man in the past .

[They]2996-they spent [their]2996-they honeymoon near [Innsbruck]227-innsbruck . [Henry]355-henry knew of [a reliable hotel there]3009-a reliable hotel there , and [Margaret]255-margaret hoped for a meeting with [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister . In this [she]255-margaret was disappointed . As [they]2996-they came south , [Helen]254-helen retreated over [the Brenner]228-the brenner , and wrote an unsatisfactory post - card from [the shores of [the Lake of Garda]229-the lake of garda]3011-the shores of the lake of garda , saying that [her]254-helen plans were uncertain and had better be ignored . Evidently [she]254-helen disliked meeting [Henry]355-henry . Two months are surely enough to accustom [an outsider]4473-an outsider to a situation which [a wife]1409-a wife has accepted in two days , and [Margaret]255-margaret had again to regret [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister s lack of self - control . In a long letter [she]255-margaret pointed out the need of charity in sexual matters ; so little is known about [them]3015-them ; it is hard enough for [those who are personally touched to judge]3016-those who are personally touched to judge ; then how futile must be the verdict of Society . " [I]254-helen don t say there is no standard , for that would destroy morality ; only that there can be no standard until [our]5540-our impulses are classified and better understood . "[254-helen] [Helen]254-helen thanked [her]255-margaret for [her]255-margaret kind letter -- rather a curious reply . [She]254-helen moved south again , and spoke of wintering in [Naples]71-naples .

[Mr. Wilcox]258-charles was not sorry that the meeting failed . [Helen]254-helen left [him]258-charles time to grow skin over [his]258-charles wound . There were still moments when it pained [him]258-charles . Had [he]258-charles only known that [Margaret]255-margaret was awaiting [him]258-charles -- [Margaret]255-margaret , so lively and intelligent , and yet so submissive -- [he]258-charles would have kept [himself]258-charles worthier of [her]255-margaret . Incapable of grouping the past , [he]258-charles confused the episode of [Jacky]318-jacky with another episode that had taken place in the days of [his]258-charles bachelorhood . [The two]1179-the two made one crop of wild oats , for which [he]258-charles was heartily sorry , and [he]258-charles could not see that those oats are of a darker stock which are rooted in another s dishonour . Unchastity and infidelity were as confused to [him]258-charles as to [the Middle Ages]3018-the middle ages , [[his]258-charles only moral teacher]3019-his only moral teacher . [Ruth]354-ruth ( [poor old Ruth]354-ruth ! ) did not enter into [his]258-charles calculations at all , for [poor old Ruth]354-ruth had never found [him]258-charles out .

[His]258-charles affection for [[his]258-charles present wife]3020-his present wife grew steadily . [Her]3020-his present wife cleverness gave [him]258-charles no trouble , and , indeed , [he]258-charles liked to see [her]3020-his present wife reading poetry or something about social questions ; it distinguished [her]3020-his present wife from [the wives of [other men]1018-other men]3021-the wives of other men . [He]258-charles had only to call , and [she]3020-his present wife clapped the book up and was ready to do what [he]258-charles wished . Then [they]3023-they would argue so jollily , and once or twice [she]3020-his present wife had [him]258-charles in quite a tight corner , but as soon as [he]258-charles grew really serious , [she]3020-his present wife gave in . [Man]3959-man is for war , [woman]3834-woman for the recreation of [the warrior]3026-the warrior , but [he]258-charles does not dislike it if [she]3020-his present wife makes a show of fight . [She]3020-his present wife can not win in a real battle , having no muscles , only nerves . Nerves make [her]3020-his present wife jump out of [a moving motor - car]3027-a moving motor - car , or refuse to be married fashionably . [The warrior]3026-the warrior may well allow [her]3020-his present wife to triumph on such occasions ; [they]3026-the warrior move not the imperishable plinth of things that touch [his]3026-the warrior peace .

[Margaret]255-margaret had a bad attack of these nerves during the honeymoon . [He]258-charles told [her]255-margaret -- casually , as was [his]258-charles habit -- that [Oniton Grange]206-oniton grange was let . [She]255-margaret showed [her]255-margaret annoyance , and asked rather crossly why [she]255-margaret had not been consulted .

" [I]258-charles didn t want to bother [you]255-margaret , "[258-charles] [he]258-charles replied . " Besides , [I]258-charles have only heard for certain this morning . "[258-charles]

" Where are [we]5541-we to live ? "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , trying to laugh . " [I]255-margaret loved [the place]5183-the place extraordinarily . Don t [you]258-charles believe in having [a permanent home]5543-a permanent home , [Henry]355-henry ? "[255-margaret]

[He]258-charles assured [her]255-margaret that [she]255-margaret misunderstood [him]258-charles . It is [home]894-home life that distinguishes [us]3030-us from [the foreigner]3031-the foreigner . But [he]258-charles did not believe in [a damp home]3032-a damp home .

" This is news . [I]3031-the foreigner never heard till this minute that [Oniton]255-margaret was damp . "[3031-the foreigner]

" [[My]258-charles dear]3879-my dear girl!"--he[258-charles] flung out [his]258-charles hand--"have [you]3879-my dear eyes ? have [you]3879-my dear a skin ? How could it be anything but damp in such a situation ? In the first place , [the Grange]212-the grange is on clay , and built where the castle moat must have been ; then there s [that detestable little river]5545-that detestable little river , steaming all night like a kettle . Feel the cellar walls ; look up under the eaves . Ask [Sir James]5546-sir james or any one . [[Those Shropshire]5547-those shropshire valleys]5548-those shropshire valleys are notorious . The only possible place for [a house in [Shropshire]132-shropshire]5549-a house in shropshire is on [a hill]2599-a hill ; but , for [my]3031-the foreigner part , [I]3031-the foreigner think [the country]4215-the country is too far from [London]2-london , and the scenery nothing special . "[3031-the foreigner]

[Margaret]255-margaret could not resist saying , " Why did [you]258-charles go [there]884-there , then ? "[255-margaret]

" [I]258-charles -- because-- "[258-charles] [He]258-charles drew [his]258-charles head back and grew rather angry . " Why have [we]5553-we come to [the Tyrol]230-the tyrol , if it comes to that ? [One]3797-one might go on asking such questions indefinitely . "[258-charles]

[One]3797-one might ; but [he]258-charles was only gaining time for a plausible answer . Out it came , and [he]258-charles believed it as soon as it was spoken .

" The truth is , [I]255-margaret took Oniton on account of [Evie]262-evie . Don t let this go any further . "[255-margaret]

" Certainly not . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret shouldn t like [her]262-evie to know that [she]262-evie nearly let [me]255-margaret in for a very bad bargain . No sooner did [I]255-margaret sign the agreement than [she]262-evie got engaged . [Poor little girl]5555-poor little girl ! [She]262-evie was so keen on it all , and wouldn t even wait to make proper inquiries about the shooting . Afraid it would get snapped up -- just like all of [your]258-charles sex . Well , no harm s done . [She]262-evie has had [her]262-evie country wedding , and [I]255-margaret ve got rid of [my]255-margaret goose to [some fellows who are starting [a preparatory school]5557-a preparatory school]5556-some fellows who are starting a preparatory school . "[255-margaret]

" Where shall [we]3035-we live , then , [Henry]355-henry ? [I]255-margaret should enjoy living somewhere . "[255-margaret]

" [I]255-margaret have not yet decided . What about [Norfolk]231-norfolk ? "[255-margaret]

[Margaret]255-margaret was silent . Marriage had not saved [her]255-margaret from the sense of flux . [London]2-london was but a foretaste of this nomadic civilisation which is altering human nature so profoundly , and throws upon personal relations a stress greater than [they]3034-they have ever borne before . Under cosmopolitanism , if it comes , [we]3035-we shall receive no help from [the earth]1372-the earth . Trees and [meadows and mountains]3037-meadows and mountains will only be a spectacle , and the binding force that [they]3034-they once exercised on character must be entrusted to Love alone . May Love be equal to the task !

" It is now what ? "[355-henry] continued [Henry]355-henry . " Nearly October . Let [us]3035-we camp for the winter at [Ducie Street]130-ducie street , and look out for something in the spring . "[355-henry]

" If possible , something permanent . [I]255-margaret can t be as young as [I]255-margaret was , for these alterations don t suit [me]255-margaret . "[255-margaret]

" But , [[my]355-henry dear]3879-my dear , which would [you]3879-my dear rather have -- alterations or rheumatism ? "[355-henry]

" [I]255-margaret see [your]355-henry point , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , getting up . " If [Oniton]255-margaret is really damp , it is impossible , and must be inhabited by [little boys]5559-little boys . Only , in the spring , let [us]3035-we look before [we]3035-we leap . [I]255-margaret will take warning by [Evie]262-evie , and not hurry [you]3879-my dear . Remember that [you]3879-my dear have a free hand this time . These endless moves must be bad for the furniture , and are certainly expensive . "[255-margaret]

" What [a practical little woman]5560-a practical little woman it is ! What s it been reading ? [Theo]510-theo -- theo -- how much ? "[355-henry]

" Theosophy . "[255-margaret]

So [Ducie Street]130-ducie street was [her]255-margaret first fate -- a pleasant enough fate . [The house]3796-the house , being only a little larger than [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , trained [her]255-margaret for [the immense establishment that was promised in the spring]3039-the immense establishment that was promised in the spring . [They]3040-they were frequently away , but at [home]894-home life ran fairly regularly . In the morning [Henry]355-henry went to business , and [his]355-henry sandwich -- a relic this of some prehistoric craving -- was always cut by [her]255-margaret own hand . [He]355-henry did not rely upon the sandwich for lunch , but liked to have it by [him]355-henry in case [he]355-henry grew hungry at eleven . When [he]355-henry had gone , there was [the house to look after]3042-the house to look after , and [the servants]4350-the servants to humanise , and several kettles of [Helen]254-helen s to keep on the boil . [Her]255-margaret conscience pricked [her]255-margaret a little about [the Basts]397-the basts ; [she]255-margaret was not sorry to have lost sight of them . No doubt [Leonard]311-leonard was worth helping , but being [[Henry]355-henry s wife]3044-henry s wife , [she]255-margaret preferred to help [some one else]3045-some one else . As for theatres and discussion societies , [they]3046-they attracted [her]255-margaret less and less . [She]255-margaret began to " miss "[3046-they] new movements , and to spend [her]255-margaret spare time re - reading or thinking , rather to the concern of [[her]255-margaret Chelsea friends]3047-her chelsea friends . [They]3047-her chelsea friends attributed the change to [her]255-margaret marriage , and perhaps some deep instinct did warn [her]255-margaret not to travel further from [[her]255-margaret husband]1134-her husband than was inevitable . Yet the main cause lay deeper still ; [she]255-margaret had outgrown stimulants , and was passing from words to things . It was doubtless a pity not to keep up with [Wedekind]511-wedekind or [John]318-jacky , but some closing of the gates is inevitable after thirty , if the mind itself is to become a creative power .

CHAPTER XXXII

[She]255-margaret was looking at plans one day in the following spring -- [they]3049-they had finally decided to go down into [Sussex]232-sussex and build -- when [Mrs. Charles Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox was announced .

" Have [you]255-margaret heard the news ? "[3050-dolly] [Dolly]3050-dolly cried , as soon as [she]3050-dolly entered [the room]1100-the room . " [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox is so ang -- [I]3050-dolly mean [he]1134-her husband is sure [you]3050-dolly know about it , or , rather , that [you]3050-dolly don t know . "[3050-dolly]

" Why , [Dolly]5561-dolly ! "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret , placidly kissing [her]3050-dolly . " Here s a surprise ! How are [the boys]5562-the boys and [the baby]5090-the baby ? "[255-margaret]

[Boys]4128-boys and [the baby]5090-the baby were well , and in describing a great row that there had been at [the Hilton Tennis Club]3054-the hilton tennis club , [Dolly]3055-dolly forgot [her]3055-dolly news . " [I]3055-dolly suppose the paper . "[3055-dolly]

" No , don t bother . That s eight months [she]254-helen has been away , surely ? "[3055-dolly]

" Exactly . [She]254-helen left just after [Evie]262-evie s wedding . It would be eight months . "[255-margaret]

" Just when [baby]4406-baby was born , then ? "[3055-dolly]

" Just so . "[255-margaret]

[Dolly]3061-dolly sighed , and stared enviously round [the drawing - room]4101-the drawing - room . [She]3061-dolly was beginning to lose [her]3061-dolly brightness and good looks . " Oh , yes , "[3061-dolly] [she]3061-dolly cried , " that is it : [Miss Avery]456-miss avery has been unpacking [your]3069-dolly packing - cases . "[3061-dolly]

" It was far more than an air , "[3069-dolly] said [Dolly]3069-dolly solemnly . " The floor sounds covered with books . [Charles]258-charles sent [me]3069-dolly to know what is to be done , for [he]258-charles feels certain [you]3069-dolly don t know . "[3069-dolly]

" [I]255-margaret am very much obliged to [you]5569-dolly , [Dolly]5572-dolly . What can have come over [Miss Avery]456-miss avery ? [I]255-margaret must go down about it at once . " Didn t [you]5569-dolly know [she]456-miss avery gave [Evie]262-evie a present last August , and [Evie]262-evie returned it , and then -- oh , goloshes ! [You]5569-dolly never read such a letter as [Miss Avery]456-miss avery wrote . "[3061-dolly]

" Why does that make any difference , [Dolly]5577-dolly ? "[3061-dolly]

" [You]5569-dolly accepted a present from [Miss Avery]456-miss avery when [you]5569-dolly were married . "[3061-dolly]

[Uncle Percy]439-uncle percy and [Albert]337-albert fussell and [father]699-father and [Charles]258-charles all said it was quite impossible , and when [four men]5582-four men agree , what is [a girl]4170-a girl to do ? [Evie]262-evie didn t want to upset the old thing , so thought a sort of joking letter best , and returned the pendant straight to [the shop]5584-the shop to save [Miss Avery]456-miss avery trouble . "[3061-dolly]

" But [Miss Avery]456-miss avery said-- "[3061-dolly]

" Did [she]456-miss avery give any reasons ? "[3061-dolly]

" [We]5588-we think [she]456-miss avery meant to be invited to [Oniton]255-margaret , and so climb into society . "[3071-dolly]

" That s a notion . Give every one [their]5590-their due , eh ? Well , [I]3071-dolly suppose [I]3071-dolly ought to be toddling . " Oh yes . "[3073-dolly]

" [I]3073-dolly wonder , then , why [he]355-henry let [me]3073-dolly ask [her]456-miss avery to look after [the house]3796-the house . "[3073-dolly]

" But [she]456-miss avery s only [a farm woman]5579-a farm woman , "[3075-dolly] said [Dolly]3075-dolly , and [her]3075-dolly explanation proved correct . " [I]355-henry have patience with [a man who knows [his]355-henry job]5593-a man who knows his job , "[355-henry] [he]355-henry would say , really having patience with the job , and not [the man]717-the man . Paradoxical as it may sound , [he]355-henry had something of [the artist]3079-the artist about [him]355-henry ; [he]355-henry would pass over an insult to [[his]355-henry daughter]1120-his daughter sooner than lose [a good charwoman for [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife]3081-a good charwoman for his wife .

[Margaret]255-margaret judged it better to settle the little trouble [herself]255-margaret . [Parties]514-parties were evidently ruffled . With [Henry]355-henry s permission , [she]255-margaret wrote a pleasant note to [Miss Avery]456-miss avery , asking [her]456-miss avery to leave the cases untouched . Then , at the first convenient opportunity , [she]255-margaret went down [herself]255-margaret , intending to repack [her]255-margaret belongings and store them properly in [the local warehouse]3083-the local warehouse ; the plan had been amateurish and a failure . [Tibby]259-tibby promised to accompany [her]255-margaret , but at the last moment begged to be excused . So , for the second time in [her]255-margaret life , [she]255-margaret entered [the house]3796-the house alone .

CHAPTER XXXIII

The day of [her]255-margaret visit was exquisite , and the last of unclouded happiness that [she]255-margaret was to have for many months . [Her]255-margaret anxiety about [Helen]254-helen s extraordinary absence was still dormant , and as for a possible brush with [Miss Avery]456-miss avery -- that only gave zest to the expedition . [She]255-margaret had also eluded [Dolly]3085-dolly s invitation to luncheon . Walking straight up from [the station]582-the station , [she]255-margaret crossed [the village green]3087-the village green and entered [the long chestnut avenue]3088-the long chestnut avenue that connects [it]3087-the village green with [the church]1321-the church . [The church]1321-the church itself stood in [the village]3925-the village once . But [it]1321-the church there attracted [so many worshippers]3092-so many worshippers that [the devil]3093-the devil , in a pet , snatched it from its foundations , and poised it on [an inconvenient knoll]3094-an inconvenient knoll , three quarters of a mile away . If this story is true , [the chestnut avenue]3095-the chestnut avenue must have been planted by [the angels]3096-the angels . Up [the avenue]3101-the avenue [Margaret]255-margaret strolled slowly , stopping to watch the sky that gleamed through the upper branches of the chestnuts , or to finger the little horseshoes on the lower branches . Why has not [England]34-england a great mythology ? [Our]3102-our folklore has never advanced beyond daintiness , and the greater melodies about [[our]3102-our country - side]3103-our country - side have all issued through the pipes of [Greece]144-greece . Deep and true as the native imagination can be , it seems to have failed here . It has stopped with [the witches]3104-the witches and the fairies . It can not vivify one fraction of a summer field , or give names to half a dozen stars . [England]34-england still waits for the supreme moment of [her]3105-her literature -- for [the great poet who shall voice [her]3105-her , or , better still for the thousand little poets whose voices shall pass into [our]3102-our common talk]3106-the great poet who shall voice her , or , better still for the thousand little poets whose voices shall pass into our common talk .

At [the church]1321-the church the scenery changed . [She]255-margaret followed [it]4597-a road for over a mile . Its little hesitations pleased [her]255-margaret . [Margaret]255-margaret was silent . It was a criticism of [Henry]355-henry s character far more trenchant than any of [her]255-margaret own . [She]255-margaret felt dissatisfied .

" But that s all over , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret went on . " A better time is coming now , though [you]255-margaret ve kept [me]255-margaret long enough waiting . " [We]5663-we are not coming , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret firmly . [She]255-margaret respected [Miss Avery]456-miss avery too much to humour [her]255-margaret . " No . Not coming . "[255-margaret]

" Certainly , [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , "[456-miss avery] said [Miss Avery]456-miss avery , and resigned [her]456-miss avery duties with a smile .

Relieved at this conclusion , and having sent [her]255-margaret compliments to [Madge]255-margaret , [Margaret]255-margaret walked back to [the station]582-the station . [She]255-margaret had intended to go to [the furniture warehouse]3194-the furniture warehouse and give directions for removal , but the muddle had turned out more extensive than [she]255-margaret expected , so [she]255-margaret decided to consult [Henry]355-henry . [He]355-henry was strongly against employing [the local man whom [he]355-henry had previously recommended]3195-the local man whom he had previously recommended , and advised [her]255-margaret to store in [London]2-london after all .

But before this could be done an unexpected trouble fell upon [her]255-margaret .

CHAPTER XXXIV

It was not unexpected entirely . [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley s health had been bad all winter . [She]263-aunt juley had had a long series of colds and coughs , and had been too busy to get rid of them . [She]263-aunt juley had scarcely promised [[her]263-aunt juley niece]620-her niece " to really take [my]3197-that spring party that after all gathered in that hospitable house tiresome chest in hand , "[3197-that spring party that after all gathered in that hospitable house] when [she]263-aunt juley caught a chill and developed acute pneumonia . [Margaret]255-margaret and [Tibby]259-tibby went down to [Swanage]12-swanage . [Helen]254-helen was telegraphed for , and [that spring party that after all gathered in [that hospitable house]3198-that hospitable house]3197-that spring party that after all gathered in that hospitable house had all the pathos of fair memories . On a perfect day , when the sky seemed blue porcelain , and the waves of [the discreet little bay]3199-the discreet little bay beat gentlest of tattoos upon the sand , [Margaret]255-margaret hurried up through the rhododendrons , confronted again by the senselessness of Death . One death may explain itself , but it throws no light upon another ; the groping inquiry must begin anew . [Preachers]3200-preachers or [scientists]3201-scientists may generalise , but [we]3202-we know that no generality is possible about [those whom [we]3202-we love]3203-those whom we love ; not one heaven awaits [them]3203-those whom we love , not even one oblivion . [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley , incapable of tragedy , slipped out of life with odd little laughs and apologies for having stopped in it so long . [She]255-margaret was very weak ; [she]255-margaret could not rise to the occasion , or realise the great mystery which all agree must await [her]255-margaret ; it only seemed to [her]255-margaret that [she]255-margaret was quite done up -- more done up than ever before ; that [she]255-margaret saw and heard and felt less every moment ; and that , unless something changed , [she]255-margaret would soon feel nothing . [Her]255-margaret spare strength [she]255-margaret devoted to plans : could not [Margaret]3204-margaret take some steamer expeditions ? were mackerel cooked as [Tibby]259-tibby liked them ? [She]255-margaret worried [herself]255-margaret about [Helen]254-helen s absence , and also that [she]3204-margaret should be the cause of [Helen]254-helen s return . [The nurses]3205-the nurses seemed to think such interests quite natural , and perhaps [hers]3204-margaret was an average approach to [the Great Gate]239-the great gate . But [Margaret]255-margaret saw [Death]495-death stripped of any false romance ; whatever the idea of Death may contain , the process can be trivial and hideous .

" Important -- [Margaret]255-margaret dear , take [the Lulworth]195-lulworth when [Helen]254-helen comes . "[255-margaret]

" No doubt [she]254-helen will change [her]254-helen mind when [she]254-helen sees [us]5668-us . [She]254-helen has not the least balance . "[264-mrs. munt]

That was the stock criticism about [Helen]254-helen , but [Margaret]255-margaret s voice trembled as [she]255-margaret made it . By now [she]255-margaret was deeply pained at [[her]255-margaret sister]544-her sister s behaviour . It may be unbalanced to fly out of [England]34-england , but to stay away eight months argues that the heart is awry as well as the head . [A sick - bed]3207-a sick - bed could recall [Helen]254-helen , but [she]254-helen was deaf to more human calls ; after a glimpse at [[her]254-helen aunt]546-her aunt , [she]254-helen would retire into [her]254-helen nebulous life behind some poste restante . [She]254-helen scarcely existed ; [her]254-helen letters had become dull and infrequent ; [she]254-helen had no wants and no curiosity . And it was all put down to [poor Henry]355-henry s account ! [Henry]355-henry , long pardoned by [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife , was still too infamous to be greeted by [[his]355-henry sister - in - law]2411-his sister - in - law . It was morbid , and , to [her]255-margaret alarm , [Margaret]255-margaret fancied that [she]255-margaret could trace the growth of morbidity back in [Helen]254-helen s life for nearly four years . The flight from [Oniton]255-margaret ; the unbalanced patronage of [the Basts]397-the basts ; the explosion of grief up on [the Downs]240-the downs -- all connected with [Paul]256-paul , [an insignificant boy whose lips had kissed [hers]255-margaret for a fraction of time]3211-an insignificant boy whose lips had kissed hers for a fraction of time . Reaction against [the Wilcoxes]260-the wilcoxes had eaten into [her]255-margaret life until [she]255-margaret was scarcely sane . At twenty - five [she]255-margaret had an idee fixe . What hope was there for [her]255-margaret as [an old woman]2348-an old woman ?

The more [Margaret]255-margaret thought about it the more alarmed [she]255-margaret became . For many months [she]255-margaret had put the subject away , but it was too big to be slighted now . There was almost a taint of madness . Were all [Helen]254-helen s actions to be governed by a tiny mishap , such as may happen to [any young man]3214-any young man or [woman]3834-woman ? Can human nature be constructed on lines so insignificant ? The blundering little encounter at [Howards End]1-howards end was vital . It propagated itself where graver intercourse lay barren ; it was stronger than sisterly intimacy , stronger than reason or books . In one of [her]254-helen moods [Helen]254-helen had confessed that [she]254-helen still " enjoyed "[254-helen] it in a certain sense . [Paul]256-paul had faded , but the magic of [his]256-paul caress endured . And where there is enjoyment of the past there may also be reaction -- propagation at both ends .

Well , it is odd and sad that [our]3216-our minds should be such seed - beds , and [we]3216-our without power to choose the seed . But [man]3959-man is [an odd , sad creature as yet]3218-an odd , sad creature as yet , intent on pilfering [the earth]1372-the earth , and heedless of the growths within [himself]3959-man . [He]3959-man can not be bored about psychology . [He]3959-man leaves it to [the specialist]3220-the specialist , which is as if [he]3959-man should leave [his]3959-man dinner to be eaten by a steam - engine . [Margaret]255-margaret and [Helen]254-helen have been more patient , and it is suggested that [Margaret]255-margaret has succeeded -- so far as success is yet possible . [She]255-margaret does understand [herself]255-margaret , [she]255-margaret has some rudimentary control over [her]255-margaret own growth . Whether [Helen]254-helen has succeeded [one]3797-one can not say .

The day that [Mrs. Munt]264-mrs. munt rallied [Helen]254-helen s letter arrived . [She]264-mrs. munt had posted it at [Munich]224-munich , and would be in [London]2-london [herself]264-mrs. munt on the morrow . It was a disquieting letter , though the opening was affectionate and sane .

[Henry]355-henry began to grow serious . Ill - health was to [him]355-henry something perfectly definite . " [You]355-henry want to get hold of [her]254-helen ? "[355-henry] [he]355-henry said . " That s the problem , isn t it ? [She]254-helen has got to see [a doctor]5689-a doctor . "[355-henry]

" For all [I]3254-the genial , tentative host know [she]254-helen has seen one already . "[3254-the genial , tentative host]

CHAPTER XXXV

One speaks of the moods of spring , but the days that are [[her]3269-her true children]3270-her true children have only one mood ; they are all full of the rising and dropping of winds , and the whistling of birds . New flowers may come out , the green embroidery of the hedges increase , but the same heaven broods overhead , soft , thick , and blue , [the same figures , seen and unseen]3271-the same figures , seen and unseen , are wandering by coppice and meadow . The morning that [Margaret]255-margaret had spent with [Miss Avery]456-miss avery , and the afternoon [she]255-margaret set out to entrap [Helen]254-helen , were the scales of a single balance . Time might never have moved , rain never have fallen , and [man]3959-man alone , with [his]3959-man schemes and ailments , was troubling [Nature]374-nature until [he]3959-man saw [her]255-margaret through a veil of tears .

[She]255-margaret protested no more . Whether [Henry]355-henry was right or wrong , [he]355-henry was most kind , and [she]255-margaret knew of no other standard by which to judge [him]355-henry .
