CHAPTER XXXVIII

The tragedy began quietly enough , and , like many another talk , by [the man]717-the man s deft assertion of [his]717-the man superiority . [Henry]355-henry heard [her]255-margaret arguing with [the driver]3397-the driver , stepped out and settled [the fellow , who was inclined to be rude]3398-the fellow , who was inclined to be rude , and then led the way to some chairs on [the lawn]3816-the lawn . " But [the diddums]5822-the diddums can t listen ; [he]717-the man isn t nine months old , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret pleaded .

" [Helen]254-helen commands [my]355-henry sympathy , "[355-henry] said [Henry]355-henry . " As [[your]255-margaret husband]5175-your husband , [I]355-henry shall do all for [her]254-helen that [I]355-henry can , and [I]355-henry have no doubt that [she]254-helen will prove more sinned against than sinning . [She]3413-she controlled [herself]3413-she for the last time . " No , let [us]3411-they go back to [Helen]254-helen s request , "[3413-she] [she]3413-she said . " It is unreasonable , but the request of [an unhappy girl]5873-an unhappy girl . Tomorrow [she]254-helen will go to [Germany]3-germany , and trouble society no longer . " As [I]255-margaret have actually been forgiven-- ? "[255-margaret]

" Never mind for the moment what [I]255-margaret mean by that , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret . " Answer [my]255-margaret question . "[255-margaret]

" [You]3414-i have not been [yourself]3414-i all day , "[355-henry] said [Henry]355-henry , and rose from [his]355-henry seat with face unmoved . [Margaret]255-margaret rushed at [him]355-henry and seized both [his]355-henry hands . [She]255-margaret was transfigured .

CHAPTER XXXIX

[Charles]512-mrs. wilcox and [Tibby]259-tibby met at [Ducie Street]130-ducie street , where [the latter]3419-the latter was staying . [Their]3420-their interview was short and absurd . [They]3420-their had nothing in common but the English language , and tried by its help to express what neither of [them]3420-their understood . [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox saw in [Helen]254-helen [the family foe]3421-the family foe . [He]355-henry had singled [her]254-helen out as [the most dangerous of [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels]3422-the most dangerous of the schlegels , and , angry as [he]355-henry was , looked forward to telling [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife how right [he]355-henry had been . [His]355-henry mind was made up at once ; [the girl]877-the girl must be got out of the way before [she]254-helen disgraced [them]3420-their farther . If occasion offered [she]254-helen might be married to [a villain]3425-a villain , or , possibly , to [a fool]3951-a fool . But this was a concession to morality , it formed no part of [his]355-henry main scheme . Honest and hearty was [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox s dislike , and the past spread itself out very clearly before [him]355-henry ; hatred is [a skilful compositor]3427-a skilful compositor . As if [they]3420-their were heads in a note - book , [he]355-henry ran through all the incidents of the Schlegels campaign : the attempt to compromise [[his]355-henry brother]754-his brother , [[his]355-henry mother]1325-his mother s legacy , [[his]355-henry father]3994-his father s marriage , the introduction of the furniture , the unpacking of the same . [He]355-henry had not yet heard of the request to sleep at [Howards End]1-howards end ; that was to be [their]3420-their master - stroke and the opportunity for [his]355-henry . But [he]355-henry already felt that [Howards End]1-howards end was the objective , and , though [he]355-henry disliked [the house]3796-the house , was determined to defend [it]3796-the house .

[Tibby]259-tibby , on the other hand , had no opinions . [He]259-tibby stood above the conventions : [[his]259-tibby sister]1391-his sister had a right to do what [she]1391-his sister thought right . It is not difficult to stand above the conventions when [we]3433-we leave [no hostages]3434-no hostages among [them]3435-them ; [men]3835-men can always be more unconventional than [women]743-women , and [a bachelor of independent means]3438-a bachelor of independent means need encounter no difficulties at all . Unlike [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox , [Tibby]259-tibby had money enough ; [[his]259-tibby ancestors]3439-his ancestors had earned it for [him]259-tibby , and if [he]259-tibby shocked [the people]4342-the people in one set of [lodgings]3441-lodgings [he]259-tibby had only to move into another . [His]259-tibby was the leisure without sympathy -- an attitude as fatal as the strenuous ; a little cold culture may be raised on it , but no art . [[His]259-tibby sisters]1556-his sisters had seen [the family]1117-the family danger , and had never forgotten to discount [the gold islets that raised [them]1556-his sisters from [the sea]811-the sea]3444-the gold islets that raised them from the sea . [Tibby]259-tibby gave all the praise to [himself]259-tibby , and so despised the struggling and [the submerged]3446-the submerged .

Hence the absurdity of the interview ; the gulf between [them]3447-them was economic as well as spiritual . But several facts passed ; [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox pressed for [them]3447-them with an impertinence that [the undergraduate]1666-the undergraduate could not withstand . On what date had [Helen]254-helen gone abroad ? To whom ? ( [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox was anxious to fasten the scandal on [Germany]3-germany . ) Then , changing [his]259-tibby tactics , [he]259-tibby said roughly : " [I]259-tibby suppose [you]259-tibby realise that [you]259-tibby are [[your]259-tibby sister s protector]5897-your sister s protector ? "[259-tibby]

" In what sense ? "[3447-them]

" If [a man]569-a man played about with [[my]259-tibby sister]4024-my sister , [I]259-tibby d send a bullet through [him]569-a man , but perhaps [you]259-tibby don t mind . "[259-tibby]

" [I]259-tibby mind very much , "[259-tibby] protested [Tibby]259-tibby .

" Who d [ye]259-tibby suspect , then ? Speak out [man]3959-man . [One]3797-one always suspects [some one]3973-some one . "[259-tibby]

" [No one]633-no one . [I]259-tibby don t think so . "[259-tibby] Involuntarily [he]259-tibby blushed . [He]259-tibby had remembered the scene in [[his]259-tibby Oxford rooms]3449-his oxford rooms .

" [You]259-tibby are hiding something , "[512-mrs. wilcox] said [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox . As interviews go , [he]259-tibby got the best of this one . " In [[my]259-tibby rooms]5906-my rooms [she]5904-her mentioned [some friends]4573-some friends , called [the Basts]397-the basts . "[259-tibby]

[Tibby]259-tibby was silent . And [Tibby]259-tibby found [himself]259-tibby alone .

[CHAPTER XL

Leonard]532-leonard -- [he]259-tibby would figure at length in a newspaper report , but that evening [he]259-tibby did not count for much . The foot of the tree was in shadow , since the moon was still hidden behind [the house]3796-the house . But above , to right , to left , down [the long meadow]3452-the long meadow the moonlight was streaming . [Leonard]532-leonard seemed not [a man]569-a man , but a cause .

Perhaps it was [Helen]254-helen s way of falling in love -- a curious way to [Margaret]255-margaret , whose agony and whose contempt of [Henry]355-henry were yet imprinted with [his]532-leonard image . [Helen]254-helen forgot [people]3992-people . [They]3992-people were husks that had enclosed [her]254-helen emotion . [She]254-helen could pity , or sacrifice [herself]254-helen , or have instincts , but had [she]254-helen ever loved in the noblest way , where [man]3959-man and [woman]3834-woman , having lost [themselves]3457-themselves in sex , desire to lose sex itself in comradeship ?

[Margaret]255-margaret wondered , but said no word of blame . This was [Helen]254-helen s evening . Troubles enough lay ahead of [her]254-helen -- the loss of [friends]3831-friends and of social advantages , the agony , the supreme agony , of motherhood , which is not even yet a matter of common knowledge . For the present let the moon shine brightly and the breezes of the spring blow gently , dying away from the gale of the day , and let [the earth]1372-the earth , that brings increase , bring peace . Not even to [herself]254-helen dare [she]254-helen blame [Helen]254-helen .

[She]254-helen could not assess [her]254-helen trespass by any moral code ; it was everything or nothing . Morality can tell [us]3460-us that murder is worse than stealing , and group most sins in an order all must approve , but it can not group [Helen]254-helen . The surer [its]3461-its pronouncements on this point , the surer may [we]3460-us be that morality is not speaking . [Christ]533-christ was evasive when [they]3462-they questioned [Him]533-christ . It is those that can not connect who hasten to cast the first stone .

This was [Helen]254-helen s evening -- won at what cost , and not to be marred by the sorrows of [others]802-others . Of [her]254-helen own tragedy [Margaret]255-margaret never uttered a word .

" [One isolates]5919-one isolates , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen slowly . " [I]254-helen isolated [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles from the other forces that were pulling [Leonard]532-leonard downhill . [I]254-helen am less enthusiastic about justice now . But [we]5924-we both thought [you]254-helen wrote at [his]258-charles dictation . It seemed the last touch of [his]258-charles callousness . Being very much wrought up by this time -- and [Mrs. Bast]389-mrs. bast was [upstairs]575-upstairs . [He]532-leonard said [no one]633-no one must know ; it was something to do with [[his]532-leonard wife]1358-his wife . Right up to the end [we]5924-we were [Mr. Bast]313-mr. bast and [Miss Schlegel]254-helen . "[254-helen]

[She]3464-i laid [her]3464-i face against the tree .

" [The little]5929-the little , too , that is known about growth ! Both times it was loneliness , and the night , and panic afterwards . Did [Leonard]532-leonard grow out of [Paul]256-paul ? "[254-helen]

[Margaret]255-margaret did not speak for a moment . " [I]3464-i was afraid that [you]255-margaret would react against [Paul]256-paul until [you]255-margaret went over the verge . "[3464-i]

" Why , indeed ? "[3464-i]

[Miss Avery]456-miss avery crossed [the lawn]3816-the lawn and merged into the hedge that divided [it]3816-the lawn from [the farm]3825-the farm . " This is not quite [[our]5938-we house]4094-our house yet , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen . " When [Miss Avery]456-miss avery called , [I]254-helen felt [we]5938-we are only [a couple of tourists]5940-a couple of tourists . "[254-helen]

" [We]5938-we shall be that everywhere , and for ever . "[255-margaret]

" But [affectionate tourists]5941-affectionate tourists . "[254-helen]

" [But tourists who pretend [each hotel]5943-each hotel is [[their]5942-but tourists who pretend each hotel is their home home]1473-their home]5942-but tourists who pretend each hotel is their home . "[255-margaret]

" [I]254-helen can t pretend very long , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen . " Sitting under this tree one forgets , but [I]254-helen know that to - morrow [I]254-helen shall see the moon rise out of [Germany]3-germany . Not all [your]255-margaret goodness can alter the facts of the case . Unless [you]255-margaret will come with [me]254-helen . "[254-helen]

[Margaret]255-margaret thought for a moment . In the past year [she]255-margaret had grown so fond of [England]34-england that to leave it was a real grief . Yet what detained [her]255-margaret ? No doubt [Henry]355-henry would pardon [her]255-margaret outburst , and go on blustering and muddling into a ripe old age . But what was the good ? [She]255-margaret had just as soon vanish from [his]355-henry mind .

" Are [you]254-helen serious in asking [me]255-margaret , [Helen]254-helen ? Should [I]255-margaret get on with [your]254-helen [Monica]527-monica ? "[255-margaret]

" [You]254-helen would not , but [I]255-margaret am serious in asking [you]254-helen . "[255-margaret]

" Still , no more plans now . And no more reminiscences . "[255-margaret]

[They]3468-they were silent for a little . It was [Helen]254-helen s evening .

The present flowed by [them]3468-they like a stream . The tree rustled . It had made music before [they]3468-they were born , and would continue after [their]3468-they deaths , but its song was of the moment . The moment had passed . The tree rustled again . [Their]3468-they senses were sharpened , and [they]3468-they seemed to apprehend life . Life passed . The tree rustled again .

" Sleep now , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret .

The peace of [the country]4215-the country was entering into [her]255-margaret . [It]3470-it has no commerce with memory , and little with hope . Least of all is it concerned with the hopes of the next five minutes . It is the peace of the present , which passes understanding . Its murmur came " now , "[255-margaret] and " now "[255-margaret] once more as [they]3468-they trod the gravel , and " now , "[255-margaret] as the moonlight fell upon [[their]3468-they father]788-their father s sword . [They]3468-they passed [upstairs]575-upstairs , kissed , and amidst the endless iterations fell asleep . [The house]3796-the house had enshadowed the tree at first , but as the moon rose higher the two disentangled , and were clear for a few moments at midnight . [Margaret]255-margaret awoke and looked into [the garden]3800-the garden . How incomprehensible that [Leonard Bast]311-leonard should have won [her]255-margaret this night of peace ! Was [he]311-leonard also part of [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox s mind ?

CHAPTER XLI

Far different was [Leonard]311-leonard s development . The months after [Oniton]255-margaret , whatever minor troubles [they]3468-they might bring [him]311-leonard , were all overshadowed by Remorse . When [Helen]254-helen looked back [she]254-helen could philosophise , or [she]254-helen could look into the future and plan for [[her]254-helen child]3475-her child . But [the father]3855-the father saw nothing beyond [his]3855-the father own sin . Weeks afterwards , in the midst of other occupations , [he]3855-the father would suddenly cry out , " [Brute]534-brute -- [you]534-brute brute , [I]3855-the father couldn t have-- "[3855-the father] and be rent into [two people who held dialogues . Or brown rain]3477-two people who held dialogues . or brown rain would descend , blotting out faces and the sky . Even [Jacky]318-jacky noticed the change in [him]311-leonard . Most terrible were [his]311-leonard sufferings when [he]311-leonard awoke from sleep . Sometimes [he]311-leonard was happy at first , but grew conscious of a burden hanging to [him]311-leonard and weighing down [his]311-leonard thoughts when they would move . Or little irons scorched [his]311-leonard body . Or a sword stabbed [him]311-leonard . [He]311-leonard would sit at the edge of [his]311-leonard bed , holding [his]311-leonard heart and moaning , " Oh what SHALL [I]311-leonard do , whatever SHALL [I]311-leonard do ? "[311-leonard] Nothing brought ease . [He]311-leonard could put distance between [him]311-leonard and the trespass , but it grew in [his]311-leonard soul .

Remorse is not among the eternal verities . [The Greeks]373-the greeks were right to dethrone [her]3478-her . [Her]3478-her action is too capricious , as though [the Erinyes]535-the erinyes selected for punishment only [certain men]3479-certain men and certain sins . And of all means to regeneration Remorse is surely the most wasteful . It cuts away healthy tissues with the poisoned . It is a knife that probes far deeper than the evil . [Leonard]311-leonard was driven straight through its torments and emerged pure , but enfeebled -- [a better man]2851-a better man , who would never lose control of [himself]2851-a better man again , but also [a smaller man , who had less to control]3481-a smaller man , who had less to control . Nor did purity mean peace . The use of the knife can become a habit as hard to shake off as passion itself , and [Leonard]311-leonard continued to start with a cry out of dreams .

[He]311-leonard built up a situation that was far enough from the truth . It never occurred to [him]311-leonard that [Helen]254-helen was to blame . [He]311-leonard forgot the intensity of [their]3482-their talk , the charm that had been lent [him]311-leonard by sincerity , the magic of Oniton under darkness and of [the whispering river]3483-the whispering river . [Helen]254-helen loved the absolute . [Leonard]311-leonard had been ruined absolutely , and had appeared to [her]254-helen as [a man]569-a man apart , isolated from [the world]745-the world . [A real man]4817-a real man , who cared for adventure and beauty , who desired to live decently and pay [his]311-leonard way , who could have travelled more gloriously through life than the juggernaut car that was crushing [him]311-leonard . Memories of [Evie]262-evie s wedding had warped [her]254-helen , [the starched servants]3487-the starched servants , the yards of uneaten food , the rustle of overdressed women , [motor - cars]642-motor - cars oozing grease on the gravel , a pretentious band . [She]254-helen had tasted the lees of this on [her]254-helen arrival ; in the darkness , after failure , they intoxicated [her]254-helen . [She]254-helen and [the victim]3489-the victim seemed alone in a world of unreality , and [she]254-helen loved [him]311-leonard absolutely , perhaps for half an hour .

In the morning [she]254-helen was gone . The note that [she]254-helen left , tender and hysterical in tone , and intended to be most kind , hurt [[her]254-helen lover]1789-her lover terribly . It was as if some work of art had been broken by [him]311-leonard , some picture in the National Gallery slashed out of its frame . When [he]311-leonard recalled [her]254-helen talents and [her]254-helen social position , [he]311-leonard felt that [the first passer - by]3491-the first passer - by had a right to shoot [him]311-leonard down . [He]311-leonard was afraid of [the waitress]2819-the waitress and [the porters at [the railway - station]3494-the railway - station]3493-the porters at the railway - station . [He]311-leonard was afraid at first of [[his]311-leonard wife]1358-his wife , though later [he]311-leonard was to regard [her]254-helen with a strange new tenderness , and to think , " There is nothing to choose between [us]3496-us , after all . "[311-leonard]

The expedition to [Shropshire]132-shropshire crippled [the Basts]397-the basts permanently . [Helen]254-helen in [her]254-helen flight forgot to settle the hotel bill , and took [their]3496-us return tickets away with [her]254-helen ; [they]3496-us had to pawn [Jacky]318-jacky s bangles to get [home]894-home , and the smash came a few days afterwards . It is true that [Helen]254-helen offered [him]311-leonard five thousand pounds , but such a sum meant nothing to [him]311-leonard . [He]311-leonard could not see that [the girl]877-the girl was desperately righting [herself]877-the girl , and trying to save something out of the disaster , if it was only five thousand pounds . But [he]311-leonard had to live somehow . [He]311-leonard turned to [[his]311-leonard family]804-his family , and degraded [himself]311-leonard to [a professional beggar]3500-a professional beggar . There was nothing else for [him]311-leonard to do .

" A letter from [Leonard]311-leonard , "[536-blanche] thought [Blanche]536-blanche , [[his]311-leonard sister]1391-his sister ; " and after all this time . "[536-blanche] [She]536-blanche hid it , so that [[her]536-blanche husband]1134-her husband should not see , and when [he]1134-her husband had gone to [his]1134-her husband work read it with some emotion , and sent [the prodigal]3503-the prodigal a little money out of [her]536-blanche dress allowance .

" A letter from [Leonard]311-leonard ! "[3504-the other sister] said [the other sister]3504-the other sister , [Laura]537-laura , a few days later . [She]537-laura showed it to [[her]537-laura husband]1134-her husband . [He]1134-her husband wrote a cruel , insolent reply , but sent more money than [Blanche]536-blanche , so [Leonard]311-leonard soon wrote to [him]1134-her husband again .

And during the winter the system was developed .

[Leonard]311-leonard realised that [they]3506-they need never starve , because it would be too painful for [[his]311-leonard relatives]3507-his relatives . Society is based on [the family]1117-the family , and [the clever wastrel]3509-the clever wastrel can exploit this indefinitely . Without a generous thought on either side , pounds and pounds passed . [The donors]3510-the donors disliked [Leonard]311-leonard , and [he]311-leonard grew to hate [them]3510-the donors intensely . When [Laura]537-laura censured [his]311-leonard immoral marriage , [he]311-leonard thought bitterly , " [She]537-laura minds that ! What would [she]537-laura say if [she]537-laura knew the truth ? "[311-leonard] When [[Blanche]536-blanche s husband]3511-blanche s husband offered [him]311-leonard work , [he]311-leonard found some pretext for avoiding it . [He]311-leonard had wanted work keenly at [Oniton]255-margaret , but too much anxiety had shattered [him]311-leonard , [he]311-leonard was joining the unemployable . When [[his]311-leonard brother]754-his brother , [the lay - reader]1038-the lay - reader , did not reply to a letter , [he]754-his brother wrote again , saying that [he]754-his brother and [Jacky]318-jacky would come down to [[his]754-his brother village]3514-his village on foot . [He]754-his brother did not intend this as blackmail . Still [the brother]1075-the brother sent a postal order , and it became part of the system . And so passed [his]311-leonard winter and [his]311-leonard spring .

In the horror there are two bright spots . [He]311-leonard never confused the past . [He]311-leonard remained alive , and blessed are [those who live , if it is only to a sense of sinfulness]3516-those who live , if it is only to a sense of sinfulness . The anodyne of muddledom , by which [most men]1940-most men blur and blend [their]1940-most men mistakes , never passed [Leonard]311-leonard s lips--

" And if [I]3518-a hard man drink oblivion of a day , So shorten [I]3518-a hard man the stature of [my]3518-a hard man soul . "[3518-a hard man]

It is a hard saying , and [a hard man]3518-a hard man wrote it , but it lies at the root of all character .

And the other bright spot was [his]311-leonard tenderness for [Jacky]318-jacky . [He]311-leonard pitied [her]3519-her with nobility now -- not the contemptuous pity of [a man who sticks to [a woman]1045-a woman through thick and thin]3520-a man who sticks to a woman through thick and thin . [He]311-leonard tried to be less irritable . [He]311-leonard wondered what [her]3519-her hungry eyes desired -- nothing that [she]3519-her could express , or that [he]311-leonard or [any man]4052-any man could give [her]3519-her . Would [she]3519-her ever receive the justice that is mercy -- the justice for by - products that [the world]745-the world is too busy to bestow ? [She]3519-her was fond of flowers , generous with money , and not revengeful . If [she]3519-her had borne [him]311-leonard [a child]5752-a child [he]311-leonard might have cared for [her]3519-her . [Unmarried]3525-unmarried , [Leonard]311-leonard would never have begged ; [he]311-leonard would have flickered out and died . But the whole of life is mixed . [He]311-leonard had to provide for [Jacky]318-jacky , and went down [dirty paths]3526-dirty paths that [she]3519-her might have a few feathers and the dishes of food that suited [her]3519-her .

One day [he]311-leonard caught sight of [Margaret]255-margaret and [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother . [He]311-leonard was in [St. Paul]139-st. paul s s. [He]311-leonard had entered [the cathedral]3866-the cathedral partly to avoid the rain and partly to see a picture that had educated [him]311-leonard in former years . But the light was bad , the picture ill placed , and Time and judgment were inside [him]311-leonard now . Death alone still charmed [him]311-leonard , with [her]3519-her lap of poppies , on which [all men]4106-all men shall sleep . [He]311-leonard took one glance , and turned aimlessly away towards a chair . Then down [the nave]3530-the nave [he]311-leonard saw [Miss Schlegel]254-helen and [[her]255-margaret brother]576-her brother . [They]3532-they stood in the fairway of [passengers]3533-passengers , and [their]3532-they faces were extremely grave . [He]311-leonard was perfectly certain that [they]3532-they were in trouble about [[their]3532-they sister]5267-their sister .

Once outside -- and [he]311-leonard fled immediately -- [he]311-leonard wished that [he]311-leonard had spoken to [them]3532-they . What was [his]311-leonard life ? What were a few angry words , or even imprisonment ? [He]311-leonard had done wrong -- that was the true terror . Whatever [they]3532-they might know , [he]311-leonard would tell [them]3532-they everything [he]311-leonard knew . [He]311-leonard re - entered [St. Paul s.]139-st. paul s But [they]3532-they had moved in [his]311-leonard absence , and had gone to lay [their]3532-they difficulties before [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles and [Charles]258-charles .

The sight of [Margaret]255-margaret turned remorse into new channels . [He]311-leonard desired to confess , and though the desire is proof of a weakened nature , which is about to lose the essence of human intercourse , it did not take an ignoble form . [He]311-leonard did not suppose that confession would bring [him]311-leonard happiness . It was rather that [he]311-leonard yearned to get clear of the tangle . So does the suicide yearn . The impulses are akin , and the crime of suicide lies rather in its disregard for the feelings of those whom [we]3535-we leave behind . Confession need harm [no one]633-no one -- it can satisfy that test -- and though it was un - English , and ignored by [[our]3535-we Anglican cathedral]3537-our anglican cathedral , [Leonard]311-leonard had a right to decide upon it .

Moreover , [he]311-leonard trusted [Margaret]255-margaret . [He]311-leonard wanted [her]255-margaret hardness now . That cold , intellectual nature of [hers]255-margaret would be just , if unkind . [He]311-leonard would do whatever [she]255-margaret told [him]311-leonard , even if [he]311-leonard had to see [Helen]254-helen . That was the supreme punishment [she]255-margaret would exact . And perhaps [she]255-margaret would tell [him]311-leonard how [Helen]254-helen was . That was the supreme reward .

[He]311-leonard knew nothing about [Margaret]255-margaret , not even whether [she]255-margaret was married to [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles , and tracking [her]255-margaret out took several days . That evening [he]311-leonard toiled through the wet to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , where [the new flats]3538-the new flats were now appearing . Was [he]311-leonard also the cause of [their]3539-their move ? Were [they]3539-their expelled from [society]1518-society on [his]311-leonard account ? Thence to [a public library]3541-a public library , but could find no satisfactory [Schlegel]254-helen in the directory . On the morrow [he]311-leonard searched again . [He]311-leonard hung about outside [[Mr. Wilcox]258-charles s office]3542-mr. wilcox s office at lunch time , and , as [the clerks]3543-the clerks came out said , " Excuse [me]3543-the clerks , [sir]3939-sir , but is [[your]311-leonard boss]5946-your boss married ? "[3543-the clerks] [Most of [them]3543-the clerks]1254-most of them stared , [some]1079-some said , " What s that to [you]311-leonard ? "[1079-some] but [one , who had not yet acquired reticence]3546-one , who had not yet acquired reticence , told [him]311-leonard what [he]311-leonard wished . [Leonard]311-leonard could not learn the private address . That necessitated more trouble with [directories]3547-directories and tubes . [Ducie Street]130-ducie street was not discovered till the Monday , the day that [Margaret]255-margaret and [[her]255-margaret husband]1134-her husband went down on [their]3549-their hunting expedition to [Howards End]1-howards end .

[He]311-leonard called at about four o clock . The weather had changed , and the sun shone gaily on [the ornamental steps]3550-the ornamental steps -- black and white marble in triangles . [Leonard]311-leonard lowered [his]311-leonard eyes to them after ringing the bell . [He]311-leonard felt in curious health ; doors seemed to be opening and shutting inside [his]311-leonard body , and [he]311-leonard had been obliged to sleep sitting up in bed , with [his]311-leonard back propped against the wall . When [the parlourmaid]3551-the parlourmaid came [he]311-leonard could not see [her]255-margaret face ; the brown rain had descended suddenly .

" Does [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox live [here]3846-here ? "[311-leonard] [he]311-leonard asked .

" [She]512-mrs. wilcox s out , "[3551-the parlourmaid] was the answer .

" When will [she]512-mrs. wilcox be back ? "[255-margaret]

" [I]3551-the parlourmaid ll ask , "[3551-the parlourmaid] said [the parlourmaid]3551-the parlourmaid .

[Margaret]255-margaret had given instructions that [no one who mentioned [her]255-margaret name]3553-no one who mentioned her name should ever be rebuffed . Putting the door on the chain -- for [Leonard]311-leonard s appearance demanded this -- [she]255-margaret went through to [the smoking - room]5077-the smoking - room , which was occupied by [Tibby]259-tibby . [Tibby]259-tibby was asleep . [He]259-tibby had had a good lunch . [Charles Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had not yet rung [him]259-tibby up for the distracting interview . " [They]5949-they have taken [the car]1432-the car to [Howards End]1-howards end , "[311-leonard] said the parlourmaid to [Leonard]311-leonard .

[He]311-leonard thanked [her]255-margaret , and asked whereabouts [that place]3555-that place was .

" [You]311-leonard appear to want to know a good deal , "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret remarked . But [Margaret]255-margaret had forbidden [her]255-margaret to be mysterious . [She]255-margaret told [him]311-leonard against [her]255-margaret better judgment that [Howards End]1-howards end was in [Hertfordshire]73-hertfordshire .

" Is it [a village]5951-a village , please ? "[255-margaret]

" [Village]247-village ! [It]247-village s [[Mr. Wilcox]258-charles s private house]5952-mr. wilcox s private house -- at least , it s [one of them]2576-one of them . [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox keeps [her]512-mrs. wilcox furniture [there]884-there . [Hilton]32-hilton is [the village]3925-the village . "[255-margaret]

" Yes . And when will [they]3556-their be back ? "[255-margaret]

" [Mr. Schlegel]271-mr. schlegel doesn t know . [We]3556-their can t know everything , can [we]3556-their ? "[255-margaret] [She]255-margaret shut [him]311-leonard out , and went to attend to the telephone , which was ringing furiously .

[He]311-leonard loitered away another night of agony . Confession grew more difficult . As soon as possible [he]311-leonard went to bed . [He]311-leonard watched a patch of moonlight cross the floor of [[their]3556-their lodging]3557-their lodging , and , as sometimes happens when the mind is overtaxed , [he]311-leonard fell asleep for the rest of [the room]1100-the room , but kept awake for the patch of moonlight . Horrible ! Then began one of those disintegrating dialogues . [Part of [him]311-leonard]3559-part of him said : " Why horrible ? It s ordinary light from the moon . "[3559-part of him] " But it moves . "[3559-part of him] " So does the moon . "[3559-part of him] " But it is a clenched fist . "[3559-part of him] " Why not ? "[3559-part of him] " But it is going to touch [me]3559-part of him . "[3559-part of him] " Let it . "[3559-part of him] And , seeming to gather motion , the patch ran up [his]311-leonard blanket . Presently a blue snake appeared ; then another parallel to it . " Is there life in the moon ? "[3559-part of him] " Of course . "[3559-part of him] " But [I]3559-part of him thought it was uninhabited . "[3559-part of him] " Not by Time , Death , Judgment , and the smaller snakes . "[3559-part of him] " Smaller snakes ! "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard indignantly and aloud . " What a notion ! "[311-leonard] By a rending effort of the will [he]311-leonard woke the rest of [the room]1100-the room up . [Jacky]318-jacky , the bed , [their]3556-their food , [their]3556-their clothes on the chair , gradually entered [his]311-leonard consciousness , and the horror vanished outwards , like a ring that is spreading through water .

" [I]311-leonard say , [Jacky]318-jacky , [I]311-leonard m going out for a bit . "[311-leonard]

[She]3561-her was breathing regularly . The patch of light fell clear of the striped blanket , and began to cover the shawl that lay over [her]3561-her feet . Why had [he]311-leonard been afraid ? [He]311-leonard went to the window , and saw that the moon was descending through a clear sky . [He]311-leonard saw [her]3561-her volcanoes , and the bright expanses that [a gracious error]3562-a gracious error has named [seas]3563-seas . [They]3563-seas paled , for the sun , who had lit [them]3563-seas up , was coming to light [the earth]1372-the earth . [Sea of Serenity]248-sea of serenity , [Sea of Tranquillity]3565-sea of tranquillity , Ocean of the Lunar Storms , merged into one lucent drop , itself to slip into the sempiternal dawn . And [he]311-leonard had been afraid of the moon !

[He]311-leonard dressed among the contending lights , and went through [his]311-leonard money . It was running low again , but enough for a return ticket to [Hilton]32-hilton . As it clinked , [Jacky]318-jacky opened [her]3561-her eyes .

" Hullo , [Len]311-leonard ! What ho , [Len]311-leonard ! "[3561-her]

" What ho , [Jacky]318-jacky ! see [you]318-jacky again later . "[3561-her]

[She]3561-her turned over and slept .

[The house]3796-the house was unlocked , [[their]3563-seas landlord]3567-their landlord being [a salesman at [Covent Garden]53-covent garden]3568-a salesman at covent garden . [Leonard]311-leonard passed out and made [his]311-leonard way down to [the station]582-the station . [The train]3864-the train , though it did not start for an hour , was already drawn up at the end of [the platform]3571-the platform , and [he]311-leonard lay down in [it]3864-the train and slept . With the first jolt [he]311-leonard was in daylight ; [they]3563-seas had left [the gateways of [King s Cross]15-king s cross]3572-the gateways of king s cross , and were under blue sky . [Tunnels]3573-tunnels followed , and after each the sky grew bluer , and from the embankment at [Finsbury Park]3574-finsbury park [he]311-leonard had [his]311-leonard first sight of the sun . [It]3575-it rolled along behind the eastern smokes -- a wheel , whose fellow was the descending moon -- and as yet it seemed [the servant of the blue sky]3576-the servant of the blue sky , not [its lord]3577-its lord . [He]311-leonard dozed again . Over [Tewin Water]31-tewin water it was day . To the left fell the shadow of [the embankment]1745-the embankment and [its]1745-the embankment arches ; to the right [Leonard]311-leonard saw up into [the Tewin Woods]249-the tewin woods and towards [the church]1321-the church , with [its]1321-the church wild legend of immortality . Six forest trees -- that is a fact -- grow out of one of [the graves in [Tewin churchyard]3581-tewin churchyard]3580-the graves in tewin churchyard . [The grave s occupant]3582-the grave s occupant -- that is the legend -- is [an atheist]3583-an atheist , who declared that if [God]274-god existed , six forest trees would grow out of [her]3583-an atheist grave . These things in [Hertfordshire]73-hertfordshire ; and farther afield lay [the house of [a hermit]3585-a hermit]3584-the house of a hermit -- [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox had known [him]3585-a hermit -- who barred [himself]3585-a hermit up , and wrote prophecies , and gave all [he]3585-a hermit had to [the poor]906-the poor . While , powdered in between , were the villas of [business men , who saw life more steadily , though with the steadiness of the half - closed eye]3587-business men , who saw life more steadily , though with the steadiness of the half - closed eye . Over all the sun was streaming , to all the birds were singing , to all the primroses were yellow , and the speedwell blue , and [the country]4215-the country , however [they]3589-they interpreted [her]3583-an atheist , was uttering [her]3583-an atheist cry of " now . "[3583-an atheist] [She]3583-an atheist did not free [Leonard]311-leonard yet , and the knife plunged deeper into [his]311-leonard heart as [the train]3864-the train drew up at [Hilton]32-hilton . But remorse had become beautiful .

[Hilton]32-hilton was asleep , or at the earliest , breakfasting . [Leonard]311-leonard noticed the contrast when [he]311-leonard stepped out of it into [the country]4215-the country . Here [men]3835-men had been up since dawn . [Their]3835-men hours were ruled , not by [a [London]2-london office]3593-a london office , but by the movements of the crops and the sun . That [they]3835-men were [men of the finest type only the sentimentalists]3594-men of the finest type only the sentimentalists can declare . But [they]3835-men kept to the life of daylight . [They]3835-men are [England]34-england s hope . Clumsily [they]3835-men carry forward the torch of the sun , until such time as [the nation]3595-the nation sees fit to take it up . [Half clodhopper]3596-half clodhopper , [half board - school prig]3597-half board - school prig , [they]3835-men can still throw back to a nobler stock , and breed [yeomen]3598-yeomen .

At the chalk pit a motor passed [him]311-leonard . In it was another type , whom [Nature]374-nature favours -- [the Imperial]3599-the imperial . Healthy , ever in motion , it hopes to inherit [the earth]1372-the earth . [It]3599-the imperial breeds as quickly as [the yeoman , and as soundly]3601-the yeoman , and as soundly ; strong is the temptation to acclaim [it]3599-the imperial as a super - yeoman , who carries [his]311-leonard country s virtue overseas . But [the Imperialist]3602-the imperialist is not what [he]3602-the imperialist thinks or seems . [He]3602-the imperialist is [a destroyer]3603-a destroyer . [He]3602-the imperialist prepares the way for cosmopolitanism , and though [his]3602-the imperialist ambitions may be fulfilled , [the earth]1372-the earth that [he]3602-the imperialist inherits will be grey .

To [Leonard]311-leonard , intent on [his]311-leonard private sin , there came the conviction of innate goodness elsewhere . It was not the optimism which [he]311-leonard had been taught at [school]3605-school . Again and again must the drums tap , and the goblins stalk over [the universe]868-the universe before joy can be purged of the superficial . It was rather paradoxical , and arose from [his]311-leonard sorrow . [Death]495-death destroys [a man]569-a man , but the idea of death saves [him]569-a man -- that is the best account of it that has yet been given . [Squalor]539-squalor and tragedy can beckon to all that is great in [us]3608-us , and strengthen the wings of love . [They]3609-they can beckon ; it is not certain that [they]3609-they will , for [they]3609-they are not love [s servants]3610-s servants . But [they]3609-they can beckon , and the knowledge of this incredible truth comforted [him]311-leonard .

As [he]311-leonard approached [the house]3796-the house all thought stopped . Contradictory notions stood side by side in [his]311-leonard mind . [He]311-leonard was terrified but happy , ashamed , but had done no sin . [He]311-leonard knew the confession : " [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , [I]311-leonard have done wrong , "[311-leonard] but sunrise had robbed its meaning , and [he]311-leonard felt rather on a supreme adventure .

[He]311-leonard entered [a garden]2297-a garden , steadied [himself]311-leonard against [a motor - car]1200-a motor - car that [he]311-leonard found in [it]2297-a garden , found a door open and entered [a house]3903-a house . Yes , it would be very easy . From [a room to the left]3615-a room to the left [he]311-leonard heard voices , [Margaret]255-margaret s amongst [them]3616-them . [His]311-leonard own name was called aloud , and [a man whom [he]311-leonard had never seen]3617-a man whom he had never seen said , " Oh , is [he]311-leonard there ? [I]3617-a man whom he had never seen am not surprised . [I]3617-a man whom he had never seen now thrash [him]311-leonard within an inch of [his]311-leonard life . "[3617-a man whom he had never seen]

" [Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox , "[311-leonard] said [Leonard]311-leonard , " [I]311-leonard have done wrong . "[311-leonard]

[The man]717-the man took [him]311-leonard by the collar and cried , " Bring [me]717-the man a stick . "[717-the man] [Women]743-women were screaming . A stick , very bright , descended . It hurt [him]311-leonard , not where it descended , but in the heart . Books fell over [him]311-leonard in a shower . Nothing had sense .

" Get some water , "[512-mrs. wilcox] commanded [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox , who had all through kept very calm . " [He]311-leonard s shamming . Of course [I]512-mrs. wilcox only used the blade . Here , carry [him]311-leonard out into the air . "[512-mrs. wilcox]

Thinking that [he]311-leonard understood these things , [Margaret]255-margaret obeyed [him]311-leonard . [They]3620-they laid [Leonard]311-leonard , who was dead , on the gravel ; [Helen]254-helen poured water over [him]311-leonard .

" That s enough , "[512-mrs. wilcox] said [Charles]512-mrs. wilcox .

" Yes , murder s enough , "[456-miss avery] said [Miss Avery]456-miss avery , coming out of [the house]3796-the house with the sword .

It was the talent in the napkin , and , for [a warm - hearted man]3656-a warm - hearted man , [Charles]258-charles had conveyed very little joy . How had [she]255-margaret done it ? By some dishonest trick , no doubt -- but how ?

[Mr. Wilcox]258-charles reappeared at eleven , looking very tired . There was to be an inquest on [Leonard]311-leonard s body to - morrow , and [the police]4562-the police required [[his]3994-his father son]1379-his son to attend .

CHAPTER XLIII

Out of the turmoil and horror that had begun with [Aunt Juley]263-aunt juley s illness and was not even to end with [Leonard]311-leonard s death , it seemed impossible to [Margaret]255-margaret that healthy life should re - emerge . Events succeeded in a logical , yet senseless , train . [People]3992-people lost [their]3992-people humanity , and took values as arbitrary as those in a pack of playing - cards . It was natural that [Henry]355-henry should do this and cause [Helen]254-helen to do that , and then think [her]254-helen wrong for doing it ; natural that [she]254-helen [herself]254-helen should think [him]355-henry wrong ; natural that [Leonard]311-leonard should want to know how [Helen]254-helen was , and come , and [Charles]258-charles be angry with [him]311-leonard for coming -- natural , but unreal . In this jangle of causes and effects what had become of [their]3663-their true selves ? Here [Leonard]311-leonard lay dead in [the garden]3800-the garden , from natural causes ; yet life was [a deep , deep river]3665-a deep , deep river , death a blue sky , life was [a house]3903-a house , death a wisp of hay , a flower , [a tower]3667-a tower , life and death were anything and everything , except this ordered insanity , where [the king]3668-the king takes [the queen]1040-the queen , and [the ace]3670-the ace [the king]3668-the king . Ah , no ; there was beauty and adventure behind , such as [the man at [her]254-helen feet had yearned for]3672-the man at her feet had yearned for ; there was hope this side of the grave ; there were truer relationships beyond the limits that fetter [us]3673-us now . As [a prisoner]3674-a prisoner looks up and sees stars beckoning , so [she]3674-a prisoner , from the turmoil and horror of those days , caught glimpses of the diviner wheels .

And [Helen]254-helen , dumb with fright , but trying to keep calm for [the child]2175-the child s sake , and [Miss Avery]456-miss avery , calm , but murmuring tenderly , " [No one]633-no one ever told [the lad]6008-the lad [he]6008-the lad ll have [a child"--they]6009-a child"--they[456-miss avery] also reminded [her]254-helen that horror is not the end . To what ultimate harmony [we]3673-us tend [she]254-helen did not know , but there seemed great chance that [a child]5752-a child would be born into [the world]745-the world , to take the great chances of beauty and adventure that [the world]745-the world offers . [She]254-helen moved through [the sunlit garden]3679-the sunlit garden , gathering narcissi , crimson - eyed and white . There was nothing else to be done ; the time for telegrams and anger was over and it seemed wisest that the hands of [Leonard]311-leonard should be folded on [his]311-leonard breast and be filled with flowers . Here was [the father]3855-the father ; leave it at that . Let [Squalor]539-squalor be turned into [Tragedy , whose eyes are the stars , and whose hands hold the sunset and the dawn]3681-tragedy , whose eyes are the stars , and whose hands hold the sunset and the dawn .

And even the influx of [officials]3682-officials , even the return of [the doctor , vulgar and acute]3683-the doctor , vulgar and acute , could not shake [her]254-helen belief in the eternity of beauty . Science explained [people]3992-people , but could not understand [them]3992-people . After long centuries among the bones and muscles it might be advancing to knowledge of the nerves , but this would never give understanding . [One]3797-one could open the heart to [Mr. Mansbridge]526-mr. mansbridge and [[his]526-mr. mansbridge sort]3686-his sort without discovering its secrets to [them]3687-they , for [they]3687-they wanted everything down in black and white , and black and white was exactly what [they]3687-they were left with .

[They]3687-they questioned [her]254-helen closely about [Charles]258-charles . [She]254-helen never suspected why . [Death]495-death had come , and [the doctor]577-the doctor agreed that it was due to heart disease . [They]3687-they asked to see [[her]254-helen father]822-her father s sword . [She]254-helen explained that [Charles]258-charles s anger was natural , but mistaken . Miserable questions about [Leonard]311-leonard followed , all of which [she]254-helen answered unfalteringly . Then back to [Charles]258-charles again . " No doubt [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles may have induced death , "[254-helen] [she]254-helen said ; " but if it wasn t one thing it would have been another as [you]6010-you know . "[254-helen] At last [they]3687-they thanked [her]254-helen and took the sword and the body down to [Hilton]32-hilton . [She]254-helen began to pick up the books from the floor .

[Helen]254-helen had gone to [the farm]3825-the farm . It was [the best place for [her]254-helen]3691-the best place for her , since [she]254-helen had to wait for the inquest . Though , as if things were not hard enough , [Madge]255-margaret and [[her]255-margaret husband]1134-her husband had raised trouble ; [they]3687-they did not see why [they]3687-they should receive the offscourings of [Howards End]1-howards end . And , of course , [they]3687-they were right . [The whole world]4140-the whole world was going to be right , and amply avenge any brave talk against the conventions . " Nothing matters , "[267-the schlegels] [the Schlegels]267-the schlegels had said in the past , " except one s self - respect and that of [one s friends]6011-one s friends . "[267-the schlegels] When the time came , other things mattered terribly . However , [Madge]255-margaret had yielded , and [Helen]254-helen was assured of peace for one day and night , and to - morrow [she]254-helen would return to [Germany]3-germany .

As for [herself]254-helen , [she]254-helen determined to go too . No message came from [Henry]355-henry ; perhaps [he]355-henry expected [her]254-helen to apologise . Now that [she]254-helen had time to think over [her]254-helen own tragedy , [she]254-helen was unrepentant . [She]254-helen neither forgave [him]355-henry for [his]355-henry behaviour nor wished to forgive [him]355-henry . [Her]254-helen speech to [him]355-henry seemed perfect . [She]254-helen would not have altered a word . It had to be uttered once in a life , to adjust the lopsidedness of [the world]745-the world . It was spoken not only to [[her]254-helen husband]1134-her husband , but to [thousands of men like [him]355-henry]3696-thousands of men like him -- a protest against the inner darkness in high places that comes with a commercial age . Though [he]355-henry would build up [his]355-henry life without [hers]254-helen , [she]254-helen could not apologise . [He]355-henry had refused to connect , on the clearest issue that can be laid before [a man]569-a man , and [their]3698-their love must take the consequences .

No , there was nothing more to be done . [They]3698-their had tried not to go over the precipice , but perhaps the fall was inevitable . And it comforted [her]254-helen to think that the future was certainly inevitable ; cause and effect would go jangling forward to some goal doubtless , but to none that [she]254-helen could imagine . At such moments the soul retires within , to float upon the bosom of [a deeper stream]3699-a deeper stream , and has communion with the dead , and sees [the world]745-the world s glory not diminished , but different in kind to what [she]254-helen has supposed . [She]254-helen alters [her]254-helen focus until trivial things are blurred . [Margaret]255-margaret had been tending this way all the winter . [Leonard]311-leonard s death brought [her]254-helen to the goal . Alas ! that [Henry]355-henry should fade away as reality emerged , and only [her]254-helen love for [him]355-henry should remain clear , stamped with [his]355-henry image like the cameos [we]3701-we rescue out of dreams .

With unfaltering eye [she]254-helen traced [his]355-henry future . [He]355-henry would soon present a healthy mind to [the world]745-the world again , and what did [he]355-henry or [the world]745-the world care if [he]355-henry was rotten at the core ? [He]355-henry would grow into [a rich , jolly old man]3704-a rich , jolly old man , at times a little sentimental about [women]743-women , but emptying [his]355-henry glass with [anyone]3706-anyone . Tenacious of power , [he]355-henry would keep [Charles]258-charles and [the rest]1080-the rest dependent , and retire from business reluctantly and at an advanced age . [He]355-henry would settle down -- though [she]254-helen could not realise this . In [her]254-helen eyes [Henry]355-henry was always moving and causing [others]802-others to move , until the ends of [the earth]1372-the earth met . But in time [he]355-henry must get too tired to move , and settle down . What next ? The inevitable word . The release of the soul to [its appropriate Heaven]3710-its appropriate heaven .

Would [they]3711-they meet in it ? [Margaret]255-margaret believed in immortality for [herself]255-margaret . An eternal future had always seemed natural to [her]255-margaret . And [Henry]355-henry believed in it for [himself]355-henry . Yet , would [they]3711-they meet again ? Are there not rather endless levels beyond the grave , as the theory that [he]355-henry had censured teaches ? And [his]355-henry level , whether higher or lower , could it possibly be the same as [hers]254-helen ?

Thus gravely meditating , [she]254-helen was summoned by [him]355-henry . [He]355-henry sent up [Crane]364-crane in the motor . [Other servants]3712-other servants passed like water , but [the chauffeur]1445-the chauffeur remained , though impertinent and disloyal . [Margaret]255-margaret disliked [Crane]364-crane , and [he]355-henry knew it .

" Is it the keys that [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles wants ? "[255-margaret] [she]255-margaret asked .

" [He]355-henry didn t say , [madam]4152-madam . "[355-henry]

" [You]355-henry haven t any note for [me]355-henry ? "[355-henry]

" [He]355-henry didn t say , [madam]4152-madam . "[355-henry]

After a moment s thought [she]254-helen locked up [Howards End]1-howards end . It was pitiable to see in it the stirrings of warmth that would be quenched for ever . [She]254-helen raked out the fire that was blazing in [the kitchen]1026-the kitchen , and spread the coals in [the gravelled yard]3715-the gravelled yard . [She]254-helen closed the windows and drew the curtains . [Henry]355-henry would probably sell [the place]5183-the place now .

[She]254-helen was determined not to spare [him]355-henry , for nothing new had happened as far as [they]3717-they were concerned . [Her]254-helen mood might never have altered from yesterday evening . [He]355-henry was standing a little outside [[Charles]258-charles s gate]3718-charles s gate , and motioned [the car]1432-the car to stop . When [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife got out [he]355-henry said hoarsely : " [I]355-henry prefer to discuss things with [you]254-helen outside . "[355-henry]

" It will be more appropriate in [the road]999-the road , [I]255-margaret am afraid , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret . " Did [you]355-henry get [my]255-margaret message ? "[255-margaret]

" What about ? "[355-henry]

" [I]255-margaret am going to [Germany]3-germany with [[my]255-margaret sister]4024-my sister . " [I]355-henry am extremely tired , "[355-henry] said [Henry]355-henry , in injured tones . " [I]355-henry have been walking about all the morning , and wish to sit down . "[355-henry]

" Certainly , if [you]355-henry will consent to sit on the grass . "[255-margaret]

[The Great North Road]640-the great north road should have been bordered all [its]640-the great north road length with glebe . [Henry]355-henry s kind had filched most of it . [She]3722-she moved to the scrap opposite , wherein were [the Six Hills]203-the six hills . [They]3723-they sat down on the farther side , so that they could not be seen by [Charles]258-charles or [Dolly]3724-dolly .

" Here are [your]355-henry keys , "[255-margaret] said [Margaret]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret tossed them towards [him]355-henry . They fell on [the sunlit slope of grass]3725-the sunlit slope of grass , and [he]355-henry did not pick them up .

" [I]355-henry have something to tell [you]3722-she , "[355-henry] [he]355-henry said gently .

[Margaret]255-margaret drove [her]255-margaret fingers through the grass . [The hill beneath [her]255-margaret]3727-the hill beneath her moved as if it were alive .

" Manslaughter , "[258-charles] repeated [Mr. Wilcox]258-charles . " [Charles]258-charles may go to [prison]6023-prison . [I]258-charles dare not tell [him]258-charles . [I]258-charles don t know what to do -- what to do . [I]258-charles m broken -- [I]258-charles m ended . "[258-charles]

No sudden warmth arose in [her]255-margaret . [She]255-margaret did not see that to break [him]258-charles was [her]255-margaret only hope . [Charles]258-charles was committed for trial . It was against all reason that [he]258-charles should be punished , but the law , notwithstanding , sentenced [him]258-charles to three years imprisonment . Then [[Henry]355-henry s fortress]3729-henry s fortress gave way . [He]355-henry could bear [no one]633-no one but [[his]355-henry wife]1358-his wife ; [he]355-henry shambled up to [Margaret]255-margaret afterwards and asked [her]255-margaret to do what [she]255-margaret could with [him]355-henry . [She]255-margaret did what seemed easiest -- [she]255-margaret took [him]355-henry down to recruit at [Howards End]1-howards end .

CHAPTER XLIV

[Tom s father]3732-tom s father was cutting [the big meadow]3733-the big meadow . Fourteen months had passed , but [Margaret]255-margaret still stopped at [Howards End]1-howards end . No better plan had occurred to [her]254-helen . [The meadow]3817-the meadow was being recut , the great red poppies were reopening in [the garden]3800-the garden . July would follow with the little red poppies among the wheat , August with the cutting of the wheat . These little events would become part of [her]254-helen year after year . Every summer [she]254-helen would fear lest the well should give out , every winter lest the pipes should freeze ; every westerly gale might blow the wych - elm down and bring the end of all things , and so [she]254-helen could not read or talk during a westerly gale . The air was tranquil now . [She]254-helen and [[her]254-helen sister]544-her sister were sitting on the remains of [Evie]262-evie s rockery , where the lawn merged into [the field]3735-the field .

" What a time [they]3741-they all are ! "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen . " What can [they]3741-they be doing inside ? "[255-margaret] [Margaret]255-margaret , who was growing less talkative , made no answer . The noise of the cutter came intermittently , like the breaking of waves . " [I]254-helen wish [Henry]355-henry was out to enjoy this , "[254-helen] said [Helen]254-helen . " This lovely weather and to be shut up in [the house]3796-the house ! It s very hard . "[254-helen]

" Usen t ! "[255-margaret] [She]255-margaret lowered [her]255-margaret eyes a moment to the black abyss of the past . [Leonard]311-leonard was dead ; [Charles]258-charles had two years more in [prison]6023-prison . [One]3797-one usen t always to see clearly before that time . It was different now .

" [I]254-helen like [Henry]355-henry because [he]355-henry does worry . "[254-helen]

[Helen]254-helen sighed . [She]254-helen seemed humiliated , and buried [her]254-helen face in [her]254-helen hands . After a time [she]254-helen said : " About love , "[254-helen] a transition less abrupt than it appeared .

[Margaret]255-margaret never stopped working .

" [I]254-helen mean [a woman]1045-a woman s love for [a man]569-a man . " Yes , [I]3760-clumsy of movement did . "[3760-clumsy of movement]

[Mrs. Wilcox]512-mrs. wilcox gave a little cry of annoyance . [[Her]512-mrs. wilcox husband]1134-her husband was lying in a great leather chair in [the dining - room]3978-the dining - room , and by [his]1134-her husband side , holding [his]1134-her husband hand rather ostentatiously , was [Evie]262-evie . [Dolly]3765-dolly , dressed in purple , sat near the window . [The room]1100-the room was a little dark and airless ; [they]3767-they were obliged to keep it like this until the carting of the hay . [Margaret]255-margaret joined [the family]1117-the family without speaking ; the five of [them]1117-the family had met already at tea , and [she]255-margaret knew quite well what was going to be said . Averse to wasting [her]255-margaret time , [she]255-margaret went on sewing . The clock struck six .

" Is this going to suit [everyone]6062-everyone ? "[355-henry] said [Henry]355-henry in a weary voice . [He]355-henry used the old phrases , but their effect was unexpected and shadowy . " Because [I]355-henry don t want [you]1117-the family all coming here later on and complaining that [I]355-henry have been unfair . "[355-henry]

[Paul]256-paul frowned ill - temperedly , and began scratching at [his]256-paul arm . [Margaret]255-margaret did not answer . There was something uncanny in [her]255-margaret triumph . [She]255-margaret , who had never expected to conquer [anyone]3706-anyone , had charged straight through [these Wilcoxes]3887-these wilcoxes and broken up [their]3887-these wilcoxes lives .

[Paul]256-paul rose to [his]256-paul feet . [He]256-paul was accustomed to natives , and a very little shook [him]256-paul out of [the Englishman]542-the englishman . "[1134-her husband]
